text:
I could not find a pelican there today. At least not the rusty pelican. But if I sit long enough and I will become one since the view is nice and make you feel relax and still. I can be one. 

This water front property has the killer bay view for the people who dine there. I would said it has nice sunset view. Price range is at high side for the food. The interior is well decorated. The dinning hall has the bay view. They have ball room can easily fit 200 people with bay east view. 

I was here for a society meeting. We was done in this ballroom that is beautiful for wedding. Our entrée is not in the regular menu. It is shell pasta with stuff cheese in side. It accompanied with green beans and carrots. The food is good. This place is good with seafood and steak. 

The service is good and attentive. Overall the welcoming host and restaurant do a good job.

Cafe style. I have the take out all the time. This place have all kind Spanish food from fried whole fish to teriyaki chicken. They gave selection of small or big plate. Range from $4 to $6.50. 

They also have devil crab, chicken or ground beef empanadas, stuff potato. They also have freshly make Cuban sandwich. 

Compare to fast food change, cafeteria style is a better option. I always come here for for the guarapole ( sugar cane juice). They prepare the fresh squeeze on the site. It is good. 

Please be aware the lunch crowd build up after 11:30 am. Please come early. If you come after 11:30 am, the line is already to the door. Friday night, music and fun is happen here. People gather after work for music.

Very establish bar. Every weekend is party at the front porch. People are gathering on the outside and have a good time with a boo. Independent has it character of the neighborhood bar. Very lively there. 

We were there for the Nate Najar Quartet jazz music. This jazz team is well known in the Bay Area. Our share table has some people from St. Pete came here just for this night. This bar has many musicians performed here before. This is my first time to Independent and I like it due to their crazy bar tender. Nothing better to sat at the bar and see all the drink fly out from the bar. Sometimes you can chat to your neighbor and enjoy the music. I like it not too loud but the music is still can be appreciated. 

They have some of bar food and good selection of local draft beers. I like it they post the percentage of the content of alcohol. You can know your limits when you order it if you have to drive home.

This all you can eat sushi place is a lot better than the one they have in Carrollwood. Tastes, ingredients preparation, mix of rice are better. I would said lunch has the best value here. 

We arrive on the early and seating is not a problem at week end. Through out the meal time, we still can see some seating is available on lunch. 

We have order the spicy tuna, rainbow, saki, Mexican rolls. The sushi includes escolar, surf clam, salmon. We also order some items from habachi and stir fried. 

The roll I like is the Fuji roll. It has spicy tuna and top with salmon and drizzle with eel sauce. The steak and shrimp hibachi is my favorite on the cook side. I also like the appetizer as Gyoza and the dessert with fried banana with chocolate dip. 

Overall the service is great. The food is attractive. The serving speed is acceptable.

Before catching the flight, we like to have a catfish dinner. This restaurant locates 5 minutes from the airport. As a result you can time your meal before the flight. 

The restaurant is affordable compare to any seafood restaurant in New Orleans. We have order a dozen of raw oysters and they are only $8. It came with reddish and cocktail sauce. The oysters are fresh and big. 

The main course is the blacken catfish with Creole sauce with rice.  The catfish in New Orleans is great no matter which restaurant we went to. This restaurant also has the good catfish. I like the Creole sauce with smaller size shrimp in tomato base sauce. 

The second dish is grilled tuna skew over rice Creole sauce. The tuna is assembling in the skew along with shrimp, onion, and bell pepper. The tuna is lightly season and grilled open flame. The shrimp along the skew is not as fresh as the tuna. The dish presentation is impressive with skew bridge over the Creole rice. 

The service is good. The restaurant may need to renovate to newer furniture. I saw a lot of the local eat here due to good pricing.

Tonight is happy night to see my pal. Over the weekend I was able to meet up with Anna. But today I am meeting with three yelpiest friends to try the 7 course beef dish from my last review. 

I have seven beef dishes on other Vietnamese restaurant before. The first course is the raw slice beef in the vinegar onion broil. Then beef is wrapping in rice paper with veggie. The sauce inside the wrap can be hoisin sauce and dip it on the fish sauce.

The second course is herb marinated slice beef to be cooked in butter. Then it is wrapping with rice paper with vermicelli. The third course is the slice beef in peanut. The first three courses require some work to wrap it. Some is skill with the wrap. The trick is not to over fill with material. 

The fourth course is the ground beef in tea leave. The ground beef is marinated then grill on the frying pan. The fifth course is the beef balls with shrimp chip. The beef ball is cook with clear vermicelli. This ball can be break into pieces and pickup with the shrimp chip. With the crispy of the shrimp chip and ground beef, it create the sensation of the crispy and meat flavor. The sixth course is the Sherrard beef with porridge. It top with some fried onion and the parsley. By mixing it provide some mixture of the flavor. The seventh course is the slice pork on the outwardly roll around the raw green onion. The slice beef is marinated and grilled outwardly. This course can be improved if they caramel the onion first before the slice beefs rolling will be better. It will take away the onion spiciness. 

Overall the food is good but challenge. It is a good meal to have when your group likes to have the long and good conversation. It will take time to finish. The two people for the seven courses are $35 and the 3 people are $45.

This is a restaurant when I travel and having coworker or boss with me. Chain restaurant is an easy obvious choice for the agreement of the selection. We were here for lunch and it is Wednesday. 

Wednesday in any outback have special in their menu. I have tried their $12 three course menu. The first course is the Caesar salad. The lettuce is fresh and crispy. My entree is the glaze grilled pork tenderloin with a size. I have chosen the grilled asparagus as my side and I have added an up charge item shrimp in the Barbie. The pork was grilled wonderfully with tender meat. Each cut of the pork has preserved their juice in each piece. The shrimp is grilled and maintain the size of the shrimp. Seasoning is well prepared in this case. The tomatoes are cut to half and well cook for mouth watering enjoyment. The asparagus is not dry after grilling.  Good technique. 

The third course is the carrot cake. The sweetness is well mix that not loses the ingredient taste of the carrot. This is the restaurant that I have repeated when I am go to Bartow or Orlando and need the meal before meeting. Wednesday is always the best day since they have good deal for the three courses or four courses.

This restaurant is recommended by my client. He grew up from Puerto Rico and he has indicated the food is close to his mom cooking. The Spanish music play in the background with lively atmosphere. 

This the first time I try Puerto Rican restaurant in USA. I have Puerto Rico cuisine at Puerto Rico before. I can said the restaurant at La Casona has interesting Puerto Rican menu. It include traditional Mofongo. Mofongo is a fried plantain-based dish from Puerto Rico. It is typically made with fried green plantains mashed together in a with broth, garlic, bit fried pork belly. It can be filled with vegetable, meat or seafood. This restaurant open since 1999. It have Spanish base customer. 

Today we have the seafood Mofongo and churrasco. The seafood Mofongo came with half of the lobster tail, shrimp, salty fish, muscle.  I was impress of my Mofongo serve with a bit wine base seafood broth. When you bite the olive they have cook with it, the wine juice came out and it is tasty and left wine fragrant in the mouth. This normally different than the Wikipedia description to prepare it. The broth base mix with the fried green plantain neutralize the salty of the broth. The two materials balance each other is the beauty of cooking. Good chef skill. The churrasco is ok. It can be better. Churrasco is Argentina food. Most of the time the Cuban restaurant prepare this dish better than anyone in Miami. You have choice with rice and bean or salad and sweet plantain. 

The service is good and friendly. However, the close out and bring the check is slow. This restaurant customer tender to speak louder due the natural of the Spanish customer. Food is good portion. Most of time you will have enough to take home for the remained meal.

I am here because of Johnathan review that they really put out a good Thai Hot restaurant. There is no hold back. So if you ask for spicy, watch out. There is no American Hot.

The restaurant has good ratings. The interior is open seating hall that most efficiently for maximum seats. The owner pay attention to the customers. And the wait staff is alert enough. They have extensive menu for your choice.

We got the Drunken Noodle and the Lad Na Noodle.  The drunken noodle is a bit wet. I like it dryer. But they did a Thai Hot for me. The spicy of the chili extended to my throats. The spiciness stay at my mount at least good 7 minutes. The Lad Na noodle is crispy noodle with beef. Food is good. We also got the stuff chicken wing. This is a dish that not normally serve. This actually the best dish. Like the staffing with pork.

Mei World Pizza has pizza and something that you not imagine they have it - The Taiwanese cuisine. I was able to take picture of the whole Chinese menu for the patrons who look forward what they are cooking. They are very flexible and they can cook to your order - meaning not in the menu. 

Mei World Pizza has another name in Chinese. The beautiful food World. Which mean the great food of the world. The specialty include noodle that is home made by hand from the kitchen. These noodles are not buying from grocery store. As a result, it creates the specialty of the restaurant with the fresh made noodle. Every Saturday weekend has fresh made dumpling. They are not frozen. They will made and cook at the spot. In winter, they cure their own meat and sell it on the February, March and April.  During that time you find the cure meat food that is not in the menu. 

The secret is out. Go enjoy the beautiful bowl of soup noodle or have them cook a special cuisine for you. I will be back to try their different food.

I grew up with Nestle coffee in my home. This is rather a memory for me when I am young. Nestle products always is my favorite before the wold has Starbucks. I am still go for my number one choice the Nestle coffee mix with red tea and milk in ice. 

The Nestle Toll House offer many food items. It include hot item like flat bread, paninis, wrap, quesadilla. The cold treat includes ice cream scoop, real fruit smoothie, ice cream sandwich, and other frozen treat. They have hot coffee like latte, white mocha, turtle mocha, and more. The cold coffee includes mocha frappe, butterfingers frappe and more. Come to check it up. 

This store just open not long ago. They big floor space. I hope they can add some table and chair in the store for the customer who need a treat. A hand wash station will be nice when the customer get their hand sticky. The coffee utensils station may need to be bigger to handle more customers at one time. 

I have a dulce leche ice cream sandwich with macadamia nut cookie. It is delicious. I will be back to try other products. When you come to the Tampa Premium Outlet, please check them up.

Marble Slab or Maggie Moos are the same company. We use to have a Maggie Moos near our neighborhood then it was close. They are the few ice cream chain who started mix the ice cream on top of the frozen marble. First select your ice cream, then select your so call topping. They will mixed the ice cream with select topping into your ice cream. It is kind cool. 

The price is base on the cup size. It doesn't matter how many flavor you want, as long as it can fit in the cup. This time I have the rum and cotton candy flavor. Instead of mixed the toppings into the ice cream, I have requested just sprinkle on top of the ice cream. I like their cotton candy flavor. It has very great taste. There was non other ice cream store have this cotton candy flavor. It was very hard to describe. I have so many of the cotton candy flavor, this is the best. 

The clerk is friendly. The ice cream can be sample before you have decided.

Auntie Anne's provide quick and easy outlet for little munchkin. Every time I past by the Auntie Anne, they are doing something. One time they spinning the pretzel dough, this time they butter the bun and dipped in the cinnamon sugar. 

I was here for a thirsty drink. They have the old fashioned lemonade and the combination lemonade with added strawberry ice drink. I am traditional guy, so go with the old fashioned lemonade. 

The service is friendly. In the making of their bread, the bread smell in oven flow out and did trigger your thoughts of food.

I am not a coffee person since the caffeine do nothing to keep me awake. Basically the coffee is just the pleasure drink. I wanted to try this place since our CM podcast interview with the owner. They have good wide space in this coffee shop. It is also in historical district of YBOR. 

They have coffee brewing class. If you use Yelp check in, they will have the 50% of the class. Every season they have special coffee features. For summer there are features the ice coffee, and same for the winter they reverse to hot coffee. Somethings for everyone. 

Today I have the Dirty Thai Jer. It is the Thai tea with condense milk, two shots of espresso. It is interesting drink. The wait for the mix is quick since not many people drink coffee after 7:30 pm. This coffee is concentrated with good enough tea. In Asia call it yin yang.

This supermarket is doing the customers attraction sales right since it is just open. They are many sales items make people visit this place many time during the opening week. Price is the lowest in the area for many items in the area. Please go before the honeymoon period is over. 

I was reading many reviews indicated this place like a zoo. We were there during the Oscar Red carpet show. There is no crowd and easy access. This prove many of the shoppers are ladies who love Oscar:)

The supermarket has many to offer. Hot deli, fresh make pie and bakery, juice up. Because of the current promotion and pricing, I could not really rate this store. The promotion price are low as a result the material which tie to price is very acceptable now. What happened the full pricing in motion will be determined at later review.

The revisits of the burger joint by select the different items in the menu make me feel they are better choice. I would suggest not go for the shave prime rib, Atlantic code, or onion ring. These are the items I am not recommended. Go for the burger. 

Since we have sign up for the e-club. They have given us a coupon of but one get one free value basket. We have order the double cheese burger with bacon. We have up the cost from our value basket to a strawberry shake and curb cheese ball. The up charge is only $1.60. Our total price for two burgers and the upgrade side is less than $11 with coupon. Talking about the saving, this is a good value. The burger patty is ground beef smash into thinner piece and over hot plate grill top. The meat is seared to crispy since they are thin. As a result, the burger is great on taste. Because the patty is so thin, you may wonder when you have order double and it look like single. 

Please sign their mailing list and you can receive the coupon. Great services have put them in the 4 star. They are people constant check on you and take away the trash from your table.

When we first visited the Ice Centre, we know there is a restaurant going to be open in the Centre. It take them a year for this restaurant to be open. When we know about the news for opening this month, we decided to stop by and check. I also invite couple of Yelp friends to join us. 

Judging the price of the menu, it is about 10% more than regular restaurant. However we were no regrets that because the food measured up with the price we paid. It still has some bump to iron out, our waitress is still don't know which beer is happy hours. They offer happy hours item from 4 pm to 7 pm Monday to Friday. The app is 25% off from the pregame section. The draft beer is $2 off. 

We started with Ybor egg roll. It has mojo pork, ham and salami wrap together. Who can resist it. I also get the tuna bowl. It seared blacken Ahi tuna over rice and Asian slaw. It has the honey soy ginger sauce. It was quite good. Lastly we have the Top Shelf wings. This is must have item. It is about $0.20 more than normal outside restaurant wing place. However, it worth the money. This wing is marinated in mojo sauce, then grill over the open flame and top with the house sauce. It was delicious. 

Overall is good experience. The place has TV. But who actually watched it when you can see live hockey from the high school competition. Love the game, love the food.

Very prominent sushi place for the purpose of small night snack. Unfortunately during pandemic, they still don't allow dine in. I would definitely like to do that. I like this sushi place because the restaurant is good for late night snack with sake or beer. 

The food is affordable and the takeout is busy. The walk in order take about 15 minutes to prepare. We wait at the car and they deliver to your car. I got the goyoza, spicy tuna, and unagi eel. The roll at medium size. The spicy tuna with good ahi. The flavors good. The goyoza also crispy. Great snack for the night. The unagi has enough eel sauce to sweet it up. 

Overall my experience for the take is great. I will like to visit them at night when they start the dine in again.

Rare Ethnic food 3 - Salvadoran cuisine. It is located in the Latin area of MLK. The most recognize item is pupusa. Pupusa Loca is a corn tortilla wrap with cheese, ground mix meat, refried bean. This restaurant serve this dish for $4 and come with stir fry cabbage. Very good dish. 

I have the churrasco with rice, veggie and salsa. Their churrasco is thin cut and grilled. Top with lemon juice. A bit sour. The meat is not the best of skirt steak but it is good enough. I like it a bit burn end on the meat to make it tasty. 

We have the tamal salvadoreno. It is Salvadoran tamale. This tamale is bean base. 

What impress me is the drink. I have order the cashew drink-maranon. This is the first time I have this drink. It smell very good and help on the thirst. 

The service is average.

It is about 3.5 stars, not a four stars. Some of the original items in the restaurant opening was removed due to lack of interest. Especially the fish cheek. This Ichicoro has the best layout. I like it partition to many room. At least they have chair with back support. 

We started with the chicken karaage and GYU Bao. I like coating and the sauce of the Karaage. It is delicious. But the GYU Bao is just below average. The meat of the GYU is just not feel it.  

We also has the GYU yakitori. I like this one better. The meat is well marinated. The quantity of the skew is tiny. Can be larger. We have the Tako Amiyaki. This grilled octopus dish is a mush have. Very delicious. Our final dish is the Tekkadon. The tuna poke on the rice. Good amount of food. The rice seasoning is great. 

The service is good. The price for the food is at the high side. The quantity need to be more.

Thai 5 is certainly match the top 100 of Yelp list that just recent published. Their kitchen is still in the food truck. I have seen the previous food truck move out this location and become a restaurant. I believe one day they will too. 

We have order the Tom Yum Soup. I would say this is the best I have taste. For this restaurant medium hot is too hot for many people. For me is just right. This restaurant definition of hotness is bring the heat. So be careful what you asking for. You may have difficult time to kiss your date after burning lip and past the caliente heat kiss to you love one. 

We have order the crab fried rice and duck noodle soup. I have order the Thai hot and it came with it. I like it very much for this fried rice since it is different than other cuisine fried rice. The dish do have chunk of crab meat. The duck noodle is street type vendor flavor cooking. The duck is deboned and easy to enjoy. The curry base soup is yummy to eat. 

I give them 4 stars is they pricing is in the high side for food truck (value vs. restaurant setting) and they run out of material for certain dish. The food is 5 stars.

Place is new and clean in the neighborhood. Restroom also clean to use. We stop here after pumping my gas station next door. The Dunkin is connected to plaza. Easy access fro US 301. Their coffee was on sales that day. We walk on the right time. 

I have blueberry coolata. It is a bit sour but bearable. Is is sweeter will be nice. I like it to be refreshing. My wife have coffee with hazelnut flavor. It is also good enough for just a fraction of price.

Gas today 1-14-2015 is $1.85. I have went inside the store but has not buy anything yet. The whole facilities is less than one month old. This is not the biggest Wawa like the one that next to the Hard Rock Casino. However, due to the newly open Wawa, they are running low gas price. If you happen to pass by I-275 and Bearss check out the northeast corner for Wawa. The price war for the new Wawa properly run for another month.

I think their quality is dropping compared to my previous visit. Since they open the new store at St. Pete., the taste of the food drop. May be now they move their best cook to the new location. The meat is not as tastier. The shrimp taco is just above average. I would rather they burn a bit outwardly. 

Price also more expensive than my last visit. I think my fantasy of the first place on the join has move to other taco place.

Great jerk food. Fist one at New Tampa Area. I have read many reviews indicating this place is slow, as result, I came here at 11:15 am before everyone showed up. I was the second in line and the food is not much of wait. During 12 noon, I can see the line building up. May be that is the reason why most reviews don't like wait. 

I got Jamaican traditional dish. The Ackee and Salt fish. The Ackee is fruit from West Africa. And now is widely planted in Jamaica. This dish is Jamaica National dish. The salt fish was clean an diluted with water before add into it. This dish is $17. 

Our second dish is the fried chicken. I like this dish very much. They have great coating outside. It is like some curry or cumin. It come with rice and plantain. I would recommend this dish. It is lunch special. Good deal. 

Our experience is great here. Definitely go for the oxtail. It has great flavor when we ask for the gravy for the fried chicken.

This restaurant is open space bar near airport. It is also next to strip club. As a result their operated hour to late night or early morning. It is good place for snack or late supper. 

We were here at their happy hours. The appetizers selection is decent. The price also decent. We started with old forester bourbon. I have it straight. The first appetizer is the Hellcat Wing. The wing was fried with choice of dipping sauce. The second app is the chicken and waffle slider. The fried chicken has good coating. The waffle need some work. The third app is the wildcat shrimp. I recommend this dish with good shrimp. The fourth app is munition mussel. I like they way prepared the sauce in the mussels. It is decent. Out last app is the prime rib slider. This dish I also recommend. The prime rib was well prepared. 

Overall our visit is positive. Very close to 4.5 stars. Definitely worth a visit. Service is good.

This Froyo- frozen yogurt - is intriguing. If you are for that, they have the many flavors of frozen yogurt. It includes many toppings such as fresh fruit and candy. They also has smoothies with fresh fruit. 

There is one item you may want to try if you have not. It is yogurt Thai tea popping. I have the Thai tea mixed with regular yogurt. Then bottom with the mango popping. It is like Thai tea smoothies with boba. It is interesting to try.

This fresh market is nice and clean. I like the most are the ready to eat food by pound. It make life a lot easy. When you walk in, it is timber like covering floor which make shopping like home. The first section is flower just reminds you do you have love one to buy the flowers for love or forgiveness. 

The ready to eat food just need to reheat or simply eat them. These food included scampi shrimp, preassemble sandwich, Korean salmon, and more. I like the coffee bean by weight. The wine selection is a bit less choice but good enough for the evening. 

Pastry is freshly made for your pickups. Many organic item in the fresh produce includes the veggies. The aisle is wide enough to maneuver your card. Most of the cart is a lot smaller with two layer of container.

Keke's new location at USF area is less than 1 year new. We been want to visit for some time. Parking is very convenient. The line for weekend breakfast is not bad. At 8:20 am, there was no line at all. Lighting design and space is very welcoming with bright to see your food. 

We got Pina Colada with egg and bacon. The piña colada French Toast is French Toast stuff with pineapple, cream and spread with powder sugar and coconut flake. The food presentation is very nice. Colorful. The bacon is thick enough with good quality. The sunny side up egg was cook to order. Food is delicious. 

The food is a bit pricey. But it does show the potential for good food. Service definitely excellent in this place. The waiter is knowledgeable to recommend a dish.

A very nice contemporary setup restaurant for Peruvian cuisine. It is kind of hidden in the plaza. Dinner has table cloth service may be good for romantic night. They have good appetizers and deserts for your selection. 

This is our second restaurant stop of the night. It is after the swing dance class and we are ready for quick nibble. But when we saw the menu, we decided to try two app and one entrée. We started with famous Peruvian grill beef heart. It serve with Peruvian soft corn and roasted potatoes. The beef heart was not over cook or become too fiber with too much heat. This is good dish with good chef technique.

The second app is the grilled octopus medallion. The octopus tentacles was slice and grilled. It come with Chimichurri sauce and creamy garlic sauce. I never have the tentacles grilled this way. However, I think it is clever of the chef do that way. 

Our entrée bear the name of the restaurant which is the paella with seafood and chicken, beef and sausage. This is good to share. 

Our night turn out well with good service and the food is good.

We have a take home for the meal. The food here is very affordable. The amount of food given is also good. It is cafeteria style food with sandwiches for order. 

We have the white rice, roast pork, gizzards, yucca, and sweet plantain. All that for less than $14. The roast pork is well marinated. The skin is crispy and crunchy. The gizzards are cook in tomato base sauce and the cook for some time. They are soft and not chewy. Bite size pleasure. The yucca is not my favorite food unless it is fried. But the steam yucca is my wife favorite. Plantain is well cook. 

Overall the experience is not bad. We also has some crocket which is tasty.

This is a licensed Japanese chef with the diploma on sushi. You can see a truly train chef knife skill is different than non actual train chef. Raj piece of fish is carefully sliced. Rice is make from the palm of hand. They have typical roll but I would encourage you go for the nigiri. 

Ask for what they carry not in the menu. That will surprise you of their selection of the day. I have order two torch salmon and yellow tails. This item requires a bit time to marinated before torch with open flame. The fish cut is large pieces in comparison to many sushi places. I like he pay attention to the detail. 

I also have sea urchin and the sea bass nigiri. This is good pieces. I like their freshness of the fish and good quality. I also has the spicy tuna which consider good flavor. 

Overall experience is good in compare to many Japanese restaurants here.

This restaurant is actually part of bigger franchise in the nation. They are located in the major cities. Tampa was lucky enough to have one. It was easy to locate Tampa restaurant because it is just not too far from the highway.

I think they have tone down the Indian spice here. They more gear to American taste. The restaurant is busy. It has some dishes worth for a try. We got the Shrimp Manchuria for start. It has marinated in coating them deep fried. Lastly stir fry the chili sauce with onion and bell peppers. It has 5 to 6 large shrimps. Good appetizer dish. 

Our main dish are the Lamb Boti Tikka. This is cube lamb marinated in spice, yogurt, garlic and ginger. This lamb grilled in tandoor oven. I usually has the tandoori chicken. But tandoori lamb is the first. Or second dish is the Gongura Chicken with high nutrition leave and spice. This is one of traditional dish. This not typical American Indian red curry. The color is dark green. 

The only complaint about the restaurant is the rice come very late after the main dish was set on the table. I don't know they try to have you eat the main dish first so you won't ask for too much rice. Curry dish need to go with rice. Although is not intentionally but execution need to be corrected.

Via Italia has street food in Italy. Mainly the the pizza by the slice. They display their gourmet pizza behind the counter, you just need to point and pick the one you like. The pizza look good. They also has entire menu with pizza. The crush flour includes white, multigrain, and gluten free. All these pizzas are wood fired. At their vegan section including a impossible meatball. It is something. 

We started our lunch with the Le Bruschette. It is bread with prosciutto, arugula and fig jam. The prosciutto was great and the fig jam accompanied well. Our second dish is the Cavatelli Con Brocolli E Salsiccia - sweet Italian sausage and broccolini pasta. This dish is just good. The last dish is the Spaghetti Con Zucchini E Gamberetti. It is sun dried tomatoes with shrimp. The shrimp is big enough. I changed the spaghetti to Pena pasta. 

Our dessert is the dessert is the rum corn bread. I thing the corn bread can be softer. But the rum was good. Service is good. Food has fresh ingredients.

It neighborhood support ice cream joint. Just across the library. This ice cream place established since 1958. Very old store. You can tell they are very successful with many come to visit. It is a dairy joy to people here like it's name. 

I got the vanilla dip cone with butterscotch. Only few ice cream place has dip cone. This is one of them. The banana split here look very good. One day I will try it. The small cone we have is good quantity of the soft serve. They have good technique to swirl it up higher. Keep up the good work which attracts people here.

I have been to many 4 river smoke house. I also been to their original smoke house that was replace with newer building in the Fairbanks Ave, Winter Park. No many can said that. I like several thing they have served. Santa Maria Tri Tip and Brisket is the two I like the most. Not to mention their bacon wrap jalapeno chees fill is my favorite too. 

The South Tampa store is my first visit. I have only try their classic brisket and burn end sandwich. We walk at 5:45 pm Tuesday and there was no line. By the time we finish our sandwich, long line was there. I have ask my brisket moist and it definitely is the best piece. I love the brisket with a little fat and tender moist. My wife burn end taste like beef jerky. I think this recipes need some improvement. 

The setting and dining hall is a sense of community dining. They have the hand washing station next to the soft drink station which make easy for the patron who finish the food and wash the hand. Great addition. This location is better than the Carrolwood store in term of grill technique.

This restaurant has the seven beef courses for $35 for two and $45 for three. We did not go for it since I want to eat light tonight. Their seven beef course is probably cheaper in Bay Area. 

Tonight we have order a grilled quail for appetizer, combination beef pho and the Hu Tieu Nam Vang noodle soup. I have try many restaurant grilled quail, each one have their differences. This restaurant added a sweet sauce on top make it very nice and juicy. I like it when the hot sweet sauce eventually cooks the lettuce below and it is great to eat it.

The pho is average in the Bay Area. I like the rare slice beef when they cook it. In Canada, they have the rare beef on the side for you to add. This is better since you don't want it to overcook. Unfortunately none of the Bay Area Vietnamese restaurants have prepared this way. The Hu Tieu Nam Vang is noddle soup with clear both with fried garlic base. I like they add the liver, quail egg, shrimp, squid and ground pork into the soup. This is a good soup when you are sick. 

Overall the restaurant is busy. The service is average; the waitresses are able to speak English. Food quality is great. I like the grilled quail here. The rainbow drink is with ice cube instead of shave ice. I prefer shave ice.

This is my go to wine store. It is located off interstate 275 and easy for me to pick up a bottle or two. Especially they have coupon send to me for discounts. The only negative thing is the left turn off Dale Mabry to plaza alway has a line for the car to turn into due to busy plaza. 

I can said that I am wine person but specific way. I like the Pinot noir particularly. Especially the Russian River Valley (RRV) Pinot Noir is my region. Not all year grape is good but most Year is above average in that region. I always try every Pinot Noir. I like Lost Canyon, La Crema, River Road Stephanie, Deloach - roughly $20 to $40 a bottle. The total wine has this option and many other too. 

The check out alway easy. If you have to many bottles, ask for box with slot to carry so it do not damage during transfer.

Must be a poke love explosion. We have seen so many lately. This one will be the first few at Wesley Chapel. Island Fin has found love by the local community. I would said they are just a bit above the  average poke restaurant for the reason they are generous on the topping.

I choose the protein as tuna and octopus. They mixed the mixed in and the protein with the sauce. Which is good and make it flavorful. If they have sesame oil will be better. Not all the mixed in are included. Some has up charge. The time we have visited, the people who have the mixer is a bit heavy on sauce. 

The other thing like it here is their dole whip with mango and pineapple soft serve. It is delicious. I thing this will bring them to the top. This unique soft serve is the first in Bay Area.

This food chain is found by Tampa Metropolitan Ministry. They train the homeless to be self sufficient and transitioning out from homeless. Any bit contributions or buy the food is for the greater good. My review for the food stand is not because of the charitable contributions they have. Just the food and service. 

They are a unique sandwich store. My friend order a porchetta and it look really good. So I order one for myself. I search what is porchetta. It can be done many way. Some has the Pork Belly outwardly and pork lion inward. This store probably use only pork lion when I saw they display the porchetta. Nonetheless, they are delicious. For the sandwich alone, it is five stars. The melted cheese, the crust edge, and the veggies was perfect harmony. I also like their home made pickle cucumber. 

The only thing is my dish missing a chip while friend has it. The wait can be improved if they can text us if the food is ready when this is giant food court.

Rare Ethnic Food 10

We have select the Creative Loafing Restaurant night to gather some Yelp friends after a long trip away from Tampa. We have try many Mexican restaurant and never list them as rare ethnic food because it is common in Tampa. Why this restaurant is listed. It because they use the St. Miguel Cuisine. 

The restaurant ground their sauce from raw Ingredients. That the reason they are unique than many Mexican restaurant. Their selection margaritas are huge. Especially the gold tequila is a long list. I have Besito Patron Margarita with pomegranate juice. Nice touch. 

Our appetizer is Flautas De Pollo. It has two different sauce over it. Ok tasting. I have the Enchiladas mixtas. It mix meat type of enchiladas. Our dessert is chocolate cake. Overall is good. 

At the end of the day, each of us got the Mexican doll for take home. Good service.

It is good German cuisine restaurant. Considering this area is a popular restaurant. During this time, it is just like October fest. Many love to sit outside like beer garden. In the good weather, you may need to come early if you want to sit outside. The restaurant serve German food and gyro. Interesting. The chef can handle two types of food. 

We got the Jagerschnitzel. It is breaded pounded pork gravy with mushroom and bacon. The side is potatoes salad. This dish is good when you are hungry. Love the coating flavor on the pork. We also get the Doener Bowl. It is shave lamb with rice and one special sauce. This dish we added a knockwurst with sauerkraut and falafel, the wurst is good and brown finish outwardly. Falafel also tasty. 

Overall the food is good. Good thing we arrived before the big crowd. They only has one waitress. With their business they may need two. Many come here for the beer.

This Venezuelan food here is almost like street food. The cooking is very authentic. This is mom and pop store with good chef. It has special of the day you may want to try, because it is not on the regular menu. The Hispanic Society often order food here to feed their group.

We saw they have special tamale on today special. It look good and very affordable. However, we did not go for it. We have order the Asado Negro. This is a roasted black beef serve over white rice and fried sweet plantains. I have never have the black beef before. It sauce is black and interesting. It is well accommodated with the rice. The plantain was well prepare and are not black and over fried. We also order the soup of the day. It has a lot of thing inside. It has some tendon and potato and other veggie. The soup semi clear but very good. The dish also include a side salad and arepa. It go well with the soup.

I am surprise that the restaurant is kind of empty. The food is good and the price is very affordable include dinner time. We added sweet pineapple flan. It was delicious. The close up is good and the service is good.

Authentic Cuisine #69 -  Guyanese Cuisine 

This grocery store has an kitchen who serve West Indian with Guyanese cuisine. It is interesting to see the curry is a touch different than most. I have been book mark this place for years, finally I was able to visit one of my 1700 bookmarks. I like grocery setup. But I like their bakery and the food they provided. 

Bakery 
I got the the pine tart. This tart is pineapple filling with good crust. I also got the the curry chicken and jerk chicken pastry. Both of them is good. Especially the the jerk chicken pastry. 

Food
We start with the Pholourie. This Guyana snack food is a fried dough with tamarind sauce. Very interesting. It is popular item and only available Saturday. We also got the Doubles. This is a street food that serve there. For me is ok. We got the chicken chow mein. The fried noodle is good but I prefer Chinese fried noodle. The chicken was marinated with good sauce. A bit dried. The last dish is the goat curry. I like this the best. It come with dhal puri which is Indian bread with split pea stuff inside. 

Our experience here is good. The price is reasonable. Love to try different item in the bakery and food in the future.

Plato meaning dish or plate in Spanish. The name of the restaurant is perfectly named. The Latino Dish. It identified the the cuisine immediately if you know the meaning of the restaurant. 

This small restaurant get a lot of attention during lunch time. We were there 11:40am. The crowds start coming at 12:00 noon on weekdays. We have order the bistec and the pepper steak. The bistec is grilled steak with two choices of side. Since we have two dishes, we got the yellow rice, white rice and sweet plantain. The steak is a bit tough but is is good grilled steak. The pepper steak is cut into pieces and flat iron plate grilled. 

We like the devil crab which is not smell too fishy. It has full crab meat inside. They also have hot deli with ropa veja, roast pork and more. Food is affordable and service is order at the counter.

Great rich ice cream and many creative flavors for selection. This sum the store best thing can be found. The ice cream store located in the plaza close to T J Maxx. At night time in winter, they still get a lot customers. This tell me they have good regular customers   

Their flavor includes something you cannot  imagine. I got eggnog and rum raisin. The ice cream as they have advertised. Creamy. Not bad at all. They do have milkshakes and sundae available if you want to that route.

Brisket shoppe is open limited time only. Only Saturday they serve Dino Bone. Price is above average BBQ restaurants. However, they did use the good quality meat. 

We have the two different links of sausage and a few slice of brisket. The link sausage come with pickles cucumber, cube of cheese and slice of bread. This look like wine worthy dish. The brisket was slice with lean meat and slice edge fat. It is perfect. The seasoning is good. The meat is delicious due to slow hours BBQ. 

Overall the food is good. Seating only at the outside.

Little Lamb sounds very gentle like the Mary the Little Lamb song. However, the food speaks a loud volume. The food serve here is really good. Their website is still under construction to add more thing. 

They have small plate like pub food, salad, entrees and sweet stuff. We have order the Beef Tartare and the Grilled Market Fish. The beef Tartare are the tenderloin chop up. The food garnish with fried crunchy chips which I think is potato but a bit different taste since they are slice, marinated and fried. The Tartare has good taste. A bit salty. I like the garnish veggies, they are very good pickle. 

Our entrée is hamachi fish which I could not tell what kind. It top with fennel herb salad. Like this dish. Fish is premium grade. The salad is very creative. 

The reason is four star due to the wait is 30 minutes. But the food is good and the chef has some skill.

Rare Ethnic Cuisine No. 67 - Laotian Cuisine. 

Sap Sap just have Grand Open. My Yelp Friend Anna told me about this restaurant and we have try them at the second day of Grand Opening. This restaurant over take previously Vietnamese restaurant. Now it has Laotian cuisine. Time to have changed in this restaurant. 

They sold out the food first day and force them to open their restaurant at 1pm second day due new kitchen work for preparation the ingredients. I would said they are not smoothly open yet. Order, food delivery, and service are not really on track yet. Fortunately the taste is there. We waited our food for 1.1 hours. Obviously they mixed up our order. Service did get to us the beginning, was not check back later. These are the item they need to improve. One thing for sure my wife has said is to simplify the menu call out. It is difficult for the American to call out the Lao food name and it can be easily mixed up. 

We start with the chicken wings and the Laap Beef. The wing is really good coating. The laap beef has good spicy item. It is good spicy to me but my friend said is too hot for them. But the restaurant did offer to lower the spiciness at the end for my friend to take home. We also has the Thum Mua Sap Sap Style - it is the salad with vermicelli noodle, shrimp and the beef meat ball. It was delicious. I like the style. We also have the the Laotian sausage. I like this the most. The last dish is the homemade fried pork jerky. The pork is slice with marinated sesame seed. I like this dish too. 

Overall they need be on track. Need to simplify the order, need to improve the speed of food delivery. I give them a pass today since they are new restaurant.

Who can deny healthy food. It is best for your body, your mind, and your spirit. Fitlife food provide option for the ready to heat food and easy to use.

They have choices from breakfast, regular meal, to dessert. The meal including bison meat. I like steak Asada with the unique sauce to accompanied. I can eat two or three box. By the way, the box meal come small, medium or large. Price varies depend which dish you have selected. The selection include vegetarian or fruit.  They also have the gluten free items. 

The smaller box is roughly $7. I can see to use it for the night time snack compare to 6 chicken wings. You can design for your weight loss. For me, I am going for the taste. Thank for the chef demonstrate the cooking of the wild salmon with quinoa for the free sample. It was good taste.

Rumfish Grill is a huge investment for the restaurant. The restaurant is originally a conference room for the hotel. The ballroom or conference room is alternated to a restaurant later. When Tradewinds Island Resort bought this place, they think big to give a wow factor for the patron who eat there. They designed this restaurant with gigantic aquarium that enable people to swim on it and the outsider who not eat there can enjoy the view without walking into the restaurant. This multi million project make an impact to the customer who eat there. 

The lunch is consider affordable and good to eat here. We have order the creole BBQ shrimp and chargrilled oysters. The shrimp is fresh and jumpy. They top with nice creole sauce. The grilled oyster is top with Parmesan crust. Nice touch. Overall the service is real good. Food came out ok.

Please come to this restaurant a bit early at 11:00 am. You can enjoy the touch tank experience in the hotel before lunch. They have the sea creatures touch from 11:00 am to 12:00 noon

This food truck located in a low income neighborhood. They have an empty lot with food truck and the seating area. The circular driveway make it easy for access to the corner lot. There are plenty of space for parking. 

This food truck carry variety of menu. They have taco, burrito, tostada, Gorda, cheviche and more. It is typical street food from Mexico. I got five different tacos. I have steak, pastor, barbacoa, trips and buche de Pork. I like the most is barbacoa. It has the most marinated beef taste. All five tacos were big compared to many place. It is worth the money. For single person just 4 tacos is more than enough. 

The wait is about 10 minutes while they cook your food. They close at 10 pm which make it perfect for the night time snack. They seating area is big enough to host 4o people. They even has TV for entertainment while you eat there.

Food still good. However, the ventilation need improvement. I like to sit in the dining hall and smell the fried garlic. But the food smell stick to the clothing. So don't wear or bring any leather cloth or purses. The food smell will difficult to get rid off. 

We got the pollo ala romana and spaghetti grouper Mediterraneo. We did change the grouper dish from spaghetti to angel hair pasta. The skill for the pasta is very good. It has some form noodle bouncing but not too soft. My wife say the grouper is a bit fishy smell. The chicken dish come with vegetable medley and top with prosciutto. It is delicious. 

Overall the service is good. The food come out a bit slow. It take 30 minutes wait. In addition they need to improve the dining room ventilation. I would still give them 4 stars until next visit. If this not changed, I will lower the stars on next visit.

It is above 3.5 stars and a bit above average Bay Area poke restaurant. I like a few things about this poke place. Let talk about that. 

I like they mix the ingredients separately before put in the base. Which is an extra step than most poke place. By doing it the sauce is not mix in the base and have good flavor. Good going. The second is they have the sweet potatoes noodle as a base. It is delicious. They also has the premixed menu if you cannot build your own. It is good for those have no sense of using the cook sauce. 

Now about the negative side. The mixed only allowed 5 item. Which is now most poke place allow as many topping they have. I also don't like pick one sauce. It is too boring. I would suggest add some oil base sauce. It will help.

This old restaurant in Brandon has some character. I have visited this restaurant twice. One before COVID-19 and one during the epidemic. During the lock down of Bay Area, they have the roasted prime rib buy one get one free. Such a good deal. 

My writing of this review is before the pandemic. We arrive here before 6 pm. The place already pack due to early bird special. We got two seats at the bar area so we don't need to wait for 45 minutes. The restaurant average age is high. Many white hair customers. They definitely like this place. 

We got the grilled chicken and the grilled prime rib. The chicken is ok. But the prime rib is excellent. Early bird special make this a good deal. I highly recommend to come at early bird. The accompanying clam chowder is too creamy. Not much o

My visit is much improved on service and the food. This Cracker Barrel is the closest to my home. I saw the have some outside seating. It is great to have outside seating for this time of year. It is also good for the dog. 

We were here for lunch. They do have under seven dollars lunch special. We got the bacon glaze grilled chicken. The chicken is juicy. The bacon also nice and thick. My kid ordered the fried chicken fried. They brought the country fried steak. At the end they give additional fried chicken fried. We end up to take it home. We also order regular fried chicken. It is just ok.  May be need to work on coating flavor. 

The service is excellent. We were checked on several time. It is definitely good experience on regular visit. There is a lot retired or old generation eat here. Very popular.

Popeyes recently has a promotion of $5 Cajun shrimp box. It is good deal I want to check them out. Popeyes always is my favorite fast food chain for fried chicken. When I was at Louisiana for my college year, this is my often visited place. Love the Cajun spice. 

The best part are the dirty rice. It is very tasty. Their spicy fried chicken with Cajun spice is wonderful and has the southern style cooking. The new Cajun shrimp is good too. Shrimp size is very good size to have. $5 deal will not last long, catch it while you can. 

I visited this store and the manager really step up the game. She saw I spill my drink when I walk to the car with my food. She replaced a new cup for me. I give them a good service rating due to pay attention to the detail.

They have the big board indicated the brewery on the tap when you walk in. Some beer is interesting from other states. BJ has been open for business not long ago. I have their food at Gainesville before. Now they are close to my neighborhood. 

We have ordered the pan seared salmon with quinoa and seared tuna salad. Their R and D did a good job to come out the menu. It is very likable. The tuna is seasoning and seared outward. The salad has good dressing and good selection of ingredients. Crispy wonton skin and pickle ginger add the flavor to the salad. 

The salmon is almost like blacken outside with good spice. The quinoa is well cook. I like this dish the most. At the end we added the monkey bread with ice cream. Like cinnamon roll top with two scoops of vanilla ice cream. 

Call ahead for putting your name in the wait list will cut down wait time by half. Paying process is quick close up.

It 3.5 stars. The ambient is definitely top notch for a brewery. If I need a beer with friend, this is definitely the place to be. For sure one thing they do it right is make this place family oriented. The food have kid menu. The also have arcade games area for kid. If need a sip with your family, this a way to go. 

The outside seating is very nice. Comfortable to get together. They also have private party room. Other than dining area, the have upper class dining room too. The entire compound set up is nice. Spacious to walk and good for kid. The happy hours is from 3 to 5:30 pm with discount price on certain items. 

We got the Florida Avenue Larger to sip. I like the light brew beer especially if you are thirsty. We also got the FL Ave Wing to try. We have the brown sugar bbq sauce. This wing is ok. The price of a wing two dollars a piece is in the high side. I would go for the blackened dry rub. 

Overall is good. May be food need to rethink how to price. Otherwise they area fun place to be.

It is about 3.5 stars. Not 4 stars yet. This place open before the pandemic business close. Now it open back up for customers is a sign of the returning to business. It is considered a new restaurant near Cross Creek. The previous restaurant close down due to lack of customers traffic. I hope they do well. 

I got the full chicken with tax is about above average price grilled chicken around here. If they they can adjust a little bit for their price, may be can be more compete with neighborhood rotisserie chicken. I would said they have good marinated sauce into the meat and bone of the chicken. This I give them an A. 

If you order takeout, you may want to call ahead. Because they may not be ready for you on time. The reception need to improve in speed for dealing with customers order. Seem like need improvement.

Nicks is fried seafood place. They have good deal on fried shrimp. The place look like a take out place. They do have a few table if you want to dine there. Parking is available on the plaza lot. 

We got seafood combo with fried tilapia and shrimp. It come with 10 shrimps and two pieces fried tilapia. You can choose different types of fish. The coating is crispy. It is also light seasoning. We also got 1/2 pounds fried gizzards. The coating is medium seasoning. I actually like their gizzard seasoning. Both dishes are good to have. Love munching on the gizzard. 

Wait time is bearable from the start of order. You can call in to save time.

Solid 4 stars restaurant. We were early on the dinner. We're were the first customers. Most of the customers come around 7pm. If you looking for a romantic dinner, this may be your place. They have live music at night during weekend. Price is medium range at dinner, weekday lunch have better deal. Time change a bit for pandemic so call ahead. 

I got the Pesca Alla Griglia - grilled grouper with Italian herb and drizzle with balsamic vinegar. This dish come with two sides. It is sautéed veggies and potatoes. The sides are excellent. The grouper is fresh with good seasoning with grilled mark. 

Our second dish is the Pollo Scarparella. This is chicken breast sautéed with Italian sausage. It sauce with mushroom, roasted red pepper, onion in white wine with balsamic vinegar and Demi glazed sauce. The sauce is wonderful. This is a good dish to have. 

Service is good. Very attentive. Food has good taste and flavor. It is good for romantic night.

Jeni has ice cream flavor that not found in many place. I like the all flavor they serve. They also charge the flavor most often to keep me interested. 

During pandemic the inside seating is not available. But they do have outdoor seating. It is good to have ice cream and eat it there. This store may face lack of customers due to location. Don't know if the customer at Amateurwork will come here to enjoy the ice cream. We like the trio ice cream with three flavors. We got brambleberry crisp, rainbow buttermilk, and blackout chocolate cake. This three flavor is interesting.

I have been to this place several time. If you in search for Italian product, this is your place. The store is part restaurant, part grocery and part wine store. They do carry good bottles of Italian wine. I like the rose wine here. 

The sandwich is decent here. I have couple of different sandwiches here. I have Cuban and European classic. Both sandwiches are tasty. They also have pizza that I have not try it. One thing for sure, the cold cut prosciutto is good here. I like to have a few cut and go with the rose.  I got a bottle of Italian wine. It is good enough. They do have other Italian red. But I am interested on their rose. 

The store also has series of refrigerators that selling home made item. You should check it out.

I like the new establishment of Zukku. The new restaurant set up is beautiful with high ceilings with beautiful wall decoration. The chair also decorative and fit the entire restaurant interior. This is something they were not able to do at Armateurwork. I have to give them an A in the interior. 

They welcome us with expandable hot tower. It is a good show to begin the meal. We started with the Centipede roll. It is a spicy tuna top with hamachi. It look delicious but I think their spicy tuna need some work. May be mixed in the sesame oil and quail egg to mixed in will better. 

I do like grilled hamachi collard. It has good large pieces. The dressing is good and complemented the collard. We also has one chicken and one steak Yakitori. Those have good flavor. The bake mussels is the one I recommend and the have good topping and baked seasoning. 

I would said they expanded the appetizers very well. Service is good. It is about 4.5 stars. Not yet 5 stars.

This restaurant is a 3.5 stats restaurant in my book. We were here at their anniversary where they have free baklava for the customer. Today we are using the groupon to try the restaurant first time in this location. 

We have order the lamb, chicken and beef kabab. We also order extra meat on the gyro and added the falafel. Going big on order for this visit. Today the best chicken kabab. The lamb and steak is a bit chewy. I order meat with medium rare. The marinate is on point except the meat quality need to be better. The falafel is a bit below average. The baklava is excellent. The gyro also excellent since they shave of the main skew and cook it one more time to make this crispy. 

Overall the food is above average. Service is better than good. The place is well decorated.

The Macy locates at the center of the Shop Wiregrass mall. They strategically located at the main attraction of this mall. Any big event of this mall is happening around this area. 

Macy is pleasant to shop due to wide space walkway and any good selection. They often provide discount when it comes close to any holiday. When you sign up the mailing list, they mail the coupons to your home. Although they are in the high side on many items, when it is discount, the price cut is deep. I often get discounts on top of another discount. Some of the work long sleeve dress I have purchased is only $12 of the 50% discount with another 30% off. 

The home good is at the second floor which is I often visit.  The bathroom is clean in Macy if I come to this mall.

The fish house is hidden secret for the local. Thanks God we have Yelp to locate this restaurant. This is favorite of the Ruskin residents in this remote area. This restaurant is buried deep inside town. If you didn't drive to this location, you would not notice it.

They have fresh fish and shrimp. But their signature dish is the smoke mullet. They serve limited fish for the day. If you come late, you may not be able to get one. However, there is plenty of other seafood you can choose. The choice included the shrimp, oyster, catfish, or soft shell crab. I got the mixed and match with shrimp and catfish. This dish is fresh and good. Two sites come with it for $12. Good deal. 

This place is open air with high ceilings. During the summer time, it is still cool breeze with fan blowing.

The restaurant is located at the plaza was plan to be the china town 20 years ago. However the china town was not happen in tampa. It came close to the planing. 

The restaurant sales Chinese BBQ food such as pork, duck, crispy pork. You can buy it by the pound. This restaurant was here before along the Ding Ho oriental grocery store. 

The best value is the beef noodle soup. The beef is stir fry and then add to the soup. The soup broth is chicken and bone base. The noodle is the Hong Kong egg noodle. The are thin and great to chew. Compare to Mc Donald. I will pick the value ($5.99) of this noodle soup anytime. It is more nutrition and fun to eat. 

They also serve traditional Chinese dishes. If you like fried rice try their dry scallop fried rice. It stir fried with dried scallop and slice asparagus. The other dish are the beef with Chinese broccoli with beef in hoisin source also a good dish. This dish is more to American style dish but still kept the Chinese cuisine technic.

The surprise dish is the Taro Crispy Duck. The duck is deboned and marinated. The duck meat then lay on the bottom and top paste with ground taro. They are deep fried and chop into pieces. The accommodate with sweet soy sauce and garlic and scallion. They are crispy on top and bottom. The top is a crispy taro create the net type crispy good. The bottom is duck create slightly burn crispy. This is a killer dish.

Happy hour at Saturday??  Un heard off. This restaurant offer the happy hour sushi is at Saturday from 2 to 4 pm. The rolls are $4 each. They also have the reduce price appetizers. 

It is perfect to go there when I just finish my Saturday noon time badminton session. Compare to many places with happy hour sushi, their sushi rice is seasoning with good flavor before wrapping. In my book, only one happy hour place sushi rice is comparable to this place. I got six different roll for $24. I also get half price sangria sake. Good deal. 

Other than their happy hour sushi, they also have chef signature sushi roll. They are very attractive. The service is good, the ambients are nice. Can you believe they are the few pioneers who serve gourmet sushi in Bay Area.

This restaurant close at 3 pm at weekday that I only can visit at my off day. They even open at Christmas Eve until 12 noon. We got there at 10:50 and they are very busy. 

We have ordered the lunch special with grilled steak sandwich and soup. We also added a breaded steak sandwich for the lunch. This is good Latin steak sandwich since they pay attention to make the edge of the meat seared well. This will release the meat burn taste. 

The soup is Caldo Gallego. White bean with collar green and tiny piece of ham. I believe the soup is meat base and they are good. The breaded steak make you feel hungry. They are very good. 

I like the floor is service by a young group of waiter and waitress. They are fast and effective. I wish there is restaurant like this with affordable price in New Tampa.

I always enjoy Fred's Market. This is my second Fred's Market I have visited. We were here for the Father's Day. At 6:30 pm, the hostess tell us the wait is 25 minutes at Sunday. About 12 minutes, pur names already call.   

Compare the Fred's Market here to the one I'm Riverview, this one is cleaner and nicer. However, I think the one in Riverview has larger buffet table and more selection. I love southern food here. Especially the fried catfish. It also has good bake chicken and ribs. The southern fried chicken here is delicious. The collar green is my favorite. 

At the end of meal, they have dessert station for you to request any assembly. I got the bread pudding at below top with the butter pecan ice cream and finish the touch with the strawberry. Yummy tummy. Service was great. Definitely recommend to visit.

Doug Nation is part of the Metropolitan Ministry. I am applause to their mission to do good for the community. It is unique in a way they have the ice cream concept to attract people. I like it when they have taken something simple to add on other thing and create something new. 

This ice cream store combine the cookie dough and the ice cream and create something new. The best thing is not just have different ice cream flavor but also include the different flavors of cookie dough. I have the s'more cookie dough with marshmallow. My ice cream is pecan with caramel ice cream. I like the combination. The only thing is after you have through with the ice cream, you have to work on the cookie dough. The entire combination is very sweet. Good for the sweet tooth person. 

The clerks are very friendly. I like the taste try. You choose any flavor to try. Since it is located on the downtown, parking is a challenge. Parking after 6n pm is free. However they close at 8 pm which did not give you much time to have it after work.

This Grain Berry is open. But the seating area is limited due to pandemic. They layout their existing chair to form line with one way entrance with six feet social distancing. Worker wear mask and gloves. They keep the customers safe. 

I got the Vacation Smoothie. It is mango, banana, and pineapple smoothie. The smoothie is expensive than normal smoothie place but it give you a large cup. It was delicious. The store clerk recommended this choice and I not disappointed.

My revisit is much better. It still has kink on the tuna protein. May still need to make sure the tuna is good to serve. All other proteins are excellent. This restaurant is improving to better. Management is paying attention to the customers suggestion. 

We went through the as it has stated beyond this line is 8 minutes to eat. It is accurate to keep the line moving and limiting number of bowls per person. This is a successful operation on the line que to sit down. 

The bowl was improving from my last visit which I can see the bottom of the bowl. This time they fill up the bowl with food. The quantity has been met. 

I like the steak and the BBQ chicken. The glass noodle is the best if you choose the base. The add on is great too such as the guacamole and the plum tomato.

Coffee is good. Have a lot of flavor. I like they making cinnamon bun in front of the customers. I love the cinnamon sticks. It easy snack. If you are sugar cravings, they have a lot. Don't get use to it, because 5 sticks may not enough. They do have the classic roll or the mini roll for small bite. 

Their ready to pour drink is what you going for. Try their cinnamon pack. It come with many types. Good luck.

Beef O Brady is local love. I see a lot customers come here for affordable drink. They do have attractive cocktails. Unfortunately the cocktails alcohol level is not enough in the level of cocktails drink at nearby bar. I think this restaurant is about 3.5 stars. 

I start with Pineapple Express Cocktails. It is good looking drink. May need to have more alcohol in it. We order the blackened dry rub wings. Wing size has small to average size. It was good. The main entree is the Friday special. Surf and turf. At these this is affordable dish and special of the night. It is sirloin steak cook to order temperature and grilled or fried shrimp. This dish only on Friday. I think this is the dish to get. 

Service is good. Nothing fancy. Food come out at right time. I would said 3.5 stars but rounded up to 4.

Ichiban is an oldest sushi restaurant before any other sushi restaurant around USF. They have been here very long time ago. The owner is a Taiwanese. They start the restaurant by wrapping their own sushi. 

This restaurant has three major part of menu - the tempura, sushi sashimi, and teriyaki. They also have the rice and noodles bowl section. They have offers the variety of sushi. I always like their bento boxes and the boxes are the best values. They have teriyaki, sashimi, and tempura bento boxes. 

Today I have the sashimi bento box with added shrimp tempura for extra $3. I love shrimp tempura. The correct way is slight dip the shrimp in wet bread and deep fried. Then drip a bit of tempura next to shrimp and create the crispy effect. However, this process needs to finish in less than 3 minute before over cook the shrimp. This restaurant has the technique for it. The box came with 9 pieces sashimi, cucumber salad, tuna roll, California roll, and imitations crab salad. The sashimi is fresh. Love the shrimp tempura. The shrimp tempura has to eat there. This is not a takeout food. 

The customer make out from local businesses and students since it is close to the USF. The service is good and the food come out quick since they have enough sushi chefs.

For Brandon area, this is good enough Italian restaurant. Local like this restaurant because of the cuisine and affordable. I see many regular of the restaurant because the waitress know them. 

The special of the day usually listed on the black board. I got special Julienne Cocotte. It is sautéed chicken, mushroom, in creamy sauce in a hot clay pot. It come with garlic butter bread. It is a light dish to have. The second dish oven roasted chicken. This dish is a half chicken with lemon and spice. The chicken was well prepared. Seasoning is great. 

This restaurant to my book is 3.5 stars. Main is the the wait staff need to be more patient and polite. This is the area that the restaurant need constant improvement.

Umai Sushi has great deal at lunch time. Their lunch special stop at 3 pm. The lunch special included hibachi and tempura under $10. They also have roll lunch special with $7 for two selected rolls or $10 for three rolls. They also has happy hour beer 3 to 6 pm with domestic beer for $1.99 and $2.99 for imported beer. 

I got a piece of surf clam sushi, one escolar roll and one chef special roll Fantastic Spicy Tuna roll. The surf clam is big and cover the entire rice ball. The escolar roll is still feel a bit frozen. The Fantastic Spicy Tuna is good. It is spicy tuna deep fried then add the special mayo and ell sauce. Then top with shredded imitation crab meat. This is good.  

Service is very attentive. Food is good. I like the decorations but can improve.

Munchie is good ice cream at the mall. It has a lot topping choices. That is the major reason they are solid 4 stars. It is love by Wesley Chapel residents. Many have come here. I feel that 1 clerk is not enough. 

The soft serve is by weight. But the toppings are impressive. They include hot fudge, strawberry dip chocolate, sweeten cherry, sprinkles, . Since it is by weight, the toppings become burden to weight in for additional cost. However, since they have good topping, customers don't mind.

There is positive outcome for good or popular soft serve flavor. I will encourage them to continue to strive for the best interest of customers for this matter.

This BBQ place is busy event is 3 pm in the afternoon. A lot of people are here to pickup. If you don't want to wait, you can call ahead. 

They have chop pork, rib, chicken and sausage. The best is their special sauce on the BBQ. Their sauce is orange tangy taste. It got some flavor on it. I have the four meat special for $16. The pack all the meat at on box almost cannot close the lid. Plenty of food. 

This is neighborhood BBQ. They only have a few table. Many come to have the take out. The also serve pineapple ice tea. It something different than most of the BBQ place.

This newly open restaurant is serving Japanese street food. Basically the name of the restaurant is alcohol house. Many come here not just have good beer and cocktails, they enjoy the time here. 

We start with seafood sunomono. The seafood is assorted. It has imitation crab stick, octopus, and shrimp. I think this dish is over price. For the amount of food is little, too much of cucumber. The chicken gizzards skew was nice. It is the food to go with sake. We also has the yellowtail collar. This collar is good not the best but good enough. 

We also has the tonkutsu ramen. The ramen most value is having a good soup base which they got it. The charshu is good also. The veggies they have is just the bamboo shoot. I wish they have more stuff to attract the customers. Service is good and attentive. They did give out the surprise gift at the end to loot back the customers.

A lot people visited this place after church. This restaurant seem like a popular place for after church gatherings. One thing notice these restaurants mainly white people. So you know their food is American taco.  However they have the way to attract these type of customers. 

I like some of the Taco but my wife love the cracked corn. I got the chimichuri steak taco and my wife got the blacken fish taco. The steak taco may need to be improved but the fish taco is very good. The cracked corn is top with spice and cheese that make this corn very desirable. 

I would said this is Baja type taco place. It has it specialty. I like the interior design to show the beach look. You may choose one of the flint stone car booth to eat you taco. It is almost like movie.

B's Caribbean food is love by local. They only have one table. This is a take out place have a lot of customers. During my visit, at least 4 customers ahead me with multiple orders. You can see the popularity of local. 

They jerk chicken and some traditional Caribbean dish like Ackee with salty fish. The selection includes large or small portion. I got their popular dish. The oxtail. The marinated sauce went into the bone. The meat is soft but have not fall off the bone yet. I prefer fall off the bone cooking. My dish come with good bean rice and braise cabbage. Both side are great. 

The wait for the food is not bad. I got my food 15 minutes after order. It is considered fast with so many order ahead of me. Parking is free with lot in front of plaza.

Definitely pop if you put your popsicle and sit for some time. It great summer to visit this place to cool off. We were going to try their waffles but their waffles machine was down. So we go for the popsicle instead. The price is about a bit above average. Not much of selection. But the selection is good enough to try. 

We have the watermelon citrus and salty chocolate Elvis. The watermelon citrus I have tasted some chop up fruit remains. It is refreshing. The salty chocolate Elvis is something good feeling. Soft to bite and easy let it melt. I can hear some Elvis music now from Graceland. Put some sun glasses I will be Elvis myself. 

They also offer dip or sprinkle. Dip it is $1, roll and drizzle is $0.75. Like I said they have waffles on the stick but machine was not operate that day. They also have grilled cheese, coffee and regular ice cream.

I like the name Sailing. It is almost sailing to island to have poke. This restaurant is rather new. It has a lot potential. They have poke and ice cream. I would go for the poke.

The poke dish has two protein in regular size or three protein with larger size. The difference is 6" bowl and 10" bowl. I would go for the large. The other thing I need to mention is their unlimited topping of you choice. I also like their protein choice. The have more choices on the protein and different than other poke place. It has the grilled eel option. Other things that attract you is their sauce is thicker and not watery. Which make this poke location a win win choice. 

We like the larger size with larger diameter to contain more toppings. Above three reasosn will be the driving force for repeat customer.

This is my first visit to this Jeremiah Italian Ice. Not many customers in front of the building except 4 police officers. They have finished up their Italian ice and remain conversations. This time of year is still considered cold night and not many customers. 

I like Jeremiah because they have Italian ice and soft serve as a layer to separate the flavor. I got cotton candy, banana and sea salt caramel. Those are my favorite choices. I love the presentation of the ice with different color. The ice is tasty and playful.

It was difficult to find the medium range price for Brazilian Grilled. Most of them are very expensive. But this restaurant offer a way out with affordable price if you want a Brazilian Grilled buffet. Their rotisserie grilled meat is good and beat the chain restaurant because they are less salty. 

Rotisserie included the sausage, top sirloin, kabab, chicken drum stick, fillet mignon with bacon, garlic steak, sausage, Pork rib. Those are good selection. On top of the grilled meat, the hot food, salad and dessert also available for the taste. I like their egg plant salad. Food is delicious, it good to go as group and not cost too much. 

They close at Monday,  but Tuesday to Friday their web site has a $2 off coupon to save you further. I like the food there.

Solid 4 stars restaurant. It s close to 4.5 stars. If the dining open, I would consider to dine here. During the pandemic, they only allow take out. There a few review indicated if you dine in, the food take some time to come out. I think it is a easy fix. 

We started with the Garlic Parmesan Chicken Wing. We don't like the fry and get the wing a la cart. The wing was perfectly done. I like the parmesan with oil on wing. It is delicious. We got the chicken waffle to star also. I thing the fried chicken strip is nothing special. But it do have good fried. The waffle is soft. May because I have it take home. 

Our entree is the smothered pork chop. It has good smothered gravy sauce on top. We also got the oxtail. The meat is fall off the bone. The oxtail was cook for sometime and soft to eat. Very good dish. 

From order to pick up is about 20 minutes. Not bad. Considering it is a good southern dishes.

I would said the best Italian restaurant for my list.  Please read on why they did not get 5 stars. Do I come back. Hack yes. Hopefully I can give them a 5 stars next time. 

Before you come to this restaurant, you need to know a few thing. 1. Do not just show up. Make a reservation. Even though they said is highly recommended, I said is a must. Almost every day for people just walk in they have to wait for 2.5 hours at dinner time. If you don't have reservation,come at the time they open. 2. Go for the menu items. They are match the value of the food. 3. Be patient. They really don't have much help on the kitchen since it always back up on the order. 

Today we show up with reservation and we still have to wait for our table to be ready. Not a long wait. While waiting there is a special of the day on the board for your choices. We have appetizer and pre-meal item that come with the entree. The first course is about 30 minutes. But the entree is about an hour wait. I did ask the waiter why. They have accommodated with addition wine and dessert no charge for our situation.
