We begin our appetizer with Vongole Marechiara. It is the baby pasta clams sautéed with garlic, basil, and white wine sauce. The sauce is great. Please ask a loaf of bread to go with it. It is excellent dipping the bread in this sauce. The baby clam is about 25 to 30 count. But they are small portion in the big bowl. They taste very good. 

My entree is the special on the board. Pan seared blacken Scottish Salmon on top of roasted slice potato with house cure pork belly. The salmon cook just right and the fish is fresh. The cure pork belly is awesome. It is a bit pricy for this dish. The entree come with the soup or salad of your choice. 

The restaurant only have the wine and beer for alcohol. We were accommodated with great dessert for the time lost while waiting. Seem like they have a smaller kitchen. This may be the only area they need to improve. Increase the speed of food preparation or bigger kitchen. Don't let the customer wait. 

The dessert is magnificent. They brought out the Tiramisu, Cannoli, Lemon Cake, and pyramid chocolate. It look awesome when they are in one big plate. I applause they accommodated the customer long wait time.

Better Byrd is unique restaurant and part of the Fresh Kitchen group. I think their menu is interesting in a way to enjoy variety of the food. The menu selection from dessert, sandwiches, bowls, to taco and wings. It more interesting than the mother Fresh Kitchen which is boring after 4 or 5 visit. 

We got the fried Byrd. This sandwich includes Peruvian slaw, fried buttermilk chicken with cluck sauce. The chicken is crispy. The sauce is great. The entire assembly is harmony. We also hot the charcoal soft serve with peanut jam, coconut flakes, and banana slice. The charcoal soft serve is the best we have. Food is great here especially you look for snack. They also has pork bun which match Asian flavor. 

Overall we like it. But in winter raining day, the inside seating is impossible due low temperature AC unit. Too cold to seat inside.

This cafe is busy during the Friday lunch. I found a place at the bar since I am solo during lunch. The bar area is where they keep all the sauces. So I can pick any sauce I want for my sushi. I am here because of my yelp friend Mel said lunch here has deal and they are good.

Friday lunch is busy. I got their lunch special sashimi. It has 12 pieces slide. The tuna and salmon slice is thick pieces. The yellow tail is thinner but at lease they provide it with masago. The white fish I don't know. These slices lay on white radish. It is actually good deal for $12. It come with choice of side with miso soup or salad. 

The sushi chef is very fast paste. They can roll out the sushi is great speed. The have 4 people in the small space counter but able to work on the tight place. Talking space management, they have good one plus a lot servant.

King of the Coop open in Wesley Chapel is convenient and closer to me at New Tampa. Since I have their chicken, they don't have bone in chicken. Mostly the tender. 

We got the tender basket with Nashville Hot coating. It is really good hot and spicy chicken. Love the sweat hot taste. It is a bit spicy sweet taste which ok challenge for a Malaysian who use to eat spicy food. The basket come with tree pieces. Love the spicy of the coating.

This Caribbean Cuisine wine Caribbean attitude. The restaurant menu do not have much to select but I do like their Oxtail. According to their name they are Haitian cuisine. 

I have the Oxtail and my wife has fried chicken. Their chicken is fried to very crispy. The chicken tasty. It can come with island spice stew. 

I am the fan of oxtail. It cook with island spice in slow braise. The meat is separated from the bone. I like the island marinated sauce. It must has a lot ingredient in it. 

This dishes has a choice of side. It come with plantain and I also choose the mushroom rice. It has dark long grain rice. I like this rice very much. 

If you come to Caribbean, the time is not matter. As a result, you need to wait for your food to be ready. As I said before. The Caribbean attitude slow and easy.

Solid 4 stars and most affordable in the street. With the competition of many restaurant at the same street, they have some edge because of their affordability. One thing definitely can improve is their menu. The letter size of the menu is too tiny. May be need to increase the font size to 14. 

We start with the Chimichurri Parmesan six wings. The wing was fried, grilled, to with cheese and Chimichurri sauce. I believe this is their best appetizer. 

Our entree are Basic and Lima plates and combo. For the basic we have Ropa Vieja and shredded chicken. This combo also come with yellow rice and sweet plantain. The Lima has better rice. It is Peruvian green rice, plum tomatoes and onion. The protein are Chimichurri pork, and mojo pork. 

Service just average. But but and price are good. The happy hour is before 6:30 pm. We were there 7pm and many of the happy hour customers left about 7:15 pm. So if you want to enjoy more quiet setting, come at 7:30 pm.

This is the most completed oriental market. I have seen Atlanta Hong Kong market, super h, ranch 99, this market cannot be compete with that but hold their own ground. They have carried many variety dry food can food and fresh food. 

There six major departments. The Fresh vegetable. The frozen section, imperishable food, deli, fresh seafood, and meat. The deli have the roast duck, crispy pork, BBQ pork, braise pig stomach, pig ear, pig tongue, and soy chicken in the BBQ section in deli. The deli have regular dish like salt and pepper pork chop or shrimp, general tau chicken, sweet and sour chicken, Buddha delight, seafood mix vege, kungpao chicken, fried rice, and noodle. 

The meat department you can get special cut such pork belly, short rib cut, beef Shane. I like the most is they allow for smaller piece flank steak less than half pound. The sea food department have live fish, lobster, vancouver crab. 

The frozen section have Sahbu Sahbu (hot pot) material that you can assemble. You can get thin slice pork, fish cake, shrimp or octopus ball, meat ball, thin slice beef. 

The center section has jasmine rice for various region. They also have the sticky rice, sushi rice, brown rice. The munch area have deferent type of biscuit, mochi, dry squid eat out from bag, fried shrimp chip.....  Got to check out yourself. 

The fresh vegetable that I like the most are the Chinese Kailan, hollow stem spinach, Bok choi, Yu choi. There is tropical fruit that you have never seen before like rambutan. 

Dessert are the coffee cake, coconut bun, sweet bun, sponge cake. More to offer. 

I can get most of the oriental spice here for Chinese cuisine.

Solid 4 star market. We know about this chain market when we travel to Seattle. Finally there is one in Wesley Chapel in the Bay Area. Joining the member ship is free. The benefit of the membership is big because of the discount. I would suggest join their membership before any purchase. There are special discount items for member. 

This store has furniture, interior decoration, toy, food, drink and more. My wife like hello kitty. She is a big fan for many year. This store carry many of the item. From candy to bowl. The items that provide in the store are import from foreign country. If you like those item, you may not get it next time because of foreign supply is different. 

They also carry some wine, beer, imported soft drink and more. Including many types of syrup. You will items you normally don't see in our daily shopping center.

It is a popular neighborhood BBQ. When I put my order in, I was number 15 in the wait list. The wait is more than 30 minutes. They did warn you it going to take long time before your turn. Since they use the parking lot of an commercial building, they have limited parking space. When they people are getting crowded, they stop taking order until the crowd reduced. 

I got the sausage sandwich. They do have a choice how spicy the sausage you want. I pick mild because my wife cannot handle too spicy food. The sausage was well prepared and pack. It was a big link. 

I also got the the tree meat combo dinner. You can choose the upgrade meat such as brisket and rib. The upgrade meat is adding $5 to the original cost which I feel is worth the money. I got pull pork, brisket, and rib. The side are baked bean and collard greens. Both side is good. I also like the sweetness of the bake bean. 

If they can improve the speed of the order, it will tremendously helping them.

We like the this restaurant and this is the third time we are here. The server is friendly, unfortunately they are not fluent in English. The food is very good. Their famous dish is the grill quail. Each order of the grill quail is coming with 10 pieces. They prepare with very tasty sweet blacken source. It is finger licking good. 

The dinner we have order is 7 courses of beef for two. The come with fresh beef slice wrap, beef cute, sesame beef, beef salad, beef congee, beef ball, beef desert. This is serious amount of food for two. The seven way to cook the beef in Vietnamese style open my eyes how it done differently. Of course, they afraid that you order this dis and share with more than three people. Be sure that you have order one more dish if you want to share. 

The restaurant is good with group  and couple. At the end the restaurant is in medium condition for the furniture. This is a place going for the taste not for look. The duck noodle soup is another dish that you may want to try if you don't mind the bone. I always like meat with bone because more tasty. If you are boneless food person this is not your dish.

No sure how long they going to run their lunch special lobster deal. But our experience here was good. This Red Lobster joint I have been visited many time. This time the service is good. Some other time is slow. 

I have been here for Shrimp festival and lobster festival. This time for their lobster lunch special. They will provide half Tail meal for below $10. I have the lobster roll with fried and Cesar salad with added grilled shrimp. The added shrimp is additional $2. Overall not a bad deal. I like the lobster roll. It has good mixture of flavor. The roll is cut out and toasted with grilled. The grilled shrimp is grilled and chilled in the salad make this cold dish which is good also. 

Overall I like the deal. I have been here for many venue and they are decent.

Rare Ethnic Food No. 15

Compare to many Caribbean Cuisine, they a bit above average. In fact, they are Jamaican cuisine. The culture for the Caribbean is more into relax and lay back type. The menu is not printed but on the board. When we were there, many of Jamaican families eat there. 

The oxtail is the popular item that people order. So we go with it. The food came out in about right timing. The oxtail is cook in the sweet side. It come with rice with pinto bean and salad. The oxtail can be pick out by the folk which the must cook this meat long time for it to fall off the bone. I have some other oxtail before. This one is in the middle of the standard. 

Service is good. This is a 3.5 stars restaurant to me. Since there is no half star. 4 stars was given in this review.

3.5 stars restaurant. However, they carry a dish that I haven't have before. Round up to 4 stars. 

This restaurant have sit down and serve. It carry some traditional dish. I have order their special beef pho. It has all the beef ingredients including tripe and tendon. A few things can be improved. The beef need to slice thinner. The pho base soup is at clear and light pho flavor. It may need a bit stronger. But if you like light pho taste, this is the one you can order. 

I have the crispy flat noodle. This dish I have not try before. The angels hair rice noodle was deep fried and flatten. It top with stir fry mixed of meat and seafood. The chef has good wok skill. This dish cook at high BTU flame. It bring out the good flavor. 

I also has a to go special Vietnamese sandwich. It is assorted cold cut meat assemble. The homemade sweet paste make this sandwich stand out from other sandwich. Service is good. Food come out quick.

Indian grill has been in my list to visit for some time. We know the best time to visit has to be lunch time all you can eat buffet. I have not have a weekday lunch time to do it until the Labor Day off. 

Parking of the restaurant are only a few adjacent to the restaurant. They do have additional parking at the back. The restaurant have a few seat on the outside and some at the inside. 

The buffet display great selection of meat which I like. I am not a vegetarian and this is fit my appetite. The stand out dish is the tandoori chicken and the curry chicken. The tandoori chickens is well marinated into the meat in comparison to many restaurant in the Bay Area. I like the curry chicken due to their heavy Indian spice like the one I have in Malaysia.

I have been to this Grill Smith when they just open. I don't like at that time because the chaos and un-organize. I have not been back at least few years. Tonight we have decided to go back to visit. Because our visit time is about 9:00 pm one hour before they close, there is no line. I wonder how this restaurant handles pressure when they have a lot customer. 

Tonight is Wednesday and they are Happy Hour all day. Only Sunday and Wednesday is all day Happy Hours. All other day Happy Hour is from 4 to 7 pm. During the happy hour the appetizers range from $5 to $7. It is almost 40% off from the original price. We have order 3 appetizers from happy hours menu and one appetizer from regular menu. They are Spicy Thai Chicken, Crispy Fish Taco, Fillet Tip Egg Roll and we add a Crab and Shrimp Cake from regular menu. After we have order we realize that all items are deep fried. They have their tasty side. I like the crab and shrimp cake the most. I also like the Spicy Thai Chicken dipping sauce with sweet tangy flavor. 

Since we have so many appetizers, we only order one entrée from their special - the Shrimp Diablo. It is spaghetti in red sauce with shrimp except they add a kid of spicy. I believe this dish is too plain and not exciting. I think this dish should not be served any more if they try to attract customer. The special is not special at all.

Overall the service is excellent; food came out very quick since there is no other customer this late. Enjoy watching the Hokey NHL game with the TV with Tampa Bay Lighting score a goal at the buzzer to win.

I was wondering why Chris W visited this place so often. This restaurant really match it name - Chicken Salad Chick. I would said it is huge chick magnet. Many ladies enjoy this restaurant more than guys. If you walk in, the girls are more than the boys. It is really ladies choice of food. 

Stacy Brown the founder and creator has her story of this restaurant of how it started. Interesting story was it. They have multiple selections of chicken salad type that will be some things for your plate. You also can sample the chicken salad before you make a choice of the ultimate salad you want. We have the jalapeño holly that day. It is tasty and good. We order chicken gourmet dish come with sandwich scoop, pasta salad and broccoli salad. I like the broccoli salad. 

The interior decoration certainly the best I seen for the fast food store. They also have the small room can hold 20 people if you like to have the meeting there. Food is definitely healthy side in my book. Service is really good. I will return to this restaurant sometime soon for the chick magnet.

It is close to 4.5 stars. 4 stars is given due the service is a bit slow. 

This place have good pricing for taco joint. I have been book mark this place for a while. With less $10 you can get a combo with drink. I have 5 taco combo for $7.50. But adding fish and shrimp taco is a dollar more. My favorite is the shrimp taco. It has very good spice for the shrimp. Very tasty for the bite. We have other tacos such as lingua, tripa, chicharon. 

It use to a taco truck. Now they have permanent place with sit down restaurant which very good for the customers. Now they serve margarita. I would said is ok. 

We also have fried whole fish. It is a perch fish. It is only $11. Come with two side. It was greatly fried to the bone. The edge and scorn area is crispy. The food is good. I will be back to check them out.

This is Tampa own nice sandwich store. This is the area they generate a lot crowd during the lunch hour. It is pack most of the time. The sandwich is famous in this area. 

We have the Cuban Sandwich with hot press. We order all inclusive sandwich fully loaded. The sandwich is very thick nice cheese. The ham is very juicy. The mojo pork just a few slice in the center. The pork need to be more mojo marinated with better strong taste. Overall, this is a big sandwich for a hungry person.

This is very much healthy local bar. The outwardly of the restaurant is nice. It allow the bar to serve outwardly and inwardly. You can choose either side. The have many selection on the cocktail. One particular I like is the smoked old fashioned. They use Bulleit Bourbon, Demerara brown sugar and walnut bitter with a twist of orange peel. It add the smoke essence. They burn the wood and capture the smoke. You also can ask them to smoke your wine glass before they pour it for you. 

I have order the Korean Grilled Flat Bread. This bread has 8 big pieces. This flatbread top with fried chicken pieces, mozzarella peppers jack cheese, cucumber, jalapeño and slaw. The slaw is pickle and has Asian cuisine taste. The combination of the ingredients has make this flatbread desirable. 

Service is good. Not spectacular. Food prices is medium acceptable. Ambient is nice.

One of the best BBQ at Central Avenue. This restaurant is close to 4.5 stars about 4.3. This is one of the URBAN restaurants along the same street. Setting is unique, one side is bar and other side is restaurant. 

The BBQ is best to be eat here. The pork belly is amazing. It has sweet and tangy taste. We got the baby back half rack. The meat is smoke more than three hours. The meat is fall of the bone easily. Marinated sauce deep into the meat with dry rub technique. Love the food taste. It come with three different house BBQ sauces. One of them is a bit spicy but all accompanying well with the ribs. We also have a side with collar green. It is good too with the slow cook break down fiber type. 

I got the Sound Czech Pilsner. The beer is good to wash down the BBQ. Service is good and friendly.

Good Bah Mi store. This store located at 49 street north of Park Blvd. it is very close to dense Vietnamese community. They store front indicated buy five Bah Mi and get one free. 

I have try their cold cut special. It is combination of many type of meat cold cut. It includes the pork roll. Most important is the liver paste. It is very authentic with the liver paste. The taste is good. Many Bah Mi place only put mayonnaise but this place put liver paste. That is special. 

They have boba drink. But I would encourage you to try their Che. It is combination of the jello and bean. I have the Dau Do Banh Lot Suong Sao. It is the red bean, pandan jelly, grass jelly, coconut milk. They were kind enough to add the red tapioca and yellow bean for me. It was delicious.

"Good" as advertised. This place is actually a distance from I-75. You will see nothing along the way then you see a strawberry farm and the production center. They close at 6 pm. 

The farm on the west of the compound has a lot of strawberry is growing. Some of them is green. The farm has wide field of strawberry. Certainly this is not just for public but also for production by the scale they have. The welcome center has strawberry for sell. But they are not in pricing. Some of the strawberry we seen is a bit dark red in the box. May be we arrive about 5:15 pm. All the good one already pick up by the visitors. 

The have food stand for strawberry short cake and hot dog. There is a lot visitor come to visit. I am guessing because of the strawberry season.

La Bahia is new bakery at Bearss and Florida Ave. This is a Latin cafe shop. You can get coffee, sandwich, bake goods and more. 

We got the La Tripleta sandwich. It has all kind of meat. The sandwich is delicious. The thing I like the most flan. They have good flan. Got to have one of that. We also got some powder guava pastry. The skin of the pasta just like biscuit break away. Interesting. 

The menu is simple to order. But don't forget to look at their daily special. It has some good stuff such as rotisserie chicken and fish stew

For assembly food, they are quite good. This is the newest location of this chain healthy food restaurant. It just open and bring a lot foot traffic to the store. I like the open area and large square footage of the restaurant. The do have limited cook food if you like to try. 

We got the superfood bowl. I have the mango passion. This bowl has a choice of base. Several bases to choose including Pitaya, kale or yogurt. I pick ACAi. This bowl has mango, coconut shaving, pineapple and honey. It just like dessert. My wife have the Relax, Eat, and Repeat. What a name. It is a bowl to repeat. I like it because it has the Nutella in it. Other ingredients include banana, strawberry, crush nut, peanut butter and honey. It is a good bowl and well decorated. 

Food is decent. I would definitely try some other items in the menu.

I have visited Frog Pond before hurricane Irma. This place is serving hearty breakfast with choice. The place is decorated with a lot frog. It frog all over place. There the reason they call themselves frog pond. 

The service is very attentive, you alway can get the waiter attention easily. The coffee alway refill without you notice it. I would recommend you visit this place if you looking for breakfast near the beach. They have complete menu with egg and omelette, egg Benedict, quiche, Belgium Waffles, crepe. 

We got the lox Benedict. It is porch egg, smoke salmon, lox salmon, caper, grilled onion, bagel. It come with grit with melted butter. The smoked salmon is delicious and come with great quantity. This is good dish to have for breakfast. The porch egg was make perfect with the egg yolks still in liquid stage.

Our revisit has make me to reevaluate this restaurant. I like to change my opinion review to 3.5 stars. It is not a true 4 stars. The revisit show the restaurant step backwards in compare to the first few months they just open. I am some what disappointed. The nigiri has show increasing of rice and thinner fish cut. The sushi roll is still in good shape but not the best as before. I wonder I am going to revisit this place. Although they have good price for all you can eat but the quality drop. Service is still good.

All about Taco - the Mexican fast food. 

I have seen Anna in and out this restaurant many times. My wife has some take out at this place when she visit West Tampa Library. For me I only eat the take out until I try it with friends a few days ago. 

They are certainly above the average taco joint. Other than their typical menu item, they have their special on the board. Today I have the Camaron, Pescado, Barbacoa and Carne tacos. The Camaron is the grilled shrimp. It is good but a bit over grilled. The Pescado is the tilapia fish. This is the best I have today. It is well grilled and season. The Barbacoa is bbq beef Mexican styles. It is a lot of spice ingredients. It is good. The carne is the steak taco. It is above average. 

Food overall is good. I like the chip with spicy salsa. This restaurant is cafeteria style and the food come out quick.

This probably my fourth visit to the restaurant. They are very consistent on the food preparation. For all the food we have tasted, other than the grilled meat, the rest of the item are well prepared. I have not try their Jungsik yet - combination of everything. That will be my list next time. 

We have group today to try the Korean marinated fried chicken, bibimbob, Kimbab, Seafood Soon-doobu. The best of the night is the Korean marinated fried chicken. The marinated sauce is very interesting. It has the good mixed into the fried chicken. I also like the Soon-doobu. It is soft tofu stew in hot pot. It come very temperature hot with bubble boiling hot. Nice mix of seafood inside. Soft to taste. Bibimbob is rice assembly with beef in hot stone pot. 

Overall is very good. Not a wow factor but definitely above average. Very close to Korean street food.

This the most cleanest ALDI I have been to. The neighborhood also nicer. I like to shop here. This is my friend Rachel neighborhood. I like the Italian prosciutto the sold here. It is delicious. The bacon selection has many type. The Appleton bacon is my favorite because they have more meat than fat. 

They do have the pink lady grape. It is a good one. Strawberry and raspberry is red and fresh looking. I also like their cheap wine selection for cooking. The hot deli is great. 

I like aisle is big and wide. Although the put in the direction, many of the customers did not follow the order. They man the entrance when inside the store get crowded. They should always improve on the number of checkout cashiers. Because the faster they checkout, the wait to enter the store will be faster.

Come here for the special deal that saw from beach. Their beach banner toll by the plane work. It does attract me to visit. Monday to Thursday and mention the plane advertising got $5 on appetizer before 4 pm. It is a steal. Monday also is $5 margarita. Come Monday is a good day at this restaurant. Restaurant is a walk to the beach. Parking across the street is convenient.

For the special, we got the peel shrimp, coconut shrimp, and wings it. The half pound peel shrimp is boil and top with old bay seasoning. There are about 10 medium size shrimp. The coconut shrimp is six of them. I also like the wings with teriyaki sauce. All items are delicious. Margarita is Hemingway Margarita with top shelf tequila. 

We enjoy our time there with less than $25 for all food and drinks we have. Love the deal.

This restaurant was recommended by a friend. I would said they have groove of the food in their menu. They are not typical food you fine. They serve Columbian cuisine with some specialty of their own. 

We have the Sobrebarriga and the Pargo Rojo Frito. Sobrebarriga is the Creole Flank Steak in "tio" sauce. It is yellow sauce with yuca and sweet plantains on the side. This flank steak is braise proper and tear the meat in string. 

My wife dish is the Pargo Rojo Frito - the fried whole snappers. The fish is very fresh and crispy. The batter that applies to fish has been mix with spice and they are very good. Love the crispy taste with flavors. 

Overall our dishes is very good. I also has a Guanabana as a juice drink to go with the meal. It is refreshing.

About 3.5 stars. Since the service measured up beyond the standard, 4 stars is given. Cooper Hawk has good wine collection. We did not try their wine because it was business lunch and need to get back to work. We were here for lunch and surprised the dining hall is almost full. Service is excellent even with so many customers. This is a plus. 

We started with their pretzels bread. This is great bread to have. When you hear the name of pretzel, you may think this will be tough bread to bite. But it turn out very good. 

My entree is the carne asada taco with tortilla soup. I think they need to work on this dish. The steak feel like cut and sit for some time. You can see the steak is dry compared to fresh cut steak. The soup is good. My friend has the Ellie Chicken Piccata. His dish is better. It accompanying with pasta and asparagus.

The begin of Sweet Bun I have try is at Gainesville. Since I have been to many oriental bakery, I would place this one a bit above middle of the pack. It is similar to Sweet Hut at Atlanta. It definitely cannot compare to Sweet Hut near Gwinnett Place at Atlanta but it definitely hold it own for Tampa Bay Area. 

They have sweet and salty bun on display. It is perfect location near USF. It is great to have bun for breakfast with lesser price. Even if you come for lunch, it is better than the choice of fast food. A bowl noodle definitely better than fast food with same price. 

The only thing they lack off is they need special drinks like fruit tea, boba tea, and WiFi. We were here for their pig feet noodle and the wonton noodle. Not the best but good enough.

Good BBQ place for smoking BBQ. Jazzy is one of my friends favorite (Howard and Lori). Thanks to their share that we know about this place. I glad that they still doing well during pandemic. It is definitely a good place to hangout. 

We got King of kings. This combo is the best deal. You got to choose 5 types of meat with 2 small sides and sauce. We got the rib, chicken, sausage, pork, beef. It is good selection. The side we have is the collards green and the BBQ baked beans. The rib is is delicious. The chicken is juicy, the sausage is tasty. I like the baked bbq bean. It great to have. 

Overall our experience is good. I like the smoky flavor. The did a good job on the meat.

I enjoy the first restaurant found open after the Florida reopen for business. We were at the field project and need to have the meal while we were out from home or office. We drove pass the Bloomingdale area and decided to try any restaurant who are open. Acropolis was open the business after we Korean the door are find out. 

I think most of the restaurant who open for business need to mention an Opening word big at their front door. Because we still see 50% of the restaurant still close. The waiter is smart to seat us at the corner of the restaurant to let people outside see the restaurant is actually open. 

We got the Athenian fish and kabob. The Athenian fish is lightly bread and grilled. The fish may need a big salt. But overall is ok. The kabob is much better. The grilled technique is good. Well mar

I would said their attractive food are actually at the appetizer. They are located on the new plaza. The place and interior are nice. It has good open space for dining. The thing is lack off is the parking. Even though there are some parking on the front. Most of the diner time, these spaces are taken. You may have to park on the neighborhood street. 

We start with fresh house made guacamole. I said this dish is ok. Our second app is the Puerto Escondido Seafood Ceviche. Puerto Escondido is at the south west coast of Mexico at Oaxaca region. The ceviche is good. The shrimp is tiny shrimp. I rather have larger shrimp and chop in pieces. Our third dish is the Ancho Seared Ahi Tuna Wonton Taco. The tuna is seared and dust with pepper corn. It stuffed in the fried wontons skin and top with home made wasabi paste. The fish accompanied with salad will mixed with edamame. Our fourth dish is the Blue Crab Tortilla Crust Crab Cake. It is good crab cake. 

My friend has the blue Chan dinner plate. I think they do need to work on the dinner dish. Services is below average. When the waitress want to joke, do not spill water over the table. It is not good impression. It is 3.5 stars in my book.

It is established Italian restaurant with family style of share plate. Love the way family style food to enjoy with group of friend. It is above the average Italian restaurant but below the Gourmet Italian. However, I like the setting with full bar capabilities. I have been to Maggiano before my Yelp time. This return give me a good excuse to review this restaurant. 

They have several private room for family eating. Some of this room has private bar if you want to have open bar. All this room can be link to big banquet hall. 

We start with Caesar salads and the Maggiano salad. The Maggiano salad carry more weight and better flavor. They include crispy prosciutto taste like bacon.  Which make this salad the best. We have family style dish including Six cheese, Rigatoni, carbonara chicken, Tilapia. All this dish are delicious. The closing included the tiramisu and brownie ice cream. 

Overall experience is good. Love the private room and family style.

If talking about street food. This food truck have it. Most Puerto Rican food are mofongo, but rarely about their street food. This owner of food truck from Puerto Rico, they came to United State for better life. They brought local street food with them. 

We got the Alcapurrias. It is Puerto Rico traditional dish with green banana dough with meat. The version we got is the Corned Beef con Amarillos. The outward is corn beef and the inside is sweet plantain. It shape like corn dog. Very interesting. Our second item is the empanadilla jueyes. It is crab meat empanadas. They use real blue crab meat. Very similar to Cuban devil crab but it is empanadas. 

Both dishes are great. The order do take some time. While you waiting for your order, you can go visit other food truck.

The food may be 3.5 stars, however the price match what they selling. Overall is 4 stars. Cheddar secret is affordable price for many and good enough food. It fit into the demographics of The Wesley Chapel. It is really do not matter about the rating. It is about right price for right food. 

I am at the bar area enjoy my dinner for the Sunday night football on TV. I started with the Texas Swirl Margarita. It is beautiful drink with enough frozen frozen drink over strawberry. My entree is the New Orlean Pasta. This dish come with sausage, chicken and shrimp. This dish serve over penne pasta and Cajun Alfredo sauce. It is big dish if you are hungry. 

The service on bar is average. Can be better. Food came out quick. Not much of wait. I like the drinks with different cocktails.

People Dedicated to Quality (PDQ) - what a company mission. This is a concept that actually drawn people to visit. In a way, they also need to measure up with what they stand for. 

The PDQ is really clean and pleasant. I like the open space. Everything is in the organized order. Service is nice. The head chef watches quality of food before send out. Very good quality control. 

I have their new product - Tropic Sizzle. It is the new grilled Hawaiian sandwich. It come with grilled chicken, bacon, grilled slice pineapple, pepper jack cheese. Mmm good to fit into my mouth. I have the zucchini fried on the side. The meal deal is good. Just the sandwich is a bit small. 

We also have 4 pieces chicken tenders. I have ginger berry sauce. This go well. The drink touch screen selection. It with a lot of choices.

Mission Complete!!!!  The Grand Opening is great and run smoothly. Although the staff is not familiar the entire menu but they are well train. Smiling at all time and check on you. 

The sampler is the best way to tried their BBQ with lesser cost. Pricing is average with the amount of food was given. The sampler allow you to choose two or three meat sampler. Or you can have your own combination by adding quarter pound of each meat items. 

Today I have baby back rib and the brisket. The brisket has a choice of moist or lean meat. I would suggest moist is the way to go. The rib cook till fall off the bone. They are still juicy and yummy. I also like their sausage and turkey. Seasoning has reach the inner turkey. 

You can make it a combo by adding single side or two sides. All come with drink. I have green bean bacon a southern dish.

This place is always busy base on the yelper photo and review. We were there at 5:20 pm and we were second in the line. I guess, this is the best time to visit. The restaurant has very limited space if you decide to dine in. They only can seat 15 the most.

Since they are number 1 in the top 100 list, we decided to try them. They have good selection of taco. We have the ribeye, campechano, shrimp, pastor, carnitas, chorizo, and lengua. This strange name but who care. The most important is they good or not. The lengua is the cow tongue. 

The only complaint I have is they need to caramelized a bit will make it better.  My wife like the most is carnitas. It is sherrard or simmering pork. She indicate to me is better than the mojo pork. 

The food do not require to wait for too long to prepared. It is a bit expensive than most taco place. It is cafeteria service order at the counter and they bring it to you.

Jimmy is a popular place in YBOR. Many old customers came here for taco. Also, they have have their parking lot which make very convenient to customers especially in YBOR. The restaurant only has out side seating. May in summer is a bit challenging even they have some cover roof. 

I have the the three taco two pork Texan style taco. And one flour steak taco. I like both of them. The steak taco is highly recommended. The thin slice the steak and grilled them chop. It is good ideal to do it that way because maintain the texture of the steak.

Green food. Healthy for begin of year. Eco provide concept of future. Eat more power grain, green nutrition, natural lean protein and recycled and biodegradable product. This is great concept. I have been here many time. This is the first review. 

We were here for their great bowl. They have mahi mahi with Asian Chili sauce. This bowl I have never have before. I think is their best product. It has rice. I believe is brown or purple rice. The grain, citrus, onion and more. The mahi mahi was grilled perfection. I like the way they have the sauce that match the dish. It is a great dish that I would recommend. 

I also like their juice. They said the building is use 50% reusable energy. Monday is the meatless bogo day. Atmosphere is good. Food come out a bit slow if you order required cook dish. I don't mind.

The store access may be tough to get there if you come from south of Bruce B Down. One good thing they have parking lot is big enough. Especially during Coronavirus period. This store is busy. Parking is full of customers to visit this store. 

The wine and beer may not the cheapest in town. But it has the special may be worth a visit. I got two bottle of Pinot Noir from Russian River Valley region. I also got the special deal of the beer - Goose Island IPA. The check out line is long. But everyone keep a distance. When get close to the payment teller, it is set to minimum six feet apart.

It is about 3.5 stars. I really could not fully assessing this place, because we came at happy hours. It was third stop of our progressive happy hours. We didn't get any food. The drink of the happy hour is very affordable. They don't have food on happy hour because their food is already in good price. 

Because of the happy hour, there was not a live music. One thing we noticed they have open bar widow connected to outside seating which make the inside seating a bit warm. We wonder if the place is full and the temperature is high during live music. This area need to be improved.

This bar is attractive and nicely decorated. Most of the first timer walking through the front door. Many of the regular actually going through the court yard with the side entrance. The counter of the bar is lighted and make it cool. 

They have good enough kitchen to put out some good Mexican food. It is a bit pricey if come to taco but they are more unique. I have the surf and turf, pork belly and blacken lobster tacos. The surf and turf is the grilled steak and blacken shrimp. I think this two should not mix. Steak and fish may be. The pork belly is caramelized sweet. It is good taste. The blacken lobster is the best. It is nice with good lobster meat. 

The bar may need some help. They are too many sit on the bar at 5 pm. They only have one bar tender. The chip and salsa come out slow. However the food come out rather quick.

This is neighborhood Panera. I bike to here for morning break. I have been here several time but never review them. During this pandemic, I can see thing have been change to adopt the ease of customers. Surely dine in is not available. 

They did set a hand sanitizer at the entrance. The order can be done in the store. Payment using the credit card is safer by using the credit card insert electronic card reader without server though it. Then the food is hand to you without touch each other. 

I alway like the bear claw. The creamy drizzle on the top is sweet. The filling inside also enhanced the food experience. The pastry is fresh enough for me to have.

Lolis at Temple Terrace is a better facility compared to the one they have on other brunch. It has outdoor and indoor seating. It is pleasant to sit outdoors because it's under the tree. One thing they definitely improve one's is to clean the outdoor furniture more often. 

This is almost like cafeteria ordering at the counter and then deliver the food to your table. I got the three tacos combinations and my friends got the quesadilla. The three tacos including Carne Asada, pastol, and grilled shrimp. These tacos are pleasant to have. They are in good flavor. The quesadilla has a lot of cheese.

Meat for the taco is in good quantity. The size of three tacos is enough for lunch. This place is very popular due to nearby students visit.

Mott & Hester is a deli food restaurant that serves the community at south Tampa for about 39 years. The cuisine has many interesting selections. Some Italian, Cajun, American and more. They survived this long may be due to their menu variety in different time. 

It is not easy to visit this place because they close early and seldom has dinner service. We got the make your own pasta. I started with angel hair pasta, grilled chicken and end with pesto sauce. It is a good dish. Good enough quantity for a hungry person. My wife has the big Tony Sandwich. It has capicola, ham, provolone with Italian dressing. It is a good sandwich. We also got some of the deli section with dirty rice. 

Food is good in compare to most deli. No wonder they can survive till now. It is local favorite.

For the take out experience is really good. During the thanksgiving day, they still open for business. We order the turkey special for good price. We order on the online and it was accurate per order when I pick up. The estimate timing to pickup is exact. The time I walk into the door the food just ready to pick up. 

It is not fancy turkey lunch. But it is enough for the lunch which help me to have thanksgiving turkey lunch. Since we don't cook turkey during thanksgiving, it is convenient for me to order during thanksgiving day. The meat is juicy. The side is good. It is definitely a plus for my experience.

Whiskey Cake was our first stop on the progressive happy hour gathering. The restaurant have good menu on the happy for food and drink. We like food they serve. A good solid 4 restaurant. 

We started with Wagyu State Fair Corn Dog. The is corn dog you might want to slowly bite to prevent the juice inside spread all over you clothing. I like the corn dog come as 5 pieces to share. The next dish is the short rib poutine. This is beautiful decorated dish. The short rib meat is in it with sunny side up egg on top. It is big to share. The next dish is the duckitos. This a spring roll type duck confit. It is ok dish. My friend got dip and spread trio. Come with three different dip. I think it is ok dish too. 

The service is just ok. To get attention of the waiter is a bit challenging. They need to improve on it. I did get a the great escape on the cocktail. I actually like this cocktail. Pineapple fuse with rum. Nice touch.

3.5 stars is about right rating for this restaurant. They are popular among the local neighborhoods. We saw many African Americans customers when we visited this place. Fried seafood is one of their favorite food. Parking is kind of limited. The seat down table also limited if you want to eat there. Many people ordered to go.  

We got the fried conch as appetizer. This is my first time to have fried conch. The coating is good. We also got the oyster and fish combo box. The oyster is in good pieces. We like the fried shrimp. It was delicious. The fish can have a choice like Basa, tilapia, salmon or mullet. For fried food I like to eat it there. 

There is a wait after ordering. I don't mind with fresh fried seafood. It is good to eat there instead of take home.

They new Wawa flex some new kid in the block muscle along the Fletcher Ave. It also has something that other Wawa do no have. It has the Ethanol Free Gasoline. It predominantly use for boat fuel. Most of the marina has this fuel for $3.60 a gallon. They only sales for $2.60. This offer the alternative for the boater who toll their boat. They can pump up their boat before launch to the water. 

The only con item for this Wawa is they only have one line of gas pump. Normal Wawa has two gas pump in one row and the space of drive through in the middle.

Pepito's After Dark. It sounds like this restaurant in the dark side of the Venezuelan. It plenty of light in the restaurant, don't be afraid of the name call. 

The restaurant is set up like fast food restaurant with service. The food can be order in the counter and deliver to you on the table. We have group of yelpiest people decide to try this restaurant. We have started with Tequenos - cheese wrap dough. This is not bad. We have order the Pepito Basket (grill beef, lettuce and sour cream at corn shape basket), Patacon (pork, lettuce, Parmesan cheese, mozzarella on top on plantain), chicharon de pollo (deep fried chicken), Arepon (chicken at arepa). The one I like the most is the the basket. The beef is well seared to cook and make the taste more desirable. 

Overall the restaurant is good. They do have big screen TV here for any soccer game in South America. It is a community restaurant with affordable price. I enjoy my time here when we have a group to enjoy the conversation.

This is a very authentic Italian mom and pop restaurant. They have their edge for the business because they have chef skill that different than most typical chain store cuisine preparation. We have a group co-worker attending a early lunch there. Since get in before 12 pm, there was no people. Even when we left, they still don't have people visit. 

Price is in the medium high side for lunch. I have order the veal piccata with added some prosciutto ham. They have some up charge. The angel hair is nicely cook. The piccata sauce is good. I would rather them to add more material in the sauce such as fried garlic or artichoke or ham. The veal is right easy to cut and bite. Overall is very good. My friend enjoy their dish. 

Service is good. There is a sense of old Italian setting in the restaurant including the background music playing.

This Greek restaurant is a chain that just open in New Tampa a year ago. They are best system restaurant in this area. What I mean of that is from the time they receive the order to deliver the food is usually on target. Normally for the grilled food is taken more time especially for the kebab. They have enough man power and operation to make the assembly look easy and fast. Our foods deliver in 10 minutes and they are faster than any mini restaurant. I will not call this fast food since the foods are cook to your order. The cook is well train to shorten the time of deliver. 

Tonight we have order on the light side of the menu. By the time we have added on the additional skew, it is not in the light side any more. We have order the lamb kebab and the chicken kebab and added a skew of steak kebab. Good value for dinner under $25 and use the yelp free drink offer by the restaurant. With the coupon, we have the reduction $5 of the total bill. 

The kebab came with the side Greek salad and rice. It also comes with pita bread. The Greek salad is very flavorful. It has a potato salad in the middle of all the mix green (lettuce, tomato, red onion, beets, Kalamata olives, pickle green pepper, cucumber). The soft feta cheese is sprinkle over it. Lovely cheese. The skew meats (chicken, lamb and steak) are marinated and cook over the open grilled. They are will balance spice with Middle Eastern flavor. Taste sensation. I like the steak skew the best. If you take the meat from skew, the flavor stick in the finger with finger licking good. 

The restaurant has small capacity seating. I like the kitchen crew shaving the Gyro with electric ring cutter. It was smoothly shave. Most of the gyro is shaving by knife which has no control of the thickness. This restaurant using the electrical shave has control over the thickness and allows crispiness. I don't like shave it too thick and cause the smell of the lamb Gyro. Technology has improved on food process. Like it.

This restaurant is fast food but not fast. You have wait for them to cook to the order. The burger is 100 percent pure Japanese Akaushi Kobe beef, 2-3 grades higher than USDA Prime. It is heathy burger that you are getting in this joint. 

Monday is a special for any patron that show up in the store and get a 6 oz burger for $5. Normal price is $7. A 29% discount. The burger here has many assembly choices. They are dividing into three categories. First is cheese- the choices are American, aged Swiss, cheddar jack, pepper jack, provolone. You also can add premium cheese such as Mozzarella with additional $1.49. The second selection is the sauce - the selections are monger sauce, ketchup, mayo, mustard, honey mustard, grey poupon, ranch jalapeño ranch, A-1 steak sauce, BBQ, attic goodness sauce, chai chipotle chup. I like my burger plain. The third category is the topping - the choice are lettuce, tomato, balsamic tomato, sweet onion, grill onion, grilled mushroom, jalapeño, dill pickle, onion slaw, banana pepper, tomato relish, roasted red pepper. You also can add bacon for $1.49 more. 

I like my burger with lettuce, tomato, grilled mushroom, and balsamic tomato. The balsamic sauce drip into the burger created the sweetness and combines with the burger meat burn make this taste heavenly good. I will come for more.

This is my neighborhood Publix. It serves well to Tampa Palm Community. This Publix is not visible to main street Bruce B Down. As a result, it is true neighborhood grocery store that convenience to local residents. 

I like our Publix due to their cleanest. The fruit is fresh. They have the sushi freshly made every day. The deli sandwich is good selection. Come to lunchtime, the line is long to get a sandwich or cold cut. The deli is easy for the housewife to pick ready cook items such as rotisseries chicken, fried shrimp and more. Bake good are make fresh daily. The frozen section is great to pick up heated items and ready to cook. I have my favorite such as frozen grilled quail and crab cake.

If you want to try your luck, the lottery is available at service station. Flower, Books, or Wine can be pick up easy and variety of choice. Parking is accessible and direct to the entrance. Publix always serve with smile and help on the push cart if you needed.

Jersey Mike's Sub is my favorite sandwich store. Because they are the only one that carry hot ham (cappacuolo). I have looking for many places and try to buy and slice myself but was not successful. The cappacuolo here is bit spicy and is in good taste. I always orders my sandwich just cappacuolo, lettuce, tomato, and the secret ingredient - bacon!!! I like to order them in wheat bread and spice up my sandwich Mike's way - oil, red vinaigrette, salt, pepper, and mike secret spice. No other thing added such as mayo. This is YUM. 

The sub menu also has the club supreme, original Italian, roast beef and provolone, the super sub. Other than the sub I like above, I like the super sub which is No. 5 sub. Provolone, ham, prosciuttini and cappacuolo and I alway add bacon. This is the restaurant after I have greasy food the night before and I come here to redeem myself. Interesting to said I am redeem with two strip of bacons. 

Other than the cold sub, they also have hot sub such as Steak Philly, big kahuna cheese steak, meat ball, chicken Parmesan, Reuben , chipotle. Lake many sub store start adding the frito chip to create crunchy feeling. I think this direction has ruined many year of tradition.

I have been to this restaurant when they are at the old location. Since they move to this larger seating area area, I have been to this restaurant once. The area have a lot seats to accommodate big banquet. 

Our regular dish that we have order in this place is the sea snail with basil sauce. This is the few places serve this snail that I know in Bay Area. The snails are cook with sweet brown sauce with basil and scallions. To eat it, performed the initial suck on the opening and let the meat come out a bit, remove the meat thin cover. Use the toothpick to pry it out and eat it. Our dish have about 57 snails in a order. 

The restaurant was open in thanksgiving night and we enjoy our time here. The service is good. We also order the the west lake mince beef soup. The beef is process and very tender. The soup is thicken with egg white. It is a good soup.

This Philippino restaurant has good potential. I like the food there because affordable and quick. If you decided for fast food that day, you might as well chose this restaurant. You will have combo meal less than $10. 

We have two meat combo meal. My order is fried milk fish and the fried lechon. This are my two favorite dish. I like the milk fish because of the flavor. The lechon is the fried pork belly. It is crispy when I get it. My wife has the adobo chicken, lumpia and the rice noodle. This food are great. Especially the adobo chicken was cook nice and different from many adobo that I have taste in a good way.

We also have the halo halo. The drink have a lot of thing inside including different types of jelly and bean. Love the purple ice cream. It is fancy. The reason they are not 5 stars is all food are serve at tray and pick your combination. I hope they can cook by order at the spot to keep the food hot by order instead from the seating tray pick up order.

This is hot place for ramen in town. They are not the cheapest in town but good taste. The reservation can be setup or you have to wait for long time at restaurants. They do have the bar section to wait before you sit. 

I have the champon ramen. This supposed to must try ramen. They are $16 is most expensive in the Bay Area. The soup base is good not the best in Bay Area. However, the taste is make up with the accompanying ginger tempura, fried sesame seed and other items make this soup better than most ramen restaurant. I have to said this is not the traditional way of ramen material for pork belly or grilled shrimp. However, it has good flavor. The pork belly do have the three part harmony (skin, fat, meat) cooking. In fact I like their way. The shrimp is great with good touch of marinated and grilled. 

The reason they are 4 stars are as below: 1. I was there at the 5 pm starting the dinner service. The restaurant is empty and they decided call in group by group and take 15 minutes. Ridiculous!  They can go in all the first group to fill the restaurant and they choose not. 2. If you paid $16 dollars for they most like-able ramen, why they don't include all combination include the fermented egg, seaweed, bacon. This is top dollar bowl already. 3. If the price is the most pricy among the ramen restaurant, why we have to sit on stool. Put some comfortable chair please. This is America not Japan. Even in Japan they have seat with back support except the bar counter area. 

This is not to put down a restaurant but a lesson and opinions for the restaurant to improve. Food is good. When the honeymoon period is over, they need to think how to get the customer for revisit. Food is 5 stars.

I was surprised this grocery has some great Italian goods. I thought that this is just a regular grocery store. They carry some interesting grocery items not normally found. They do carry some international grocery items. 

To start, their fresh produce has a lot of varieties. They got it from local market and bag it at the same day. It is also including the live herb that still in the pot. You can get those and pick the leaves and cook for fresh ingredients. 

They have the home made chorizo with buy one and get one free. The home made Italian sausages are displayed in the climate control glass storage cabinets. The flavor includes thick cheese with parsley, mild sausage, kielbasa and more. 

Fresh seafood and prepared seasoning seafood are on display. Giant scallops, fillets tilapia, peeled shrimp are beautifully displayed. Poultry, meat cut was there for your choice. 

I like their ice cream. We have the hazel nut Italian ice cream that is heavenly good.

Haus coffee has a fair price in coffee business. I alway think most of the coffee or tea place are overpriced. But Haus is fair on the coffee price. 

The coffee house also has the pastry, breakfast, or sandwich in mixed. Those item do attract more customers to enjoy. Their corner store has outdoor seating if you bring a pet. 

I was going to get one of the coffee but today they have the pumpkin spice special chai tea. I ask for a cold ice large cup. The chai have good taste. It is rare to get pumpkin spice. But we are close to holloween which has potentially offer this special.

Rick is located  in very seclusion area at the Hillsborough River. It is not too far from the Amateurwork. The river and marina  are good backdrop for the restaurant. The patio seating is good area for the view and enjoy live music. Rick is a sport bar restaurant with minimum TV which is ooze of the improvement that need to made. 

We were here for a glass of beer with food. We started with the little neck clam. I like this dish a lot because of the quality and sauce. It is a dish to get if you visit. 

Our entree is the coconut shrimp dinner and catfish basket. The coconut shrimp is butterfly and fried. It come with sweet sauce. The catfish coating is crunchy. Although the coating is not seasoning but still good for fish fry. 

The service is good. Food come out quick.

After the yelp event. I decided to give them a formal review by visiting them during lunch time. The place certainly is busy. I like the interior decoration during my first visit. It is certainly beautiful and pleasing on the repeat visit. 

This time I got the classic dish with the sampler. The fish I got is the Jambalaya, Crawfish Pie and Chicken File Gumbo. Among three, the crawfish pie is the best. The pie is actually look like the pastry wrap with crawfish and veggies inside. The crust is very good and the flavor is good in the infill. The jambalaya may need a bit more Andouille sausage. I only see two cut pieces in it. The chicken file gumbo has the good gumbo base. Preferably the seafood gumbo. 

Overall my visit is good. Service is good in the bar area. Food come out quick. I was able to finish my lunch less than 40 minutes.

Liang is an old restaurant in New Tampa. I have been here several time but was not give them a review. The restaurant is popular by American Chinese Food. I mean better than normal take out but not authentic enough to call traditional Chinese food. Most dish is more into sweet side. 

We have their lunch special orang chicken and black pepper beef. The orang chicken is their best dish. Good orange peel flavor. The accompanying can have a choice white rice, brown rice or fried rice. Their fried rice is a better choice. It also come with a choice of soup and we got the egg drop. The pepper beef is just like most take out Chinese food. Good beef. 

One thing for sure they did it correctly is their packaging. It is air tight and not spilling out. Good container system. The restaurant is about 3.75 stars. It can survive for long time certainty has it client tail.

I have been to this Wawa many time when I on my way to my badminton game to west side of Progress Blvd. this Wawa has good price in the Riverview area. It has plenty gas pump when there is many car pull in. The only thing I don't like is single roll gas pumps. 

It has Wawa drinks for $1.99 special. The convenience store and sub restaurants is great for grab something and go. Area is clean.

Decent restaurant at the island. The outside sitting area can view the boat dock. You can reach here with the boat or car. The restaurant has modern look interior design. The bar area connect inside and outside with circular bar. 

We have order the lunch menu with lobster roll, salad, and grilled grouper sandwich. The lobster roll looks good with three bun height roll. The grouper come with one side. I have the french fried as a side. The grouper is firm and fresh but the grilled technique need to be improved. It need slightly burn to bring out the meat taste. 

The food came out in very quick time. They must have good kitchen help. I like this way. The service is very good compared to many restaurant. The management of this restaurant is reach the customers goal.

Near Pinellas Park for economic food. It is a Mexican place but has some good enough tacos. Space is very small. Not much of seat but it has the good food. 

I have the Lamb, steak and pastor tacos. They are tasty and quick. It take me less than 30 minutes from order to finished the food and paying. It is fast paced food compared to any fast food restaurant. Price is reasonable and average among the taco joint. 

Service is good and precise. They do have the tamales, steak, grilled shrimp or fried whole fish if you want to spend a little more.

J C has good Caribbean flavor with spicy twist. This restaurant opened during pandemic. It need local love to support them. The restaurant now only accept 14 customers at a time during pandemic. Limited seating. I got a to go order. 

I got the jerk chicken and the oxtail. The jerk chicken has good spicy kick on it. The chicken skin is delicious. The marinated it into the bone. I like that way. The oxtail has thick soupy marinated outside. The meat is fall off the bone. Both dishes come with coconut flavor bean rice. It was delicious. They do have choices on salad or cook cabbage. I would suggest you go for the cabbage. 

From order to pick up is about 15 minutes. Call ahead will be needed. The lunch menu only for weekday. The weekend price same as dinner which I said they are at the high side.

Tonight experience is about 4 stars. We have a reservation on upstairs. The food is as good as last time I have remembered. After first plate 60% of the food is gone. I have enough but some of my friends went down the floor to get the food and they are kind of clean out. I would not call this as buffet. I only can call it as a feast.

Following Coty review and try this place out. Very Good Vietnamese sandwich cafe. It has the local flavor. It located almost like a little Vietnamese town. It near the Vietnamese supermarket. 

Other than the sandwich, they also serve boba cold smoothie. I have the avocado slush. No bad at all. I also order the BBQ pork and the ham sandwich. The BBQ pork is typical char siew pork. But their own type BBQ sauce. It is ok. 

Overall they are good taste. You can get everything under $10 for quick snack. Since is order fro counter, tip is up to you.

About 3.5 stars. The drive through can be faster. It take some time to clear the line due to single window. The recent new addition is the smoke house chicken. This bourbon black pepper flavor. It was delicious especially the coating. Definitely you need to give a try for the new recipe. 

The chicken skin is crispy. Brown sugar and pepper coated. It is a good delicious chicken with capture the juiciness. It come with gravy mash potatoes and a sweet top coated biscuit. I have not been to church chicken for long time. But this is a recipe to keep.

This is a Spain cuisine restaurant with music venue at weekend. You can book a private event. It is quite a busy booking. Sometimes the booking is a wedding rehearsal or baby shower. 

The food of the restaurant is average for Spain cuisine. But I would say try their tapas. It is great to enjoy their tapas at the weekend and have some wine with live flamenco guitar music. They have the music every week end. Please check their calendar. 

The reason they are four stars is they have the flamenco dance and dinner show on every month. The show team has three female dancers and one male dancer. Man oh man! They are good. Very move is a posture of art. The flamenco guitar add the twist of the show. It almost like a whole band. I would said this is the best flamenco show in the Bay Area.

Good healthy choice. I would recommend this place. They are USF student and faculty favorite. The food is just like it Name. Fresh and good for you. 

We have an office lunch and we have a group order of 8. I got the Power Bowl and the Ahi Tuna. The power bowl is saute'ed carrots, kale slaw, brown rice and quinoa mixed with almonds, raisins, goat cheese and homemade kale-basil pesto. I am ok with the kale basil pesto sauce. But the salad bowl is great because it has the pre mix sauce in it. 

The Ahi tuna was seared correctly. I believe the outside is coated with spice that very close to all bay seasoning. The seafood is good since the tuna is sushi grade. If you feel like to cut down your protein, this is your good place. The eight orders we got was correct per the order.

Previously this location was occupied by the other taco food truck call El Charrito. Now it is new food truck for this place and also serve taco. I got here before the rain. Thanks goodness they have overhead cover to allow the customer to stay dry next the the food truck. It has about three table under the tent if you decide to eat there. 

Today I have the steak, pastor, carnitas, and lengua taco. All tacos are $2 except lengua is $2.50. All taco come with 2 corn tortillas in case you break one and the other can be addition protection from the meat to fall apart. The pastor pork has a lot of flavor. It is the different way to marinate the pork I have seen for all my taco experience. The taco is tasty and good for snack or quick lunch. Food delivery is quick. Don't need to wait long.

About 4.5 stars restaurant. Close to 5. I like the food here. This restaurant really have a charm in Tampa Bay Area. A long history that survived for that long should have they secret of success. They do have one of the best court yards and party room. 

They cuisine is Mexico St Miguel region food. I got the Enchiladas Miguel. This dish top with St Miguel Enchiladas sauce is really good. Not sure where they mixed this sauce. But is really good. The grilled beef is great beef and good marinated in the Enchiladas. I would definitely recommend this dish at lunch. 

My wife have the Chile Relleno. This dish is interesting. It is Poblano Pepper fill with spicy pork. Basically you have to open up the pepper to see the spicy pork inside. Great presentation. 

For the appetizers we have the ceviche. Mexican ceviche is different than most Latin ceviche. It is shrimp and scallops toss with avocado, olives, cilantro with their homemade cocktails sauce. It does not use lime. Very interesting. 

Service just good. May be need more attentive. My waiter is too busy on other table. Sign of area need improvement.

TBD is not to be determined. It is Tea Bowls and Desserts. Get it. This kind of Filipino food with boba tea and nice dessert. Certainly is worth a visit for your money. Imagine you can get a bowls with boba tea for $10. Not many place has that kind of price. If you order a bowls of food, the drinks is $2 extra. Each bowl roughly $8. Great deal. 

My Friend Mark was here make me book mark this place. We got the chicken Adobo and the beef Kaldereta bowls. The chicken adobo has good flavor. Especially the rice is very good. My wife like it. The beef is no bad either. I would said for the price is good enough. We also order the combo with drinks. Only $2 extra. I got the Fancy Fruit Basket herbal tea with boba and added honey for sweetness. It is good and the boba is soft. My wife got the Berry Hibiscus tea with boba. I like that one too. Next definitely try their lychee dragon pearl tea. This is a ball shall Tea leave. Must be interesting to sip. 

The owner was very friendly.

This a cafe and restaurant. This is different restaurant who has the similar name. We like to give it a try. They have good Cuban sandwich. Other than that, the Cuban cuisine is good here also. I would start to say this is very affordable restaurant. I can get meal same price like Mc Donald and is full cook meal. Go figure.

I have ordered the Vaca Frita with two side of sweet plantains and the collar white bean soup. The soup is really excellent. The plantains did not over burn. Perfectly prepared. I have order my Vaca Frita extra crispy which mean burn a bit. When the flank steak burn, it taste better. 

Our time here is great. This was the second restaurant stop of the night. We are not really hungry but to see what they have. Good service. The only thing I can say is only one server entire night. I think is overloaded for her. But she got it and very good on handling it.

Cute restaurant with good sushi and ok Thai food. This sum the restaurant for the food. To me I would go for the sushi. Restaurant is not busy during lunch. But a lot of take out. 

I have the Pad Kee Mao (drunken noodle) and my friend has the Pad Thai. I specify ask my noodle to to very dry which mean on the wok longer. But the kitchen doesn't do it. The waiter only tell may be next time I am here they will try again. But when is the next time. My friend like his pad Thai. We also have the Chirashi. The chirashi is better than than their Thai food. The sushi rice at the bottom was well marinated. The serve with nine pieces of sashimi and very thick cut. They masago and dry seaweed leave sprinkles over it. 

Service is good. But I think the instructions to the kitchen can be better.

To locates this taco place, you have to look at the back alley way. They do not have the store front facing the street side. It is within the Hillsborough Ave Farmers Market. It is open air taco place with a roof over the taco trailer. Good thing that many open air taco place do not have it is a place to wash your hand before handle the taco. They have the running water sink you can wash your hand. 

We have ordered three tacos - Pastor, Carnitas, and the Steak taco. The best is the steak taco. It come with seasoning and pan grilled. The carnitas is tasty also. Their shredded pork was marinated. They have single corn tortillas which may break easily. The bottle opener affix the the trailer need to replace since it is rusted. 

Overall our experience here is good. They have some room to improve. Their green hot sauce that go with the taco stand out.

Poke LuLu has fresh seafood on poke and good quality. This restaurant is a vendor in the food court. During the weekend they got a lot of attention. Line build up during lunch time. The customer are here to get poke and boba drink. 

We got their House Poke. If you like different protein with two or more, this preset bowl may be your choice. The poke has salmon, shrimp, and spicy tuna. Which make this bowl good combo. My with have create your own bowl. She pitch the eel. It come with two big pieces of eel. The bowl is bigger than the House poke and better price. 

We like both of our poke. Good quality and quantity. We also got the Thai tea boba. It is tall and skinny cup. Which usually don't fit well with cup holder. But it look good. The drink is good.

This restaurant name like we need to eat like a cat and left the fish with bone and head. Fortunately, the chef is kind enough to fillet for all the customers. Personally, I like whole fish to eat and left only the bone. With that said, their brand is to have good seafood. I always have good respect for this restaurant. 

We start with corn chowder with lump crabmeat. The chowder is great. However I would suggest sautéed the crab meat which will make this soup more superior. 

Our entrée are the grilled red fish. This very good dish. It is not in the regular menu. Redfish is bit harder to catch. The meat definitely is nice and good. It is accompanied the string green bean and crawfish etouffee. This is very excellent dish. 

Our next entrée is sirloin and crab cake. I like the crab cake but the sirloin is average. It come with two side and I have crab fried rice. Again, the crab meat need to include in the fried rice while they stir fry. Not added with broil lumb crab meat. 

The service is great. It has seamless coordination.

Authentic Cuisine # 58. Moroccan Cuisine. 

First Moroccan food in Tampa Bay Area that I have. The Moroccan restaurant is located near USF area which has a lot of Muslim residents is good choice to support the restaurant. Their cuisine is unique. I will try this food here and will compare them when I travel to Morocco in two months. 

We got the couscous with meat and veggies. This dish only serve at Friday and Sunday. It is a special dish. The dish cost is $16, I think this is a higher than average around this area with not much of meat. The couscous is amazing. The meat is so so. But the veggies is really good. May be I am hungry. 

My wife got a traditional dish with chicken tagine. This chicken serve with olive sauce. The sauce is wonderful. I like this dish better. It serve with pita. The sauce and pita go together. Lovely dish. 

Overall our experience is great. People are nice here. My recommendation is the chicken tagine.

It is about 3.5 stars. This is my third Liquid Nitrogen ice cream store I have visit. This one considering is on higher than average pricing. Many other store already including one topping in one price. Here topping is additional 65 cents. 

I like liquid nitrogen ice cream because I can select any flavor or combination of the flavor to mixed the flavor that you have never thought off. We got the tiger blood and pistachio flavor mixed in. This is different ice cream that mad scientist can made. 

I like it very much for the flavor. It is cool to see the liquid nitrogen smoke under the blue light. Make this alien encounter.

This restaurant has good authentic use of Indian spice along with fresh ingredients to prepare the food. This very sum up of this review. It is close to 4.5 stars for the way they have prepared the food. I like is very much. The reason they are 4 stars is the quantity they have served in the dinner time. Their portion is small for the dinner. But some people just eat a lot of rice with curry sauce. 

If I come to the buffet, I may have rate them 5 stars. We have the Fish Molee and the Beef Malabar Curry. The fish is Basa and fried first before the curry. Love the turmeric, green chili, ginger and coconut milk. This is a good dish to enjoy because the coconut curry is out of the wold. 

The beef malabar is good spice. We east the meat and take the sauce home. It is still good to enjoy with the rice. The spice is deep touch with nice medium spicy curry.

Alvarez has a good affordable food. Highly recommended. This is actually their second store. It actually a good restaurant even they have second store. Many restaurant has second restaurant will not be able to keep up on the second place. I hope they continue to strive for the best for both store. 

I got the steak quesadilla. Normally they don't serve steak quesadilla, they only serve ground beef quesadilla. Because of my request, they make a special steak quesadilla from chop steak. It was quite good. The other dish is ground beef burrito. It is fat burrito and big enough for hungry person. The last dish is the Plátanos Rellenos. It use sweet plantain as base. Top with cook ground beef, lettuce and Mexicano cheese. Delicious. 

I order the dish then come back to pick up. It is still good when eat at home.

Solid 4 stars restaurant. The restaurant located on the south of Bush very close to Bush and Armenia. It has good Peruvian stir fried. Stir fried technique here definitely has the Chinese cuisine secrets. 

We have order the Anticicho de Corazon. The grilled beef heart. This is not the best in the bay but very close. One good thing is they give you a lot quantity in the dish. Definitely the quantity will be count into more stars. It come with two side. The Peruvian golden corn and the slice potatoes. It is the dish I would recommend. 

Our second dish is Lomo Saltado. This typical Peruvian stir fried dish. It come with two side. We have order the yuca and the white rice. The stir fried technique is in high BTU wok like Chinese cuisine. It is one of the best in the bay. 

Service here is attentive. It you looking for good Peruvian. This may be an option for you.

This 3.5 stars restaurant is correct from my fellow Yelper. It is above average for the rating. A few things I like about this restaurant is about their choices on the burger and services to bring the food and clean the table quick enough.

We have been here several time. But this is my first time order the Number 12 burger - The Ahi Tuna. I like their mixed of sauce that on the burger. It has the caramel soy sauce with a bit of sweetness on it. The fish is sushi grade with Panko crusted on the coating and lightly fried. It come with avocado which accommodate well in the burger. We also has the OMG burger number 10. It is double patty close to half pound meat. It has two big pieces of smoke bacon on top. Love it. 

Food is good here. What make them no much competitive is price. Burger range from $7 to $10. Add other side can get you to $14. It is regular restaurant price. I still consider this is a fast food joint but not quite with twist of different in table service. I do like the Gourmet part of the burger.

I like a restaurant has optional by items section. This is a bakery and restaurant combo. Allow you to have a Bakery baked good and food. The seating space is limited. During the pandemic not many people are dining in anyhow. Most of the customers had to go orders.

We also have some takeout orders. We saw some bakeries displays on a glass container. It has a good cheese bake goods. We got some of them. One thing interesting is they sell the food by pieces. We got some Chicharrón, blood sausage, regular sausage, in and empanada.

They also serve some cooked meals like bistec, fry pork, Carne Asada. Overall Our experience is very good. Definitely come back for dinner.

Today I am using their drive through for ordering. It was rain cat and dog. I am happy to see the kiosk order cover section at their drive through without get wet while order. It was without delay at the pick up window to paid and received the order. 

I order the half chicken special. It was well cook with good marinated sauce. The marinated went to skin deep. But flavorful. The rice and bean also good to have. The order was well conducted. Food is good for the drive through and accurate with the order.

The food compare to actual urban area of Tampa is budgetary. It is lesser than Tampa. It become affordable. This restaurant located at US 301 make it easy to access. Everything in historical downtown Zephyrhills is walking distance. So does this restaurant. 

The menu is extensive and all items are under $10. The category divided to appetizer, combo plate, beef noodle, rice platter, fried rice, noodle bowls, egg noodle soup. The selection of protein included grilled pork, grilled shrimp, grilled chicken, grilled beef, fried fish, grilled pork chop, grilled fish and veggies. We got the today special fried frog leg. It come with 8 drum frog leg. This leg is massive. The coating and accompanying sauce are flavorful. 

Our other dish is grilled pork chop rice. It has good enough seasoning. It come with rice, pickle veggies and spring roll. It has large enough portion for a person. Service is good and attentive. Seating is comfortable.
