Are we tired of most of the national chain coffee shop. It is nice to to have a chance in brand name. This local coffee shop located at downtown that serve northern part of the downtown area. They do Catering and provide sandwich and munch. The place is trendy. I like vibrant atmosphere. 

Today I am going for the mocha ice coffee. It is a bit chocolatier but have all the mojo. Good tasty coffee. Just to let all you know, caffeine never affects me. Most of the time I drink coffee is for the flavor and pleasure. They do have good flavor.

Very good burger place. It is very close to 4.5 stars. It has many choices. There are may choices of Black Angus burger. They have good list of burger. 

The restaurant outside seating make it convenience for the dog owners in downtown area. Especially this restaurant is close to Curtis Hixon dog park. I got the glass of beer with burger. Good local beer. For the burger, I got the Franklin Street burger. This burger come with Kaiser Roll bun. I like the bun. The burger has angus beef patty, pull pork, smoke brisket, and bacon. Very complicated combination. By it work and very tasty. Excellent burger. 

Service is good. The turn on light on the outside side so we don't eat at the dark. I also like the skinny fries. Very good fried.

This is the biggest Land and Sea I been to. The area is big. They carry a lot of items including the baked goods. Non to say they have a lot kind of seafood, their meat department has some good selection. 

We were here at Friday searching for boneless beef short rib. We could not find this item in many grocery stores but Land and Sea carry it. When we visited this place they run the special on Friday. BOGO with one pound get one pound free for the short rib. Good deal. I would suggest checking up their special of the day. We also got the mini crab cake for good deal. Some of the special is reduce in price from their regular price. 

They have pre-seasoning food too. You can take home and follow the label instructions to cook. It is convenient. If want some wild caught fish, they also carry it. This store not only carry meat and seafood, they also carry veggies for one stop shopping.

This place holding a lot of young people heart. I can see the average age who visited here is about 30 or below. Somehow this place feel young. The DJ play it music at the bar area. This may be the major attraction. 

We were here for the taco week. It have some deal. But the taco is one of the best quality. We got the three blackened shrimp taco. It come with top as cabbage, pico, avocado, queso fresco, sour cream, sweet thai chili, and cilantro. The shrimp is blackened with southern style. The flavor is good and desirable. 

The margarita is part of the deal with three taco. It is ok not to kill for. Overall our service is great. I would recommend if you come to downtown for light snack and drinks.

I was surprised my credit card company put this store as grocery. It the same way, they sell bread and sandwiches. Not sure the actual category need to be. We were here for their promotion of the buy one sandwich and get sourdough cinnamon bun free. The free bun is actually a sourdough material. Interesting. 

We have two sandwiches. My wife have the Italian sandwich. She start Tampa Sandwich Bread. The selection she got is Italian that come with ham, salami, pepperoni. It is quit good. I have the BST which is come with bacon, tomato, and spinach. My bread is roasted red pepper. The sandwich is good. 

We only need to wait a little while for the preparation. Not bad. I do like the sourdough cinnamon bun. It is quite interesting.

Very interesting brewery. Good thing they have a permanent food truck to keep door open during pandemic. The people who go there are very friendly. Their space is big enough to have many patrons. The put side seating have good setup with plenty of seat. I am not sure they allow dog on the outside. But worth a try. 

The selection of beer is good. I like the Diddy. It is a German Pilsner. The selection includes other like Lager, Stout, Cider, sour beer, wheat beer, bock, IPA, and Ale.  It has good collection. The size is just good.

3.5 stars food truck. This is Puerto Rican food served here. They have mofongo, tostones o papitas. They have good wide selection. This food truck is kind of tuck away from the road. If miss the entrance, you may have to U turn. 

We were here first time to buy a bowl of Carrucho. The marinated conch. It is big pieces. But we feel that taste like chicken. Not sure is the best since we are not best judge of the Puerto Rican cuisine. 

When come to second visit, we got the pulpo. It is the octopus. This one is much better. It does come in good chop amount of the octopus. The marinated sauce accompanying well with octopus. Great small dish with wine at home with football games. 

Overall is good. Definitely will go for the pulpo. Food here is a bit pricey for food truck.

Zephyrhills start to has their own brewery. This one is located at downtown prime location. They have the outside beer garden and street view seat. Many people has use this advantage for the viewing of Christmas parade.

I have try their Belgium Blonde. This is light beer with good taste. The brewery is busy and the patrons are sharing the table with each other and have good conversations. They have table order service is you don't want to go to counter to get your beer. 

The indoor is nice and well lid. Plenty of seat to host big party. I bring my food there while enjoying a glass.

Solid 4 stars. It is because the cost vs value of the food. There a few positive thing about this place. The service is excellent. The store provide the complimentary brownie cake with coconut flakes. Love it. It good promotion to get the restaurant going. 

We three taco combo. The taco is divided to classic and specialty. Any in the specialty taco add $0.50 each taco. We got the campechano, grilled grouper, and grilled shrimp tacos. I paid extra dollars for the specialty taco. Which worth it. The combo plate come with chip, salsa, and a drink. Not bad at all. My wife got the steak quesadilla. The steak is well grilled. 

I would recommend the campechano and grilled shrimp tacos. It was delicious. Food come out quick with not much wait. Seating is limited but enough for the dine in conditions.

Rock and roll in food sum the restaurant. One of the founder is Gene who is KISS group. They restaurant is very popular at weekends. As a result, we pick a weekday to avoid the crowds. I like the set up with rock and roll music videos at the background. High ceilings open dining hall. Choices of inside or outside dining. Love the set up. 

We start with the Mango Habanero wings. It come with 9 wings with $1.4 per wings is in the high price side. The wings did a good job with ghost pepper. My entree is the Blackened Redfish. This dish come with vegetables medley and rice. It top with crawfish sauce. Crawfish also taste good like Cajun. A very rare dish to have. My wife have the Carolina Slow Roasted Pork. The sauce is honey mustard sauce which is very similar to the BBQ we have when we travel to North Carolina. It come with steam veggies and we upgraded to sweet potatoes fried. 

I like the happy hour drinks. I got the house Margaritas and it is big for me. Please keep it up. It is the reason customers coming back.

This restaurant has good Thai taste. The only thing is they didn't turn the spicy heat up when I ask them for Thai hot. Overall they are good restaurant. 

We start with the Kai Tod Had Yai the blacken chicken wing. The wing has some marinated spice. This is southern Thai dish. Blacken wings with deep fried. The spice is above average. It come enough wing to share. 

The entrée are Grouper Chu Chee and curry pork. The curry pork dish is good. But the the Grouper Chu Chee is my flavor. The grouper was slightly fried with crispy coating. It top with their homemade curry. According to the menu is a mix of coconut milk and soy sauce. It is great and healthy fish to have. 

During our visit, the traffic of the Christmas Day is low. But they may be the few restaurants that open for that day. The service is good and attentive.

It is about 4.25 stars. I like their new location in Tampa. I have been to their St. Pete location but this Tampa location is much better. I like the high ceilings open space. It brings value and comfort level to the customers. The ambiance and decoration is very nice. An open space with kitchen viewing available. 

We got the Housemade Sausage and Roasted Pepper pizza. It is good size pizza. The ingredients is very nice. But the the cheese and ingredients are not spread to outer edge of pizza which creates a lot of crust area. This area they need improvement. 

I also got the Wood Grilled Marinated Skirt Steak. This is my favorite steak. It has good qualities and quality of the skirt steak. It is marinated with sweet sauce. It was cook to requested temperature. It also come with broccolini and mash potatoes. I also like the herd green sauce the have on the steak. I hope they don't reduce the steak quantity in the future. 

Service is good. Seating is comfortable, spacious and good lighting in compare to St Pete location.

Jin China is a fast food American style. I have been many Chinese fast foods and I never like any of it. However, this one is the most welcome among all Chinese fast food. My review is only base on the lunch. 

I usually like to stop on the newly opened restaurant and decided to try this one. The lunch special is really worth the value. You are here not for the great taste of Chinese food but for the something quick and fresh. The special is $5.50 with lunch cook at the spot and a soft drink. Very good deal. I have the schezuan pork with fried rice. The veggies in the pork are crispy which mean very fresh. Like it that way. Some restaurants don't have the controls of the material. This restaurant is next to MD oriental market and they can get fresh produce immediately.  

Please call ahead because needs 10 minutes to prepare.

We were expect bar food before we arrive at this place. The restaurant look like normal bar. Not many customers during weekdays. We look at the menu and feel the items are very interesting. Not many place serve hog fish, this is one of the few I can count. 

I got the main dish as grilled blackened hog fish. It come with fried and the coleslaw. The portion of fish is big enough. Fish is fresh. It has good blackened taste. 

Our appetizers are the the Irish Stew and Aran Island Shepherd's Pie. The Irish stew serve in the sourdough bread bowl. The stew meat was slow cook in red wine and Guinness beer. It is delicious. The Shepherd pie is different than most shepherd pie I have. It serve on potatoes skin. 

As you can see, this is not you typical bar food. The chef has good skill. Definitely a different type of food with great restaurant standard. I will definitely come back for the hog fish.

This ice cream store opened during pandemic. That was the time that the pandemic just began. I glad that they still operate and serving the community. We wish they hang on the business and continue. Their story includes good ice cream flavor, sandwiches and empanadas. 

The flavor is very interesting. It includes mint chocolate chip, mermaid (cotton Candy), beach bum ( coconut, caramel, chocolate and almond), sea salt kisses and more. My wife have the Santa Letter - it is a lot of stuff including brownie, mint and other stuff. It is interesting. I have the eggnog. I love the taste of seasonal flavors. 

We got beef empanadas. It is good snack for the night. They fried the empanadas fresh from order. We did not go for the the Nutella empanadas. It must be interesting. May be next time we will try it. Overall the store allow taste try. Which is good for the customers.

I always a fan for Jersey Mike. They are just few sandwich store has the capicola ham. This is a spicy ham that has some kick of spiciness in it. I usually have them add extra meat with the ham. Then top with lettuce and tomato. I have the mikes way spice including salt, pepper, red vinegar and oil. Lastly have them top with two strips of bacon. That will be my lunch. 

Their sandwich is the best that I like. Although the local Cuban sandwich is great, but I pick over Jersey Mike's sandwich. 

You can get a combo with drink and chip. I like their southern sweet tea. You can cumulate point for free sandwich with your home phone. The service is quick here. They also has numerous hot sub to select including the Philly Cheese Steak. This location is a bit small compare to the one that Bruce b Down near USF.

I have a gift card can be use and we are happen to be close to this store. The Parking lot looks empty at 2:30 during that time. The store may be only three customers including us. May be this is the best time to shop since they are not busy. 

This is the biggest and nicer ABC that I have been through. I like the high ceiling that make the store elegant. They have many sections like wine, beer, spirit, imports and more. I am surprised that they have a big section of the hand roll cigar section. The display is very nice. Some of them is our local hand roll cigar. 

I use my gift card get some of the import beer and American brew. I got the Blonde Guinness the American Lager. The taste is average like regular American beer. Guinness usually has stouts which is very good when you age it. But this Blonde is just average. I was surprised that Guinness has a brewery in U.S. I also have the Innis and Gunn from Scotland.  This is the rum oak aged beer. This is very interesting beer for winer (wine enthusiastic) like me. The experience has oak flavor and in beer. Nice taste. 

The beer price is average compare to other wine and spirits store. I like this store that is well presented, nice parking lot, clear label section.

Good sushi can be found here. The lunch special give you few buck different compare to dinner. With that said, their sushi price is reasonable also at dinner. I have book mark this place due several of my fellow Yelper friends check in. 

They have good interior work pleasant to customers. We were here for lunch. The items we have try are spicy tuna, lobster roll, jaguar roll, hibachi combination with selection of salmon and scallops. Their sushi chef prepared correctly. Spicy tuna has good mixed of ingredients and taste. This is my first time with the fried eel roll - Jaguar roll. It is good to try it. The lobster roll has real lobster inside. 

The hibachi combo is good way to enjoy. The scallops are sea scallops compared to most of the places give you bay scallops. The salmon was sear with outside crispy. The combo come with fried rice, noodle, veggies, ginger salad and soup. 

Service is good. Sushi rice a bit soft.

I have night work last night and I am free to lunch anyway today. We choose to come to this Koizi location instead of the Tampa Palm location. The chef here is better than the Tampa Palm Koizi. They must learn their lesson from the older Koizi. The restaurant is bigger and the food comes out faster. 

At Tampa Palm the line and wait is longer. Here I was seated immediately. Like it. Interior is well decorated and spacious. We have order many thing from the menu. This is our first time we order the QQ ball-Chicken and Beef grounded ball. It serves with sweet sauce. I like their habachi with Sirloin. The meat is soft and tender. 

We also have the Mt. Fuji Roll looks like lava flows from the top. I always order my favorite spicy tuna roll. It did not disappoint me. The rainbow roll interior crab meat is marinated with flavor. Compare to Bay Area endless sushi, Koizi has better flavor.

Cold Stone was our second choice tonight since other desert place is long line due to graduation. But we happy to be here with no line. They have out side sitting but the night is cold to sit outside. 

Cold Stone Is a decent ice cream store. The R & D of the ice cream did very good job to create the standard ice cream flavor. Good choice of ingredients for your selection to be mixed. The ice cream certainly mix it correctly over the frozen stone on the counter. Clerks very friendly on this this store they also very polite. 

I have the banana caramel. It has nut and bananas in the mixed. The only downside is melt quickly after mixed. Probably the cold Stone counter need to have the the temperature drop to the desired cold or chilled. However, it doesn't hide the great flavor.

1-21-2017 was the first day of business opening. This will be their third store in Tampa area. We were just in time when we walk in there and no customers after the parade. Immediately after our order, the store was jam pack. 

Popsicle is suddenly back to fashionable ice cream. Hyppo has many flavors to choose. They have many fruits flavor. I already like the jack fruit. But that night I chose the pistachio coconut with a dip in chocolate. I never have a popsicle dip in chocolate before. The chocolate form a thin crust that make it more interesting. I like the flavor. 

The sitting area is small. I like the window sitting. The wall painting is nice with "There are so many ways to eat a pop".  The hours is friendly to about 10 pm on week day and 11 pm at weekend.

Some of my Yelpiest friends have their regular visit this place a lot. The ice cream store give out the dog treat and the outside sitting is suitable for the dog. 

Some Bruster's Real Ice Cream has inside sitting, but this one is all outside sitting only. It is great during May and November when the weather is mild. Florida has too hot sun that beat up the pavement which preserve the heat will not play well for the outside sitting. The ice cream melts faster if you are not hurry. As a result I got my ice cream and sit in the car to enjoy it longer. Other reason is fighting with mosquito while you eating the ice cream outdoor. Other than that, I like the Bruster's Ice Cream. 

Bruster's ice cream has many offers. Sometime they have buy one waffle cone get one free, Flag Day $1 ice cream, coupon to purchase, frequent visit punch card and more. Please check their web site for the offer.

Don't get me wrong, this is a good ice cream joint. I visit a lot to this place then any other place.

I have been to this restaurant several time. I like the outback at this particular location due to their service, material control, chef skill are top of their own chain restaurant. Tonight is special new year eve night. My wife call ahead for on system reservation. When we get there, there are already a lot of people waiting. The hoster said it need 1.5 hour of wait. We tell them our reservation and we waited for 20 minutes. 

We sat down at 6:15 and the line is still building up after we have left at 7:40 pm. We came here today is not about the new year eve. It is about the Wednesday special 3 course meal $12 and up. It came with soup or salad and desert at entree price. I have chicken totier soup with 12 oz prime rib and my wife have the Parmesan chicken. The  totier soup is tomato base with spicy flavor and chicken chunk. The cheese melt in the soup make the spoon feed with dragging line of cheese from the bowl. The prime rib is an open grilled cooking and it is about a inch thick. It marinate with pepper corn and salt. They grilled to folk tender medium rare. It came with grill asparagus. My wife Parmesan chicken have the cheese on top and lite spice of garlic and salt. This make the Parmesan crispy when it oven baked. The crispy crush make the food more flavor to eat. 

The overall service tonight is a bit slow due to crowded condition. The line still build up.

There are two BBQ near this exist of I-75. This one is only 0.6 mile from I-75. I am thinking to give a try this afternoon. This restaurant have unique selection of the rib. St. Louis style with dry rubbed; sticky bone is St. Louis style with caramelized; meaty back rib is tradition with selection of oversize meaty area of rib; of course there is traditional back rib. 

I have the tradition baby back with sweet potatoes fried and BBQ baked bean. The full rack of the rib with one side is $11.99 and two sides is $13.49. What a price. Enough said, time to get your hand dirty. The best part to eat and enjoy the rib is by hand. The rib is dry rubbed and top with hickory smoke BBQ source. The meat juicy and pink. Because this is a dry rubbed, the meat is tendency to stick with bone a little bit. 

With the yelp help, I was able to find this place. Thanks for those who have yelp before me. The rib at my plate is more than 12" long. Mmmmm!  This good.

Butcher or BBQ. Both. I like BBQ side better. Their menu has included slice brisket, pull pork, chicken, St. Louis rib, kicking Wang (wing). Other than the typical menu, they also have chicken in biscuits, Korean Philly, burger, fried bologna sandwich. One thing catch my that I did not order is their side item watermelon salad. May be next time. 

I got the brisket a la carte. The brisket is juicy and carry very minor fat to make it tender and juicy. The minor fat is the best way for the brisket to be grilled. The meat is well marinated. May be I will try their burn end next time. This dish serve with choice of BBQ sauce. I got the spicy honey and sweet BBQ sauce. Both are good. 

The only downside is you have to wait there for your food to be made. I would prefer some system to inform the customers when the food is ready for pickup.

This seafood place do not have table to eat in the store. Mainly you have to order to go. If you thinking a picnic or lunch to go, this is a good place for seafood items. This isn't hole in the wall place but in a rough neighborhood. 

When you walk into the store, the live blue crab is crawling in the glass counter display container. It shows you they cook these crab live. They have live seafood and the fresh catch of the day. The choice of seafood is a lot. Blue crab is their special. It can come with garlic butter or deep fried with coating. They also have fried scallops, Asian Cajun style live cook crawfish, fried shrimp and more. 

We have the captain trio $10.99 - fried blue crab, shrimp and fish. If you substitute the fish to grouper add $2. The deep fried shrimp is very good. This dish also give two big pieces of fish, 4 blue crabs. Out of the four blue crabs, 3 of them have a very good blue crab with very tender smooth meat. I think this dish is the best value. However their best seller is the garlic butter blue crab.

To America - the Mexico style street vendor is here. This is very unique ice cream store that can be found in Tampa Bay. Most of the food and drink here are home made.

They made their own ice cream with various flavor. Most of the names of ice cream are in Spanish. Who care, they just need to be delicious. They also have ice cream in the stick or Popsicle. You can see the real fruit sticking out. Again, they have many flavors. Each one is in very reasonable pricing. In the store they also have the specialty drink. Non alcohol. But it is similar to street sweet treat in Mexico. I have sample for the pinacoloda, mango, tuna. Tuna drink??? It is actually cactus drink. In Mexico they call it tuna. Strange name. The drink is two dollars each. 

The store items are affordable below $. It is great experience to go to ice treat store like this.

Simply Pho has the right location to start the restaurant. The restaurant interior design is attractive and eye pleasing to customers. The restaurant have small capacity for the sitting, I can predicts they are going to get busy due to the affordable pricing and good food. Try it now while you can get sit easily. 

Today we only try a very little section of the menu. The menu has two pages. They have offer the pho, Hu Tieu southern Vietnam noodle soup, stir fry noodle, vermicelli, fried rice, and the special. They also have variety of appetizers. 

We have order the pork skin roll, pork sausage roll, roasted quails and southern Vietnam combination (Hu Tieu). The pork skin roll is wrapping like a fresh roll with peanuts and pork skin. This is a blend taste fresh roll. The pork sausage roll is also a fresh roll with charbroil pork sausage. The pork is well grilled and has a wonderful taste. I like this roll. 

The roast quails are not the best in the Bay Area but they are excellent dish. The dish come with salt and pepper on the side which I think you can eat without it. The quail smell good and I always eat with my fingers. 

The southern combination noodle soup is in clear broth. This is not pho but it is wonderful dish and very light. It is good for people who are in weight watching. The noodle is the medium size egg noodle. The soup come with combination seafood and slices pork. 

Overall the experience is good. The service is good also. The waiter and waitress are still learning the menu. I will be back for the second page menu.

Record, CD, Book. What a combination. It is close the USF where you find your music in the pass. This kind store is getting harder to find. Although this not the future technology, but it has a goodie of the old song that you never think of. 

The store is very cute. Sometime they have live show or music. If you need a LP, they have plenty. Book every way. Store like this alway have a coffee shop inside. I have the Mexican Mocha. It is a spicy coffee. Mmmm. SPICY. 

They also have Japanese Yama Coffee. This coffee suppose to be the high caffeine coffee for Japanese. The distillery is display on the side. Funny looking.

There thing they did a good job for the customers. Their drinks is one of good things. The restaurant has contemporary comfort look. I like the wide area with game available to be use by the customers. Seat is comfortable. 

I have honey dew with Aiyu Jelly. I would they are the first that have this. This is a summer drink to cool down at Taiwan. Aiyu is made from dried fig fruit seed. This place are the first I know use Aiyu jelly. The tea is fragrant and nice. My wife has the the butterfly tea. All tea come in large size. It was great for the price paid. 

We also got the bah mi. It is good also. We like this store with new type jelly.

We were here for the dinner happy hour before 6:30. The place do not have a good access if you come from the east of Bearss Ave. we eventually got to the place with a lot of turn. The plaza have plenty of parking space if you need to get to the restaurant. 

I would they about 4.5 stars restaurant. For the happy hour dinner, definitely 5 stars. We got one of the top seller Lama rolls. It is flame torch over the salmon and wrap with spicy tuna. It is good. Their happy hour roll are the best. We got seven rolls. We spicy tuna, bagel, Mexican, yellow tail, eel, tuna, and crispy salmon. I like all of them, especially the eel, spicy tuna, crispy salmon and yellow tail are the best. 

The service is great. The waiter is realizing we don't like cream cheese and it was not add into it. The sushi rice is the best. Great sushi rice in Carrollwood. I would said they are the best happy hour sushi I like.

This is classic restaurant in Tampa when my wife told me. They reason they classify as classic is they been in Tampa Bay for a long time. They main reason they survive for so long is due to their regular customers. There is a reason why people keep coming back. The reason are quantity of food and affordable to many. 

We have chop BBQ pork sandwich. I this this is their best seller because the chop pork and house sauce make this dish savory. We also has two meat combo. This dish I consider is a value dish. We got baby back rib and chicken. It come with 4 bone rib and quarter chicken in good price. I like they provide the BBQ sauce in warm condition which not sit on the table and condensed. This may be their selling point for the regular who coming back.

I saw many low rating reviews about this place. Since I have not visited this place, I like to give them a try. I saw many low rating review during first month of the opening. I hope they have improved when I visit them.

We have ordered shrimp and lobster chowder and signature salad to start. The chowder is creamy with small size shrimp that cook for long time. It blend well with the lobster and potatoes inside. The signature salad got good dressing. The most intriguing is the honey walnut with strawberry. 

Our main entrée are the Grilled Lamb Chop and Flat Iron Steak. I would not recommend flat iron steak since this steak have a lot of tendon. It difficult to bite. A lot of cutting to remove make smaller piece. The lamb chop is nicely decorated. The only complaint is they cook these lamb chop to almost well done which I ask for medium. I also asking for sauce to be on the side which they didn't do.  

Overall service is attentive. Chef skill on mixing the spice is An "A". But grilled technique need small improvement.

This crab shack has been there for long time. I like the seasoning that put on the crab. They serve live blue crab cook in the spot. Since cook it from live, the crab is fresh. I got 6 large crabs under $17. A lot of meat. Unfortunately one of the crab missing the crawl. If not because of that, I may have give them 5 stars for crab along. 

This shack really doesn't have a good place to sit and eat. Basically is a take out place. The day I have visited, they have 10 blue crab crawl for $3. They can cook crab by fried or steam garlic. The price varies due to the size of your choice. 

They serve other seafood which I may not able to said anything about it since I only like their blue crab. They have oyster, shrimp, clam strip, crab cake, devil crab, wings, snow crab, fish, gumbo, corn dog. Any how. Go for the blue crab.

Very nice setup. I like the open area of this restaurant. I have been to same location and Spot Sushi is the third restaurant who hold as a restaurant in the same address. I like the menu they serve. They are part Halong Bay restaurant group. 

We started with Bo Bia Spring Roll. This is fresh roll with Chinese sausage, egg, jicama. Jicama is widely de in Malaysia street food. This is rare occasions I see they se it here. That is the main reason they call Bo Bia. We added the appetizers Dynamite Mussels. It is chop mussels with mixed in imitation crab salad and baked together. It is interesting dish too. 

Our entree are the spot pho and the Hu Tieu Thap Cam - combination noodle. The pho is good. It more authentic soup base with heavy herb smell. I like this way better than like beef bone soup. The Hu Tieu has good combo of meat and seafood in the bowl. I like that one too. 

Overall service is good. Social distancing was provided on each table.

This restaurant is tiny. If you decide to come here for lunch, may need to come early for two reasons. Limited seat and wait time. The chef cook each dish on the wok separately. I like this delicate service for each dish. As a result, it take time if someone is ahead of you. May be take out is the best choice. 

I got the drunken noodle. This dish was stir fry in high BTU wok. Slight edge burn which the correct way to cook this dish. It come with egg chicken, broccoli and bell pepper. It was delicious. The only thing I would said not spicy enough since I have ask for Thai hot. 

Dish is affordable. Not much of service because the entire restaurant is run by two people. Very limited seat. Less than 20 seats.

Finally we have Poke place that can pick the side items you like to add on. Orlando has this build your own and 4 steps process assembling about 5 year ago. Tampa simply behind the schedule. 

U pick have advantages and disadvantages. You may need to have some chef know the flavor and ingredients skill. First pick your base. Rice, brown rice, veggie, chip. Second pick your protein tuna, salmon, chicken, octopus, crab salad. Third pick your ingredients. Fourths pick your sauces and last pick your topping. If you pick the wrong thing, it is your fault. No body to blame. 

Overall l like to have this U pick restaurant. A few things the restaurant can improve is to have the ingredients and sauce mixed before join the poke bowl. If you have the plain protein, that also can join the mixed up.

Definitely need reservation for this restaurant. Even with reservation, the wait still take 30 minutes for party of seven. This is the area I think they need improvement. Imagine you don't have reservations and it is weekend. 

The previous restaurant also Korean BBQ. But I like the current Korean BBQ better. I like they have conveyor belt with food push out. Now you can select what is pleasing to eye. The marinated meat need to be order. For the BBQ, I agree on some of the reviewer comments that it is more to Chinese Korean influences marinated sauce. But who care. It is still good. 

You also can enjoy the hot pot with BBQ combo. The hot pot has great selection. Including the fresh blue crab. The crab was clean very well. Good cleaning technique without sand trap. 

Service is good. As I said to the BBQ before. Don't bring any leather cloth or purse to the restaurant. It is a big smoke house. The food smell will stick the leather good. Wear easy walk clothes. Because after you eat, all the food smell will stick to your body including the cloth.

It is about 3.5 stars. This new boba place is at the same place of previous ice cream place. They have roll ice cream and the boba drink. Selection of menu is quite good. But the price after the topping is in the high side. Which I would said it is in the high side in compare to many boba places. 

I got the 35 degree special smoothies. The choices include the Thai tea, coffee, coconut, almond, matcha, and taro. This is first time I see Thai tea smoothie. It is good but not sure it measures to the price. After adding the seventy cents topping make this drink almost $7. It better be good for that price. I think the smoothie is just good and middle of the pack quality. 

Overall is good. If they can have the combo drink to attract more customers is better. May be change the method a bit especially they pickup this store from previous ice cream store. They do have soy milk and almond milk selection.

This is only place sell go cup wine for Armature Works. Many has come here for cup of wine. When I was sitting there, at least 8 customers has come to get their wine. Popular place. I think they are more successful than the one at McDill. 

The steak is good amount for the price paid. We have the sirloin steak. The steak was cook very well to the asking temperature. Meat quality is super. I would said like it. Now day at Armature can be easy spend that much of money per dish why not a good piece of steak. 

The food is good. I would give them better than average.

This newly added restaurant. They are new restaurant that in Amberly Drive. Their menu is not ready when I first visit. I decided to have takeout and try their food. When I was there, they still decorating the restaurant. They are doing some final touch. 

They do have 4 pages of the menus. They do recommend a few dish is must try. I did not go for it. I leave it to next time. I got the Apollo Fish. It is a dry curry fish. Good number of pieces. I like the curry. I was able to select the spiciness of the curry I choose medium because my wife cannot take the most spicy. 

I would try a few dish that is must try as suggested next time. This include the Chef Dadang Dosa, Desi Lovers Curry Leaf Chicken. I also try the chef special curry goat and chicken Manchuria.

This is a unique bakery. This is a Puerto Rican bakery. They do have sandwiches, flan, dessert, pastry and more. The place is busy. May be you feel like in the Puerto Rico. 

There is one item you may not want to miss. The Bozcocho Mojaito cake. This syrup almond cake. The cake is moist and delicious. I would recommend that you buy that without leaving. We got other pastry. They are good. Very similar to typical Hispanic pastry. 

We also got the tamarind juice. The juice is solution to thirsty day. I would said the pastries are looking delicious.

It is solid 4 stars fruit juice place. They have many things to offer. Including the the corn with cheese. This typical South American street food. They can many fresh juice. Including milk shake. They also has fresh fruit cut with sprinkles Mexican dice on top. 

The only thing is this food truck located at low income apartments parking lot. You don't feel save at night. But for day time is good. There a lot people hang out there. But it is ok. 

I got the Mango Papaya fruit juice. They are make from real fruit not powder. For price of Starbucks, I got a hoot 24 oz drink. Better deal than any place. I highly recommend their juice.

This Krispy Krabs location will be the closest to me. I use to go to Largo to get their crab. Now they located at Temple Terrace is about 15 minutes away. The new location is a food truck. They seem like building a building next to it. Hopefully this will be their permanent location. 

As always, I got six fried crab. The crab size is medium big. The crab was fresh. Sometimes they don't have crab due the crab is too small and not worth to sell to customers. Now is the season. Some of the crab have egg. I like to eat them when watching a game at TV and enjoy my finger food slowly. My wife have garlic no 1 order with snow crab. Other than snow crab, it has the shrimp, sausage, potatoes and corn. She like it. 

Overall the order is good. They will show the crab before they pack it. The timing from call to order as promised time. Please allow 25 minutes to call ahead.

I would said this is 3.5 stars restaurant. It is not a four stars restaurant to my opinion. Since we don't have 1/2 star, four stars was given. 

We select the Christmas for our visit at the hour of their opening of the door. This will take out the crowed conditions for serving and the busy kitchen situation. This will give them a fare review. 

We have order the two appetizer- the Roti and the Pla Muek Yang. The roti is two round roti cut in eight pieces. It has the Malaysian roti taste. Although this may be from packaged factory made but was pan fried perfectly. I like the curry dipping. 

Pla Muek Yang aka grilled squid. It marinated in curry or Cumming. It is flame grilled and you can see the grilled mark. The only complaint it the dish come out cold. Seem like sit a bit before it was brought out. It serves with sweet sauce. It is about three squid cut in ring. 

Our entrees order is disaster. It take three rejections before we got our order. There are three items they don't carry yet. But I did not count against them on this review. I have order the Phat Chinese Broccoli and pork belly and they have given me Asian BBQ pork and Pork Belly  noodle. I did not ask them to change since it look interesting. We also added the spicy chicken seafood noodle. 

The Asian noodle soup base is very interesting and different. I believe the ingredients was not the same as described in the menu. The spicy chicken noodle are very close to Thai street noddle but in the sweet side. This two dishes is just ok. 

Food is about 3.5 rating; service is about 4.0 and the kitchen crew is about 3 ratings. I believe the kitchen should not have any excuse because there only three customers when we were there. They should not busy and should handle the food better.

During the Coronavirus period, I would said they good efficient way to pick up your order. You just need to give up the your assign order number and paid. The pick up promises time was correct with no delay. Pay one one side of the door and pick up on their other. 

We got the seafood with crawfish and Manila clam. The size of the clam and crawfish is big enough. The mr and Mrs crab sauce is Cajun enough to the meat of the clam. It is well spice and bring a lot of flavors. It was in the plastic bag so you can shake it more to get to the seafood. 

Overall seafood is great. Definitely go for the Manila clam again.

This Carrabba's is in the middle of the pack of the Carrabba's chain I have been to. Somehow the Carrabba's is average on the steak. But they are very good on the appetizer. I like their appetizer the best in compare to their main entrée. 

The service is on point today. Very nice attentive service that we have received. The serve also good on pushing the sales on other dishes and dessert. Carrabba's are generally generous on the portion of food. We always stuff coming out of the restaurant. 

Let talk about the food. We got the mussel with white wine butter sauce. The sauce is perfect. The mussel are the best among the Carrabba's chain. They know how to clean and cook it soft without overcook them. 

The entrée of the bone in ribeye was cook to the temperature. Unfortunately their Steak skill need to be improved. But they are better than the average restaurant. The meat need to completely cook but left the inward red on medium rare. They are more to medium. The meat has more tendon attached to it and tough to bite on certain portions. 

Overall we still like it.

Chef Li open for takeout during pandemic. I happen to drove pass by and decided to give them a try since they got high mark from Christina review. The is close to sit down but available on take out. 

We order the grilled beef on the stick. I think this is the best value and best dish. They come in order of 4 or 8. It is go well with the red wine. The chef special shrimp and scallops, bird nest are are almost the same sauce. Except one serve over the fried bowl tortilla. It look pretty. The schezchuan tofu is a great dish. I got the small portion. The beef chow fun is tasty to have. I would recommend this dish also. 

Chef Li is basically a take out store Chinese food. The level of cooking is above than the average takeout place. Food and dishes is affordable.

Great place to have breakfast at the Nook. We were here for other thing but see this place open and decided to join the crowd for brunch. The place is bid. The hostess has beautiful mask. 

My wife has the 6oz grilled strip steak and I have the the  Atlantic wild caught haddock. The strip steak is almost like New York strip. Is well prepared and come with two side. My wife got the tot and the fried okra. The Sr trip is easy to chew and cut. 

I like the grilled haddock. Not many place serve this kind of fish. This place is one of them. I got the veggies beef soup as the side. It is wonderful. We also got one of the day special with strawberry French toast. I think this dis is just ok and below average. 

Service is good. Food come out quick enough. The restaurant space is big to seat big party.

One good tip. 5:00 pm to 6:00 pm is happy hour. Many item reduce 3 dollars. Drinks also good prices during that time. This newly open restaurant has good and ok App. You will be the judge. I was surprised that at 5:16 pm, this place is pack already. So get there early if you want to try their happy hour. 

We started with the devil Egg and philly flatbread. I would recommend the devil Egg. The topping with the fried candies pork belly is delicious. The philly flatbread need work. The meat of shaved ribeye is too little. It need to be more for that price. We added the Fabio's meatballs. This one comes with grits. The last dish we have is the Italian Steak. This is the New York strip cut. The steak is cook to asking temperature. If this dish come with broccolini will be better. But I also like the asparagus. 

The drink I have is the cotton Candy cosmo. It is good show. I give them an "A" for the food come out really quick. Good kitchen work.

This Quickly is the same join from Orlando. The one thing I like for this boba place in Orlando is their poke. Unfortunately they don't have it. Hopefully one day they started the poke. 

This place has good chicken nuggets. You got to try them if you are visiting this place. Boba is ok. I have try their special Bah Mi. It is decent not the most excellent but good enough. They also carry a crawfish Bah Mi. This is the items I would try. Not many place have this item. 

For the dessert, we have ordered the mochi waffle. This is something new I have not have before. It is chewy mochi base. It accompanied with condensed milk and sugar powder. 

This restaurant drink place, it kind of self serve. Order from counter. They will bring the food to table.

Gelato place at Palm Harbor bring joy to the kid of the neighborhood. I hope New Tampa has one of the mom and pop gelato store one day. Coolside has a special beerlato that I did not try. I will try that next time. 

Today we have three of the flavors. All three flavors was very nice. Before you are ordering, you can try their specialty flavors. The server was nice enough for any cup size, he can fill as many flavors he can. We got the small cup, and he was able to fill with three flavors. This is a plus to attract customers to come back. 

Other than gelato and beer, they serve coffee too. It is as advertised fine Italian ice cream.

The four stars was given for their ambience. There two antiques ford was lifted high like are repairing at garage at the bar. Gas pump is everywhere. It is interesting to eat there. I have to give them they have good burger. 

We were here for the restaurant week. You probably save $5 on the restaurant week menu. We like pretzel. They are fresh from oven. The buffalo chicken dip is average but the chip is crispy. 

We have the Brisket Ranchero Roaster. It is burger top with brisket and bourbon bbq sauce. It has fried onions make it crispy. The accompanying tot is good. We close out with milk shake and the famous funnel cake. I like funnel cake with the white chocolate dip. 

The service was good. The table setting for six is comfortable. Enough room from each other. I would said don't forget to visit the restroom. The ambience in the restroom is great.

The food has good taste as for food truck but they are not cheap. double Gustazo is popular at local. It has wait time to pick up the food due to a lot of order. The food truck has some seated area. 

I got the the Carrucho with mofongo. The Carrucho is the conch. They processed the food very well. It have good number of conch. It come with a bit salad. The mofongo has good garlic mixed. It is delicious. Although is do not have the pork belly mixed in, but the taste is there. 

The only thing is the price is a bit steep. Almost $20. It is almost restaurant price with good ambient. For food trucks his price is on the high side.

Crepe!!! My visit here was good. Order on the counter and they bring the food to you. Since I gone between meal, not many people there. It is actually pleasant and quite moments to around that time. The decoration is simple. They do have some wall unit sofa. The also have the stool high top section. Other than that, the outside sitting also available. 

They serve salty, sweet, or breakfast crepe. Some of the lunch salty crepe is interesting. Please look at their special of the day which not in the menu. It may surprise you. Happy hour start 7 pm to close. Beer and wine half off. 

I got the nutty joe. It is crepe fill with Nutella and Oreo cookies. It top with vanilla ice cream. It also come with a shot of espresso. It is good combination. I actually like the way they made their crepe. It is sweet with chewy condition.

Great restaurant to go to at night. Even late at 9:20 before they close. The bar area has the live piano music. It is great if you on the business trip by yourself and seat on the piano bar. 

I have the southern style shrimp and grit. The shrimp count is at the large size. The ingredient include chorizo ham and bacon. It make the taste interesting. I would said this is average value. I like the piano music at the bar. It make the time pass quicker while you eat and listen. 

The signature margarita is average. The service of the bar is a bit slower due high volume customer during that time i. Overall is a good experience. I like the small plate menu at the happy hour. I will try that next time for the happy hour. I will be back.

It is affordable restaurant in this area in compare to surrounding more expensive restaurants. It is definitely an outlet of food for the students in University of Tampa. Budget enough with a lot of variety. The selection includes poke bowl and noodle bowl. 

We got the pork belly ramen. The ramen noodle was well prepared. It is well separated with chewy noodle string. The pork belly may be baked then pan seared and served. Soup base may be some bone and vegetable base. Overall is a good experience. Definitely worth the visit.

Since they open during pandemic, we only have take out. Finally we can sit down and eat. The place is pack on the day we have visited. People love crab here. Don't mind to get the hand dirty. They do provide glove and bib if you want to protect yourself. 

The interior has many locations you can take pictures with including the giant crab. We got the combo C with a lot of good stuff in it. Snow crab, blue crab, shrimp, clam, sausage. We have the garlic butter this time. The seafood is great. We also have the appetizers of chicken wings and crab cake, the wing was good but the crab cake is not recommended. Is has a lot of dough in it. It is also like devil crab not is not devil crab. 

Service once is engaged, it is fast. You may want to ask who is your server. Because sometimes they seat you on the open table which mean that table has not assigned a wait staff. As a result it is good to ask so you will not get delay of the beginning of the services.

Taco ringing again today. This one mobile phone ring. No- it is mobile truck. This truck is close to our area. My wife have gone to this place without me several times. I have to do it without her at lease one time. Today is the day. 

It is a bit different to eat there than bring it home to eat. The taco is decent. I have the steak and the chorizo taco today. But I like their lengua and tripa taco. The metal tent is behind the truck. It provide covering from the sun and rain. Among all three ladies is there, one know how to speak English. 

Their taco is to corn taco with pack of meat. Nice looking one. It come with small jalapeño and stir fried onion. Food is better than average but no wow factor. Good for snack like today.

Rare Ethnic Food #46  Syrian Cuisine.

I am going with the bad first. The the consistency of great food at everyday need to bring it to customer. With that said. Our experience with the restaurants for one day is fantastic. We were there Friday buffet. That is the only best day or what we call Prime Day. 

The buffet set off day only Friday and Saturday from 1 pm to 6 pm. Friday we have visited is the best day compare to my friend went on the following day. The food at Saturday is not nearly good as to Friday buffet. The Friday buffet has Mansaf - a authentic Arab lamb dish. It was delicious. It also has bake and bbq chicken, beef, fried fish. Other than the main dish. They also have about 12 other choices including the eggplant. Food is great on Friday buffet. It worth the price and experience to try their food. 

Since it is buffet, get all you can eat. We were stuff with food.

The food truck is located at the same area of many food truck. I like the ideal with food truck center because this food truck may benefit from visitors to other food truck and order something from this food truck. 

The total taco food truck is well set up. Not just the sit down place under cover, but also includes a hand wash station after finger food. It was convenient. We got two tacos. We have the cochinada mex which is a mixed of different types of meat. It was delicious. We also got the shrimp taco. Both taco is comfort and savory. 

Food prepared was quick. The choices of taco is large. The price is medium. They also serve other stuff like fajitas, burritos, nachos, quesadilla, tortas.

This is about 3.5 stars. Since we don't have half stars, I round up to 4 stars for their cooking skill. Oro meaning gold. This food truck name is gold tacos. 

Other than tacos, they have burritos, quesadilla, torta, flautas. The meat included steak, marinated pork (pastor), pork (carnitas), Mexican sausage, Pollo, Tripa, lengua. I have the steak, pastor, lengua and the trips tacos. I have to give them an A on tripa. Because you don't feel bitter on the tripa itself due to right amount burn cooking on this ingredients. 

The only complaint is all the tacos are small compared to many tacos place I have been to. The wait time after order is about 10 minutes. It is acceptable. The marinated meat was well presented. The steak can be improved. Instead on cut the meat in strip, may dice in cube. This will be better.

It is 3.5 stars restaurant. It is not 4 stars. The service is good, the ambient is excellent, the food is par, and the wait is par. 

The restaurant does not take reservation. So you have to arrive and find out your fate. On the weekend is over hour to get in. However, they get your cell phone number and text you when the table is ready. Once they text you, you have 5 minutes to respond that you still want your table, then 5 minutes to show up. Which give you time to walk around the mall. If you need 10 minutes time to walk back. Don't respond immediately, response close to your 5 minutes is up. 

The decorations is definitely eye catching. I like many of the ambient. It is beautiful. It is fiesta atmosphere. Seem like you seat on open air restaurant with stars hanging over you. Music is good volume and still able to make conversation at bar area. 

The food is the main thing that they need to make the most improvement. Go from the bad to good. The taco are the area need to make the most improvement. We have order 4 tacos. The shrimp, blacken fish, cochinita (roast pork) and carne Asada (wood grilled steak). The pork is lack of flavor. The fish is dry and over cook, the shrimp is just broil and serve. The best is the steak that is a star. I would suggest control how the fish is cook. The pork may be need to marinate and cook in the thicker sauce and the shrimp grilled it before put it in the taco. 

The entrée is the ceviche and the grilled chicken with mole chocolate sauce. I like both of the dish. It is not a wow but above average. I do like their table side guacamole. They have options for the spiciness and chunky of the avocado. I like the chip because they have spice on top and tasty then the most restaurant. 

Overall is good experience. We have very good service. Our waiter is experience. I have read some of the reviews of my friend that some of the waiter are not up to the task. But our night was good may be it is weekend and they have the experience waiter.

I have been to this place several time. I like it because of easy access. The flow of the drive through is good on some day, the other may be slow. During the COVID condition, this is good to have. 

I went into the store the shield is up between clerk and customer for protection. The coffee is still good on this difficult time. I got the ice coffee with hazelnut flavor. I also like their sugar donuts.

The historical building remodel to Italian Restaurant. This Sicilian restaurant is the one I like in the Columbia Restaurant Group. It has the best menu and thought on the food. The restaurant follows the pandemic protocol. They ask the customers to wear mask if they are not seated. 

We seat at the bar section with limited number of seat because the wait for table required 45 minutes. The customers who don't have a seat near the bar are reminded to wear the mask. Only the seated customers allow to order. 

Before our meal is here, they serve the pre meal bread with good seasoning. I like those. My wife got the the Polpo Alla Griglia. It is sliced grilled octopus salad. The salad is ok. I got the Sea Bass Grigliata. It is Mediterranean grilled sea bass. They sea bass is big and grilled to good flavor. The accompanying eggplant capanota was very good. We like our food. 

With high price item come greater expectations. The restaurant is about better than average. I would suggest you call ahead. Because they are really busy. The car parking is free in front of the restaurant between 21 and 22 street.

I have been to here twice since the Bruce B Down Dairy Queen close the business. I like the location is  between the residential and commercial area. Its location was at the major street of Wesley Chapel.

I like about Dairy Queen is about the their blizzard. This item is their signature dessert. When they finish the mixed, they will turn the ice cream upside down to show the concrete featuring of how sticky is the mixed. They do have a lot of premixed features. Also you can choose the mixed by your own flavor. 

My favorite mixed is the vanilla ice cream with heath bar and the cappuccino flavor. This is the best mixed I love to have. Time to time they have the seasoning mixed design blizzard. Sometimes they are very good. It is more important to choose the ingredients and the flavor to mixed. But sometimes will surprise you like the flavor that you have never attempted before.

We need to give some love to this Caribbean restaurant. Yelp elite! We have new restaurant in Pinellas and not many review yet. 

Caribbean Cuisine is a lot of marinate and it will not taste blend. They are so many choices here. But I have try their fish since I saw some one post it earlier. The posted fried red snapper look very good. We order the same thing. Since this market price, we have to ask how big is the fish and the price. 

The given fish is huge and I am sharing with my wife. We order it as grilled option since it is more healthy. The fish will take 25 minutes to cook as the restaurant has warn us since it is grilled. The fish was marinated in Caribbean sauce and pan sear or "grilled" at hot plate. It is not open flame grilled. But it is good since there is no burn part. 

Fish is fresh can be tell immediately. The meat did not fall apart and a good sign of fresh fish. I will come back to try some other items in the menu. The papaya juice is good too.

During the thanksgiving day, Cracker Barrel is the very few restaurant open. It make many family or travelers happy to fill their stomach during the holiday. Thanksgiving day always has to wait on the line if you going to here for lunch or dinner. We waited 25 minutes. 

The store has plenty of items for you to look while you waiting. They even have the rocking chair in the front for the customers who wait. I like the conversation with my neighbors chair. They indicated to me they don't need to cook the and clean the turkey because the option they have in Cracker Barrel. 

Today they run the special turkey platter with turkey, ham, sweet potatoes casserole, corn bread, stuffing, cherry sauce for $12.99. It including drink and pumpkin pie. It is a good meal. Love the turkey and the pumpkin pie. The pumpkin pie are freshly made not frozen before. It is silky smooth. 

Service a bit slow during the holidays. But is acceptable.

I have been to this place twice. The food here is good. There is good grilled master behind the kitchen make the grilled chicken great. We have the two dishes for $10.99 with our coupon in the mail. It make the food very economical. 

We have quarter grilled chicken and one tropical chop. For the chop, we selected the mojo pork. Both dishes are delicious. The chicken grilled perfectly with good marinate. We also have the fried yuca. The yuca is cut into cube. I like the cube better because the batter cover more area. 

We did not try their drive through but the inside order is quick. There are plenty of parking spot at the facility. After eating, they pickup the dishes. What a service for the fast food. I can see I will be back. I always love their mojo base grilled chicken.

Rare Ethnic Food 26

Pollos A La Brasas - Rotisserie Chicken. The word from Latin language explains it all. Their best dish that should not be miss. This place the food here is very affordable. It located off street from main road Hillsborough. If you come to shop at the Italian market next door, may be plan a visit. 

This restaurant is mom and pop shop. Some of the customers said they move from other place. Their rotisserie chicken has good marinated spice. I would said it is one of the better one in Bay Area. The chicken is well marinated to the bone. It is tender and juicy. The accompanying is the white rice and fresh salad. If they can improve these two items, they may be able to sell better. 

They do have some good looking dessert that we didn't try on this trip. It is definitely worth a shot.

Bubble or boba.  It is just a fight of the term. This new bubble tea place is located near food court entrance. The store is located at the center of the walkway. 

The analogy is interesting like a mad scientist to create the experiment drink. Watch up the science of boba cooking. I have the special drink in the menu - rainbow ripple. The lady who make the tea forget to add the boba into it. I have added it later. What make this tea interesting is the presentation, I like their creation with rainbow sprinkles on top of the whip cream. This drink is strawberry base. 

I like my wife drink a bit better. She has the cookie and cream. It add a real cookies and cream in the mixed of the drink. It is interesting rich drink. I cannot say for all other drink. But their special drink score a 4 stars. Price for the boba drink in Bay Area is at the high side.

I have been to this cafe several time and I decided to give them a review. The interior is all green since the name call green island. During the odd hour of 3:30 pm, there is a lot of high school student hang out. Other than drink, they also have sushi, salad, rice bowl, sweet toast. 

For the main selection are the drink. They have ice tea, milk tea, smoothies, cold coffee. And they have add on like boba, jelly,  and fruit. For the ice tea, I like their Kumquat lemon ice tea and black tea. Today I have the avocado smoothies. I add boba into the smoothies. The boba need to be broil to soft and add the sugar water at the bottom of the smoothies. The avocado flavor was added into shave ice and ground together. 

The pricing for the smoothies is average in the Bay Area. The drink is non fat and the calories is approximately 100 to 140 for smoothies.

This is my third time here. I like unique of the restaurant with music venue. The restaurant is separated from the music venue. The music venue sometime is free but most of the time requires a small cover fees.  However, you can eat at the restaurant without attending the music venue and not charge with the fees. 

The restaurant has a lot non typical food from the swamp or sea. They have the smoke mullet, fried gator tail, popcorn crawfish, beer boil shrimp, smoke fish dip.  The service is quick and so does the food come out.  The ambient is very interesting that the restaurant is constructed from a shack. The full menu offer a lot of seafood dish found in many restaurant. In season, they also have the stone crab. 

Please check at their music calendar that is playing and the required cover fees. They also have special event held here call skipper dome for the entire music venue. They open late at night if you want a bite.

It was recommended by Yelp friend for good pho. As a result we ordered a big bowl of Pho Xe Lua the combination meat special. It is huge bowl of soup that have everything. You can share this bowl and order other items. Since I am not the Vietnamese, I cannot tell what is actually good Pho. Same go for many people depending on their preferences. Some like heavy smell, some like clearer soup base, some like beefing smell. So pick your own.  

We also order the Bo Bia the vegetable roll with Chinese sausage. I like the sauce that comes with it. We also ordered the Hai Vi Kho To - simmered seafood with caramel sauce. I have this dish at many place. This restaurant have it a bit different. The sauce is not creamy but liquidity. Good balance of salt. This restaurant seem like family owned. Service is average. Next visit I will try their stuff chicken wing and salty lemonade with soda.

Our experience is great here for special Christmas menu. It can be 5 stars if not because the price in the high side. We have more expectations if the food alone is $90 per person. The service is excellent for the night. The waitress and waiter are busting the table and o'dourves very nicely. 

We star the o'dourves of wood grilled mojiot gulf shrimp. This is a sugar cane slaw pineapple bbq sauce. The shrimp is good side. The marinated was well done. The other o'dourves is the short rib pierogi. This is fried pierogi with good meat. Great bite items. 

The appetizers are the crispy calamari and Fig and Goat Cheese flatbread. The fig jam flatbread is nice. The calamari is fried. The dish come with shishito pepper. Nice touch. 

Our main dish is the Grilled Golden Tilefish. This dish fish is grilled. It accompanied with parsnip purée and blister tomato. It was parsnip grind to smooth purée. The tomato was special make to cook the inside to juice. It also has the fennel watercress and small shrimp with sauce over the fish. 

The final touch dessert are tiramisu and the pistachio blood orange cake. The tiramisu is almost like cake. The blood orange cake has little gold chocolate paper on top is eatable.

It is Chinese style Cajun crab. This store is along West Water Avenue. The place has some of my friends visited before. We visited at the month of August. It not the crawfish season. They don't have crawfish even though there are several dishes in the menu. They sub the crawfish with shrimp. 

We got their snow crab and shrimp special. It come with pound of snow crab, 6 shrimp and Andouille sausage. We believe the crab was stir fry before they added the Cajun sauce. My wife like this style. It also have ear of corn and potatoes. 

For the restaurant, it is a plus with they provide bib, glove, and crusher. After finger food, my finger still doesn't have Cajun spice smell because it was protected by the glove.

I thought I have reviewed this place. But when I check, I miss my review. So I use this visit to complete my review. I always like this bar because they have a lot TV screen that you can choose. There were plenty of TV with different channels that you can find the one channel that you like. 

I have constantly see their promotions. Our recent visit have a chance to try their blacken snapper and the Ahi Tuna Poke bowl. I have specifically instruct to blacken with heavy spice. It didn't disappoint me. It was good enough spice to turn the snapper fillet spicy. I also like the accompanying mushrooms truffles oil french fry. It is delicious with the parsley. The Ahi tuna poke bowl has good enough sesame oil to enhance the taste. Instead of rice as starch, we has ask for the noodle. 

We also order the coconut grouper finger first time. It turn out a good choice. Love the atmosphere and food. Service is good. If you come at off hours, they have more discount.

The tea place is a bit low customers traffic on Sunday night. We were able to get our order in very quickly. I saw the have coffee, so I ask if they mix the yingyang tea a mix of coffee and tea. Their reply is they can do it but may not be good. 

I kind agree with them about the yingyang tea. The tea has to be a red tea with dark roast coffee. I don't think they has it. So I order a Naga milk tea with boba. The tea is very flavorful. It has the good smell from the tea. The boba is actually soak in brown sugar and it is extra good taste. 

Overall they are good. The price is in the high side.

It is about 3.5 stars restaurant. Round up to 4. Bam has been open less than few months and up and coming. They move from other locations to here. The new space is nice and plenty of parking space. Their menu has combination special with their signature roll and two other typical roll. Their sushi category divided into cook, raw, or tempura. 

I have order two of their signature roll. The Nambomb and the Sunburn. The Nambomb is real snow crab in fill. Not the imitation krab meat. The snow crab meat was mix and mash with creamy sauce. The it roll and top with tuna and salmon. I like the in fill snow crab meat. The Sunburn is roast beef top on the roll. The in fill is lobster meat. The only comment I made is they need to do something about the beef. Instead of roast beef, may be they can create their own beef is more attractive such as grilled beef. 

Overall experience is good. The restaurant still young. Lunch before 2:30pm will have 15% off the meal every day.

During pandemic, Yamato considered has good customer traffic during difficult time. This has to thank to their simplicity of menu and more combo price dish. It is more attractive in compare to my first visit. The combo menu make it more affordable and the customer can try more items. 

I got the Yamato Special. It has shrimp, chicken, and steak. The side dish includes fried rice, veggies, noodle, salad, soup. This is the first time I also bring home the left over. My wife have the steak and calamari combo. We like our food. I think the chef make it a bit too salty. 

We always like the show. It includes the egg roll and toss. I also like the big fire in the beginning, ops check your eye brown after the show. Did it burn off. The volcano onion is classic. We enjoy the entertainment. As usual, this is seat close to the tepan cook top. Expect the food smell will stick to you. Just wear easy to wash. Cloth. Avoid bring and leather items such hand bag, clothing. The food smell will be difficult to remove from leather items.

I have not seen a wawa gas station has electric charge station. This one certainly has one. I saw a lot of local owner or traveler come here to charge up. They waited at the back of Station while the car is charged. Seem like a long benefit. I wonder they have to paid or free for the electric car. I glad that there is along the way charging station. The only inconvenience is the wait. It is make more sense to charge near the mall while they can shop and dine. But for Wawa is the first of the pioneering this project. 

The wawa is generally cheaper gas than most. It has the gas in good pricing. Other than the gasoline, the sandwich and coffee are great here. The bathroom is some what clean.

If you are hungry and have less than $10 in your pockets, you may want to consider this place. The place is small, but it has street food written all over it. We came here for a memorial crawl. It is definitely a good stop for our stop. 

We order the signature crazy Burrito. It has steak, seasoning pork, chorizo, rice, bean, guacamole. The size is crazy big. I mean really big. I love the taste. It is definitely a must have for the visit. I also got the fish and shrimp taco. Both of them is delicious. It come with many tail of shrimp. 

Food come out quick enough. The order can be made on the table. We enjoy our time there. It has some Mexican hats lay around if you want a picture. The store is small. But is big enough for a group of eight of us.

It was great night to meet a group of yelp friend. This usually a test for waiter who actually can handle our group. The test was pass with a good standing. Our waiter was able to weather the storm of 10 people group. 

We were there before the happy hour end. The happy hour drink is $3.5. The glass is small than the normal size but have good enough alcohol. At least is about 30% off on normal size. The choices include rum, tequila, or vodka and flavor. 

I got some happy hour sushi with Tampa Roll and Shrimp tempura roll. This two rolls with good fish and shrimp. We also order the smoke fish dip and bacon burger slider. All this item is $5. Great for happy hour. 

On the entree, I got the Kapalua Grill for $26. It has medley of grilled seafood. It has shrimp, scallops and crab cake. It also accompanied with potatoes cake and grilled asparagus. All have great flavor.

Great space with moving fan sideway for ambience and function air mover. This new restaurant has inside and outside seating. Live music is playing at the outside seating. Same as the bar has half inside and outside seating. When you seat at the bar outside is not quite hot since they have the blow air next to bar. 

When seat at the bar, we have good advantages like the immediate access to our bar tender and waitresses immediately. So we take it slow by order items one at the time. 

We started with firecrackers shrimp. It is buttermilk coating fried to crispy. It come with sriracha aioli. It is crunchy with good dipping sauce. I also order the hibiscus margarita. I like they give you enough alcohol of Sauza. This is actually one of their signature drink there. It has hibiscus with sugarcanes juice. I also like the crystal brown sugar on the edge of glass. 

We have order two main dish. The grill salmon on mixed greens on cheese tostadas. One improvement can be made is to place the tostadas to side to avoid lessen the crispness from dressing. The second dish is the skirt steak churrasco. First time brought out to us is over cook. Second time was good. Some how the chef need to know turn down the grill fire heat or turn the steak often. The manager did come out to apologize about the steak and give us credit. 

Overall experience is good. Good management team to watch the floor. Waitress is alert to customers need.

I am excited finally to try out this restaurant. I have been many event that the restaurant involved in and try their food. Tuesday is good day to try since my friend said they have the prefix menu. Actually they have stop this offering long time ago. 

The night is busy. I like their bar and kitchen is next to each other. The action in the kitchen was presented in front you when you just a few feet away. I like the action and coordination between chefs. 

I start with lamb neck with over the dumplings top with salad. This dish meat was obtained from the neck area. The meat was braised me dumplings below is fried. The top salad was very delicious. The hot sauce below just accommodate well with the dish. 

The second dish is risotto with lobster. The risotto was cook with lobster and wild mushrooms. The edge was green color by caramelize fennel and top with lemon fraiche. This hot, warm and cold section make this dish my favorite dish. Very interesting. 

Overall close 4.5 stars. I think they can be better. I would said good restaurant.

Solid 4 stars. The word fun is sound of rice in Chinese. This make up their store name. Very good name. The poke is also fun to have also. They are kind tuck away from plaza. It is a bit difficult to get to. 

First choose the base. They have something most of the poke place do not have it. Soba Noodle as a base. They do have other base like rice, salad, brown rice which no interest me. Second choose two protein. I got the tuna and salmon. Third 5 mixed in. I got the cucumber, cherry tomato, mango, pineapple and last with shiitake mushroom which not use by most poke place. They have the protein and mixed in combo with sauce and stir the mix before put in to the base. Good technique. 

The topping selection has 4. I got crab meat, seaweed salad, octopus and masago. Considering this good topping. Food is a bit expensive but has good topping and base. I would make some changes with sesame seed, bonito flake and onion crip to free add on instead count as topping. This will give customers willing to come back because they got something extra.

Typical day at the mall shopping and rose show. Usually my wife went to different store and we will meet at certain time after shopping. When she want extra time and I already finish my window shopping, I sit at a restaurant to have a drink and wait. 

I know the heat playoff games is on and in the same time the Kentucky derby is on. I could not believe that Kentucky derby drawn a lot of fan to watch at the bar. 70% of TV monitor showing the derby. The customer next to me is from the Tampa downs jockey, and the left is older lady fan who are very interested at the derby. 

I have order the strawberry lemon vojito - vodka, lemonade, mint and strawberry. It is a Long lost cousin of Mojito. Interesting. Ok mix drink. The bartender is very attentive. It is very interesting day at the bar that I am the only one watching the heat game and the rest of people watching the derby.

This place has a change over for many Indian restaurant. Nice yellow spice curry is serving here. It is located next to gas station. Very strange place. Parking is very limited but no worry because the mall parking is just behind it. 

Lunch buffet is the best to do here and get your value of the meal. We came in late for our lunch. But they are still serving buffet. It is alway best to go to buffet when they just open. The food just ready and has not been clear out. 

When we were there, the food is a bit empty but they fill slowly by their kitchen. I like the tandoori chicken here. It is very good use of spice and perfectly grilled. Some tandoori have to many spice and make the outside of the chicken moist but this place is perfect. 

The curry they serve is great. Good use of spice. It is great to enjoy the buffet here.

The lunch special is very affordable and attractive. It is great to have lunch here with less than $10 on weekday. I like restaurant has multiple TV with many angle and channels. That's why you call them sport bar. The drink has special every day including the happy hour 4 to 6 pm. 

We got weekday lunch special with grilled salmon salad and grilled chicken Fettuccine. Both dish is big enough for lunch. The salmon come in the strips and perfectly grilled. The salad is great because they have good mixed of green. The Fettuccine sauce also good and the chicken is juicy. 

You may want join their lunch time gold stars punch card. After 5 visit, you got $10 free on lunch. The service is great. From reception to service is very attentive. Our food come out quick too.

Since this place has low star. I am trying them out for their new smoothie. The time I went is 3 pm and not many of people. The place is a bit of small and have a few table. 

I am trying up their new Avocolada. It is a mix of avocado, lime, coconut, spinach, kale, and pineapple. It is a good combination with smoothie ice. Taste is great. The drink was prepared in 5 min. Not bad for the price for the large size cup. 

My experience here is ok may be is off hour.

The outside look like a dump but the interior of this restaurant has some characters. The decorations include big hat, music instruments, a drunken Columbian sniper?  The dinning room has TV. They are Real Madrid soccer team supporter. 

The food is more in affordable side compare to Bay Area Columbian restaurants. We are here with some Yelp friend. Steve E review has me book mark this place. If anything bad blame Steve. If it is good, I lead you into this place :). 

I have order the churrasco, my wife got the seafood mofongo. One my friend got the traditional mix meat with rice - Bandeja Paisa. Churrasco is big pieces that I can share with my group. The mofongo is very nice. This is Columbia cuisine perform Puerto Rico food. However, they did a good job on the dish. 

Food is good here. The margarita is average. Service is ok.

This WAWA is open not long ago. The price is reasonable. Since it is new in Brandon, there is a lot visitor. I like they have the larger screen for instructions. The display letter size in the screen also in larger font size. It is easy to ready for young and old. Especially for old people. I like the blue background screen to reduce the reflection of the sun.
