It also has boat fuel. Since it is at it honeymoon period, the gas is cheaper. Now the nearby gas station also lower the price. Good for the consumer. It don't have right in and out to SR 60 but it has share use entrance.

It is solid 4 stars restaurant. In fact very close to 4.5 stars. A restaurant now day need to bring their "A" game and specialty food to the table. This restaurant has bring it. It great to be the neighborhood restaurant near Cypress. This restaurant is cucina with meat market. 

The Boozy Pig has good dish in the menu. We have many choices. We got the their Rocket Man and The Smoke Chicken Purtine. Rocket Man just like jet fuse. It is Wagyu Beef Pastrami with kimchi and melting cheese. It is a rocket fuse. 

The Smoke Chicken Purtine go with fried and dripping cheese. It sprinkled with bacon. It is a good finger food. I would eat this dish first before the rocket man. Because rocket man has stronger taste will overpower the smoke chicken purtine. 

The few things that keep them from my 5 stars is the side we got is braised collards is $4. A bit at expensive. Most dish come with side dish but here is added on.

Hibachi night. My wife have been to this restaurant many time and this is my first. I am usually not order the steak. I am usually order the seafood. The steak cook on the hot  steel plate is usually not as good open flame grilled.

Tonight we have started with onion mushroom soup and ginger salad- come with the meal. The fried onion soup is great but the ginger salad is so so. I think their ginger dressing is too little. To taste a good sushi chef you always order the spicy tuna as a test drive. The sushi came with whole piece cube tuna and slice cucumber. They have a bit of wasabi to make it a bit spicy. A true spicy tuna should be hand chop and dice into tiny pieces then add the sesame oil, raw quail egg, and spicy chili sauce. Then, they are mixed together and wrap in the seaweed wrap. This is true spicy tuna. I believe they have fail at this department. 

Our entree is the calamari and tuna with shrimp. We have specified how they are cook. The tuna is seared the outside and the calamari needs to burn a little bit on the out side. The chef did a very good job on this dish not only preserve the good quality of the material and also well season for the hot steel plate cooking. 

I would not recommend any sushi but highly recommend the hibachi. Be brave to order the calamari and try it. You will not disappointed. The service is good. As a result they deserve 4 star. If you come with your birthday ID and with a paid friend. The birthday entree is free. For the lady, do not need to wear expensive dress due to the food smoke may stick to your dress, hair and hand bag. You only dress for food. Be prepare wash your hair after visit due to food smoke may stick to your body. That is the price of hibachi.

4.5 stars to my book. It is a good  smoke BBQ place. I would said their dry rub is similar to North Carolina BBQ. I am actually like that way. We were here at the Saturday afternoon and the place is kind of park due to street market is in session.  

We have the three meat combo with two sides. We selected the brisket, blackened tilapia, and BBQ chicken. The brisket is tasty. I like the blackened seasoning on the fish. It was delicious   I would recommend the blackened tilapia. The chicken was amazing. The grilled technique is perfect. 

Service can be a bit better. Overall I enjoyed my visit.

The restaurant last to this date has it own reason - good wok technique on noodle. This very much summarized the best of the restaurant. I have a takeout here and the order was done correctly. Currently the restaurant has social distancing for the customers who dine in there. 

We order a garlic squid lunch special and the basil noodle with pork. It come with correct spiciness of the heat level. I have it Thai hot. The squid has good garlic sauce. It also good numbers pieces of the squid. The best is the noodle. It is done in the high BTU wok. The edge of noodle is slightly burn and create a good wok application to the noodle. I like that way they have wok it. It is delicious. 

The pickup was at the promise time. No wait is needed. Utensils was included in the package and we just need open and enjoy it.

I like the name of the restaurant. Immediately you know what kind of the restaurant you get into it. Even thought I am not an vegetarian, but the food they brought out in the dinning hall is well decorated. It very eye pleasing. Each dish presented well for the look and arrangements. I did not get a meal here but I did get the smoothie.

I got the mango dream smoothie. The smoothie has healthy stuff like Basil Nut Mylk, Vanilla Stevia, and mango. I go for more fun drinks than actual energy drink. They do carry some energy drinks such as powerhouse and jungle gym. 

The smoothie is great and filling. The store also sell some supplemental food as superfoods. The meal side includes some choices of veggies burger, wrap and more. Overall is very solid store.

Shula has good quality burger due to selection of the premium meat. If you want to leave your name in the restaurant, you can accept the 48 oz 48 minutes challenge. It is huge. They do pack the left over if you cannot finish. 

We got the Swiss Mushroom Burger. I like the Swiss cheese than American cheese. It more chewy. The mushroom are developed from fresh mushroom with thick slice. Great when cheese melt on top. The burger is nice with entire package. We got meal and fried come with it. We also got the chocolate shake. I believe on Tuesday, the shake is only a dollar addition from meal plans. It great to have it. 

Service is great. Restaurant has TV that I can watch the games while I am eating.

French restaurant before the beach at Fort Desoto. If you come at Sunday Brunch, please make reservations, they are fully booked most of the time. I have been here twice. I think I can give them a fair review. Their restaurant is at exclusive area and need toll if you from I-275. 

My friend and me visited them during job assignment near the beach. We got daily special Hachis Parmentier. This is a special dish in French cook with ground beef and potato. Parmentier is French know as potatoes man. He promoted the potatoes in the local. This dish also very similar to shepherd pie in England. 

The second dish La Vosgienne. This is a French crepe wrap with Prosciutto ham and top with sunny side up egg. It is brunch item. It quite good. I like it to be savory. I like this dish the most. The last dish is the Sandwich Parisen. This just a assembly item. No creativity. That is why they 4 stars. The bread is tough to bite.

Good gas station. Wawa did a good jog on the food and drink. This good gas station in this area and the price of the gas is very competitive. The wawa pump station is well designed with a lot of room for the vehicle to be move or flow. We got the gas here and enjoy a drink or two. 

Sometime they have the Italian wedding soup is the best. You may want to look for the coupon which will lower the food price. Hoggie is most popular food around here.

The clerk reception is friendly and patience. They explained each sandwich to meat for the different of normal and double roast beef. Single is 3 oz and the double is 6 oz. clerk is knowledgeable about their products. 

We got their special two sandwiches for six dollars deal. We have a roast beef and a spicy Greek gyro. The roast beef is thin slice like I use to like on Arby's. The lamb gyro is nice and well prepared. We also got their root beer float with special deal. They have a limited time offer for orange cream shake. I think this is their best product. I hope they can keep it on the menu. 

Our experience was great. Restaurant is about 3.5 stars.

This restaurant has high ratings. It is about 3.5 stars in my books. The reason they are in the rating is due to the wait time, run out of choices because of the food run out. These are the area they need to improve. 

We got Swai Fish Dinner with green beans and cabbage. The fish was well fried. The coating was spice up with flavor. I like the fish with crispy coating. The side also good. The second dish we have is the rib tip with Candy yum and collard green. The candy yum is great. The rib tip is was well cook. Food is good. It has good flavor.

Very interesting healthy fast food join. They do carry vegan food. However I like some non vegan sections which is more interesting. I think the bowl here has good base for the selection. This includes many choices like cilantro noodle, Asian sweet potatoes noodle (recommended), forbidden black rice, Tuscan zucchini and more. 

We got two bowl. Our protein is spicy Thai shrimp and mojo pull pork. The shrimp is up charge with 8 shrimps provided. I also creamy garlic sauce and eel sauce. The topping also good. Our selection is good combo, it is not watery. Good mixture. 

Seem like assembling line is well train and in the fast track. Food has good taste. Love it.

For the food truck. Their food is is a bit expensive in compare to actual restaurants with seating in air conditioning dining room. Food is good quantity is enough. Wait time to pickup the food is bearable. 

We got the adobo pork with lumpia. They do give enough adobo pork. Pork has good flavor and less sour in compare to many adobo restaurants. I actually like it that way. The lumpia was crispy fried. It was delicious. We also got one of the dessert that we never have it before. We have the Filipino cannoli with ube filling. The purple ube filing is unique. Definitely is a must try. 

Overall our food is great. Love the food truck. Very close to 4 stars but not yet.

Moreno is the "sweet" haven for people of Brandon. An idea place for small snack on the sweet, big bite on lunch sandwich, or the hot deli dinner. Can you find it all in the bakery store. It is Moreno. 

We were here one time after 7 and they close. We only can wave our hand to the worker inside the store. Finally we are able to experience firsthand in the store about their food and sweet by come a bit early before 7pm. The display is look like the tour of around the sweet from cookies to cake. The selection is a lot for single store. Very impressive.

The bakery also has Spanish hot deli for dine in or take out. They have Ox tail, mojo pork, bake chicken, lamb and more. It is an affordable for lunch box to go. They also can make the sandwich to your order. The best seller is the Cuban sandwich. 

Moreno serves the community well. However they close at 7 pm. Please go early.

This restaurant do have the vibe to serve the Italian food. Their menu is constantly evolving on the availability of ingredients. This is very interesting Italian restaurant. I would suggest early dinning or reservation. Reservation is strongly suggested. Please call ahead before come here. 

The food serve of the day is written on the kitchen door in Italian. It give a chance for the waitress to explain to you what the dish make off. We start with insalata di Trota. This is Smoke Trout salad with orange dressing. This dish is delicious. Our entrée are Ossobuco Di Maiala and Seafood Pasta. The seafood pasta is just so so. It does has squid, little neck clam, shrimp, and fillet snapper. Big portion. The ossobuco is Beef shoulder braise in good sauce. It come with home made pasta. 

This restaurant total has 7 table of three. Maximum capacity of 21. AC need to be a bit stronger since kitchen and dinning hall are connected. I like the ideal allowing customers to bring their own alcohol or wine. It make dinning pleasant.

The Saturday organic market is slow stroke relaxing location. Meeting the farmer, pickup a few organic items, listen to the live music, enjoy the vege product. 

I like their vege burger that cook with extreme spice mixing. You will not know this is a vege burger by the time you have finish. I have the rasta burger with avocado. We enjoy our burger and the live music from the local artists. 

It is country, gypsies, farmer mixed. A little corner of the metropolitan that set a side for down to earth place.

It is about 3.5 stars. Not 4 stars yet. Restaurant is popular during weekends. We did call ahead for reservations. Parking to the garage is free first 2 hours. Not required validation to the parking ticket. 

We started with octopus salad. This salad has fried cauliflower, gigante beans, olives. It top with ricotta salata cheese and Calabrian hot sauce on the side. I like the octopus and I love the fried cauliflower. My wife entree is Naduja Meatballs pasta. It serve with tomato sauce and spaghetti. I think this dish is not impressive for the price that they label. It can be different on sauce or something. My entree is good. I have the the duck confit with pici pasta. This have good creamy sauce.

Our experience is good. Service is attentive. Food come in right time. Value vs price may need measures up on entree. Appetizers is good.

Newly open restaurant on the Groove. They have lunch specials now from Monday to Saturday. Seldom you will see Saturday lunch special. Enjoy it while they still last. The lunch special is included soup and salad. I like the onion flakes soup. The ginger salad has a lot yellow sauce. 

Our lunch dish is the shrimp tempura. We got 4 shrimps tempura, yum, zucchini, onion tempura. The tempura is ok. But I like the shrimp extension to to tip of tempura. We also got three roll combo lunch. It is spicy tuna, spicy mango shrimp, and eel avocado. I like all of them. The mango shrimp is interesting. Because is half cooked shrimp with mango. 

The food come out fast because we are the last table at late lunch. No one ahead of us. I also like the technique of sushi roll with little rice outwardly with very thin layer.

It is a bout 3.5 stars. Definitely a credit for quantity of food and quality of food. The food may just need to tone down the salt level on meat seasoning. Especially the carne Asada. 

We got the carne Asada for the entree. Mexican is a bit different than Columbian. Their meat a bit thicker. The seasoning is on the salty side. The pre fried bean is good and soft. But I like their rice better. My wife have the Enchiladas de pollo. I like the chili sauce. Deep dark red chili sauce is the best. I will recommend this dish. 

The restaurant is nice inside and outside seating. It is great place for snack especially Tuesday taco. Buy three get one free. I saw many customers is USF student. It is good place to hang out. I like their salsa to begin with chips.

Very close to 4.5 stars rating. I have call ahead for take out since I am near the location for my project. So I plan to pick up some food here to take home. They tell me need 25 minutes. So I show up 6 minutes early and the food is already ready. During the pandemic, they have their restaurant as 50% sit in capacity. 

I got my food home at 57 minutes. It is still taste very good. We got the salt and pepper seafood combo. They have great salt garlic taste. The second dish is the Singapore rice noodle. I like the high BTU wok technique on this dish. The third dish is the spicy fish fillet with eggplant. The sweet minor spicy sauce is well done. I like this dish. The last dish is walnut shrimp. The shrimp was fried and cook in sweet white sticky sauce. This East meet West technique is great. 

Overall we enjoy it very much. Definitely recommend this restaurant.

I have been to the Cheesecake a few time. Now officially give them a review. Sometimes I come here for dinner and sometimes is just the cheesecake. It easy to access since they are not too far from the parking lot. 

The visit from the past is distance memory. But I will say about our current visit is easy just for the cheesecake. There were so many cheesecake to choose from. I was debating to have the tiramisu cheesecake, Chris outrageous cheesecake, mango key lime cheesecake. I went for the tiramisu. It was really good. Because the cheesecake are extremely fresh, I refuse to have them in the 4 degree overnight. I eat it all and left nothing. 

Service is quick to order. They have added a flower whips Creme on the side. The box is special made for that condition.

Blind goat have the offer many local start beer. Why call the name blind goat. Is it a one eye jack of completely blind. It just the goat have sun glasses. Sound like too much drinking. But it is all good fun. 

This is a cute place. They do have the happy hour from 4 to 7 pm. The price start at $3 to $5 for the happy hour. They also have food also. I would said  small place with big package. They also serve food along the way of drink. They do have some signature cocktails that is good. I have not order the food yet. I will try it one day. 

They not just serve food and drink. They also have little game such as shuffle board and darts. They open very late at weekend. Weekday close at midnight. Other than beer and cocktails, they are very limited on wine.

On the way to the lunch in Valrico, we saw a Latin supermarket sign that was mention by my friend long time ago. It is a hidden gem in Valrico. The supermarket located just off the SR 60. 

Many of the service people may not able to communicate in English (Espanol only). By the way, I have stay in Miami for 11 years as little Spanish I know I can survive. This small matter doesn't affect me. The best language is body language. We were able to ask them to pick the food by pound in different container. I believe you also can do it too. My universal language is finger. Pointing and number  count to ten is the most I can do - haha. 

The supermarket has the hot deli section to buy food by pound, sandwich assembly, salad, marinated seafood, fried whole fish, dessert and more. They also have regular grocery sections with seafood, meat, veggie and fruit. The different cut of meat can be found here. By the way, when you check in here, the  yelp complimentary 10% discount coupon with check in, they will not honor. 

The supermarket also has cell phone sales, hair cut and fast food box service. This is rather interesting place like I am actual back to the Miami.

This my family goes to restaurant and we are frequently here. The food is consistence through out my visits. Other than pho, rice and vermicelli dishes, the have the chef specialty dinner dish. I like the fried frog leg with salt and pepper, cube filet mignon, stuff squid. 

Today we have order the combination pho, fried frog leg with salt and pepper and a rainbow drink. The food came out very quick and the service is good. This restaurant always fills with people no matter what time you go. 

The pho soup is not the best in the Bay Area but it good enough. The Beef Combination Noodle Soup or pho is come with Sliced Beef, Flank, Brisket, Tendon, Tripe and Beef Meatball. It served with bean sprouts, basil leaves, lime, and hot peppers, topped scallions and onion. There is a lot items to find in the soup and try to get them out. This a good dish when you catching cold or just to eat. 

The frog leg is deep fried and marinated in salt and pepper. It serves with a sweet sauce on the side. The leg is very crispy and the deep fried enhance the flavor. 

We also order a pre-meal drink. The rainbow drink. This drink is very colorful and pleasing to the eyes. It has the Red bean, yellow bean and green jelly, topped with Coconut cream and crushed ice. You have to mix it before you drink or spoon feed.  

I like this restaurant overall.  This is my kid favorite restaurant due to their fried rice. We will be back for many times.

The grilled is almost like the fast food restaurant but cook to your order. There is limited service in this restaurant. You will need to order at the counter and find a seat after your ordering and they will bring the food. 

The restaurant is a typical sandwich cook to order. The selection starts at Philly cheese steak to hot pressed sandwich. They also have the Black Angus burgers for your selection. Lunch time is a line. I am not sure they take order over phone. The dinner and lunch have the same menu. We were here for the dinner. We have order the Cajun Chicken Cordon Bleu and the Uncle Muzzies   Mufaletta. The chicken is well season with Cajun spice and top with Capicola ham. The sandwich is yummy and the chicken is half breast. They are juicy since they seal the juice of the breast inside. The Muzzies Mufaletta is the similar name to the general store in the New Orleans that sells the Mufaletta. The different of the mufaletta here is there are hot pressed. The sandwich includes smoke ham, genoa salami and provolone cheese with green olive in Cuban bread. What a strange combination. The sandwich is not bad but they are not as good as the New Orleans.

Overall the restaurant is good. I did not try their burger since they are rated number 1 in New Tampa. May be next time I should try that.

The Ramadan month is a fasting month according the observance of Quran. It usually last 30 or 29 days due to the visual sightings of the crescent moon. During this month, the Muslim eats only after sunset. 

Greenland Restaurant during this month serves the special buffet after 8:30 pm. The restaurant will not start the buffet until sunset per the observance.  The buffet certainly is great since many of the believers have been fasting for the daytime. The restaurant will fill up quickly and please come 15 minutes early to get a seat. Tonight the buffet include two different hummus, lentil soup, tomato base soup with Arabian spice, Arabian salad, bidet, fruit salad, yellow rice, grill chicken, roasted whole lamb and more. Yum. Got to try it before is over. 

The lamb is certainly my favor. The lamb meat is well prepared and you cannot smell the lamb smell. The season is will balance. I also like the tomato base soup of the night.

Greenland is a great Mediterranean restaurant around the USF area. There are many Middle East restaurant around the USF but I like this one the most. 1. Service faster, 2. Food has good quantities, 3. Good taste. 

Greenland have a lot o picture shot display at Middle East. All this famous land mark make you experience want to travel to Middle East. We have order the mix grill - shish kabab and the chicken shawrma - and kufta kabab. The shish kabab is grill lamb chunk with spice. I like the way they grill it with no lamb meat smell. The meat is tender and folk tender to bite. This is good. The chicken also came out perfectly. The other dish is the kufta kabab is make of the ground beef and the lamb. My kid always have a joke of "what is cow without leg - ground beef". Now, the mixture of the two type of meat and spice it up at the grill make the dish very desirable. 

The meal came with hummus, non bread and mix green. The price of the dish and the quantities of the food make the selection to the top.

Organic is the name of the game. They have organic food, veggies, fruit around the entire store. F you go to their web side, they have the daily special, recipes and events for the all people. 

We were there and we were welcome with the tasting of their food. There precook items at the chef corner include marinated chicken and salmon. One particular item is the wasabi salmon. It is good. The cold cut section include wrap, assembled salad, sandwich, mixed fruit, mixed quinoa with corn. They also has a sit down area you can buy food at eat there. 

Check out line is plenty. Store is compact enough and the parking is very available. Easy access is the key. It is real easy for the people in the south Tampa. Since the store close to I-275, it make easy to pick up any items before continue your journey.

Wing Stop has a good dry rub wings. I had ordered many of their wings in the past and did not find the love of it until the current visit. The Louisiana Dry Rub is the best that they have. If you have not try them, you may want to do it. It is addictive. 

The Louisiana Dry Rub is Cajun spice with hint of garlic. It is very tasty. If you only can handle the medium spicy, this wings is very good fit for you. I like it because of the spiciness but the Dry Rub with Dry wing. I am not particularly like the wet wings. So this preparation is to my liking. 

The wing is crispy and have good kick of spicy taste. It is not sweaty spicy. It is also crispy. The phone order was accurate and the the promised pick up time is exact. The price is good with $0.80 per wing.

Rare Ethnic Food No. 20

Haitian cuisine is unique in certain way. I am guessing they probably start with what they can find in the island. It is unique in their way of cooking using the ingredients at the island. 

The restaurant is counter order and bring to the table. We have order the Oxtail (Ke bef) and the Fritay Konple. The oxtail come with the side of plantain and one choice of side. Definitely pick the Diri Djon Djon. This rice have a lot of flavor and it have unique taste. 

The Fritay Konple is fried goat piece come with plantain and a fried veggies that I do not even know the name. The goat is chop to pieces. The meat closer to the bone is the best. Is is a bit tough but it is adventure to try. 

Overall is very good experience. We have special home made drink with mix of passion fruit and some other fruit. Not sure what the actual mix. But is good enough.

The store is at the east side of the N Florida Ave. you won't be able to miss it with Red Color Store front. The restaurant is just open and they are more into Korean food with New American twist.

The chef is very young. The selection of bowl is started with starch for rice or noodle. Then it is the selection of the sauce, then the meat, lastly the side. Good concept. People line up since 6 pm. When it, get to 7 pm the restaurant has the line to the door. 

Tonight I have the pork belly in rice bowl shop sauce with Russian pickle shroom and the chicken with miso love love sauce with mean green. The pork belly is great and good. The fat and skin is well prepared. The Russians pickle shroom is piece of art. Love it. My wife dish is not as exciting but they are good. The chicken is well pan seared to well done. 

Like the first day promotion with the drink is free. I have the lychee flavor and kiwi melon flavor. Both are good. The only thing for this store is the AC not working correctly. The whole store is hot. Welcome to the dining in sauna.

I like the young people have the new concept. The service has not measured to the standard yet but I believe they will. The restaurant is still in the try out. I am just evaluating the taste and the quality of the food and they have passed the grade in flying color. Thank to the shop like this with affordable price.

Very interesting restaurant in the Lutz area. This is considering very good restaurant around this area. The seafood is fresh, good quantities, and affordable price. 

Tonight is the Thursday night and they have two special. Kid eats free and prime rib special. We arrived at 7 pm and the prime rib already sold out. We cannot beat retiree around that area that comes early. Just kidding. 

We start our night with the steamer. Nick is the experts in this area. He shows us how to eat it. The steamer is steam to cook first. The outer black skin need to undress from the clam body. Then it is clean in the broth or beer. Then dip into to butter and enjoy by eating it. Some has added pepper and lemon after clean it. This is a very adventurous item in the menu. 

I have the fried sea scallop and fried whole snapper. The snapper come with the batter coating outside. When come to whole fried fish, you want to make sure the meat inside is cook. This restaurant did it correctly. The only thing is the coating is tasteless. I prefer it to be season. However the fish is fresh and good. For fresh seafood, you do not require too much seasoning. 

The fried scallop is very tasty because the coating was seasoning with flavor. When you break the scallop, the meat of the scallop is like a string which means the freshness of the food. 

Overall the seafood is fresh, the portion is very generous, and the service is great.

It is about 3.5 stars restaurant. Since no half stars 4 stars is given. 

This restaurant is very far from New Tampa. If I have to make a trip to here, I probably will not. Since I am on a assignment to the area, I decided to knock the book mark I have. 

I have order the wood planks salmon. Is is grilled salmon with some spice on it. If they know how to make the edge crispy will be good. The side are chopped Brussels Sprouts and mash sweet potatoes. I don't like the the stir fry Brussels Sprouts that much. I prefer it to cut in half and grilled in extra virgin olive oil. Because stir fry with chopped up Brussels sprouts taste like stir fry cabbage which did not bring out the goodness of this type of veggies. The sweet potatoes is good. 

Service is attentive but need a bit more attention to the customers since it is lunch time. Usually lunch crowd need fast service with everything including close up of the bill and get back to work.

This airport is easy access. The gate to ground transportation and the baggage claim is a short walk from Southwest terminal. 

When we were at the airport they are running the free luggage tag. This is a Mardi Gras week and they also have the numerous vender provide free gift if you have the purchase or $10 or more. 

The airport security is quick and easy since the line is short. They also have free WIFI if you have to access the internet services. Like most of the major airport, they have the comfortable cushion seat with electrical outlet next to it for you to hook up or chagrin you phone or computer. The restroom is clean generally. 

The rental car return is convenient located at their parking garage next to the terminal. There is a short cover walkway from the garage to the terminal. But they are not fully enclose and it is open air on each side. This is only down side of this airport. If rain with wind, you are more likely get minor wet. I hope they can improve it to fully enclose climate control situation.

We were here for the second stop of the night. I have book mark this place for some time. I usually like to visit places have Dim Sum. Since this is the second restaurant of the night, we just want to have nibbles. 

The restaurant entrance is very nice with glass wall water falls. It feel like walk into great restaurant. It open up the dining hall with good set up. Although it said on the front is Vietnamese Cuisine, but it has Chinese dim sum dishes. We have a few to try in the list. The picture in the menu make it easy to select. 

We order the stuff egg plant, Pork dumplings, fried taro cake, and beef tripe. All of them have good dim sum technique to prepared. We also order a black bean sauce baby Clams to try their stir fry skill. It is also very good. Overall they are solid dim sum restaurant. I like the food. Service is good also for the night. I recommend to try their dim sum.

I thought this restaurant tucked away in Tampa may not a good show. But it proof me wrong and they are indeed good food in south Tampa. They have some skill since they survived that long. If you do go there, I recommend a boba drink as Okinawa with brown sugar slush. This slush is rich in flavor. The price a bit higher but they give you large cup which make up the price you paid. 

We got pork belly pho noodle soup. The pork belly was glaze and in good taste. The mixture of the entire bowl was balanced and good. The Singapore Sling is actually Singapore rice noodle. If you go to Singapore, Singapore Sling is actually a national alcohol drink done in Singapore. It is not noodle. However, the name can be use for noodle. It come with stir fried shrimp. It has good curry on it. 

Our experience here is nice. We do not need to wait for long on food. In fact the drink take longer than food.

Mandy probably the most competitive in price for the restaurant on their shopping plaza. Food not the top notch but decent for the price you have paid. The take out I have has big portions to be able to share. It Latin cuisine with Cuban background was great for the patrons. 

We have the roast pork for to go. My wife saw the pork skin and ask if we could have some, it was added bonus when they give us the big piece. If the roast pig skin saw by Philippine residents, it will be gone first. Although I am not Philippine, but I like it because they crispy  and nice. My dish come with rice. The rice may need a bit work to completely cook. We also has plantain which is sweet and tasty. 

Overall the food is good. Who can complaint about the affordable price. We have to come back to try other items they have serve.

Tea Lounge is gourmet dessert drink. They have good selection of the mixed drink. You also can see your drink on the wall TV screen display. It will show you the different type of drink before you order. Those drinks are very colorful. The next section is an ice cream place. Both in the same store. 

My first drink is the tea lounge special. It has variety of jelly, boba, tapioca. I like the sweet coconut milk make the drink mixed well. I also got their daily special - Durian Extreme. This drink top with durian ice cream. Durian is very strong taste if you are not really get use to it. I like durian because I am from Southeast Asia. This drink also has the herbal jelly, longan, avocado, and basil seed. 

Overall the drink is good. The price is a bit high. Over $7 with tax. It is good with the hot weather we have in Florida.

The restaurant move to new place. It is a little smaller than the old place. I think the food may be take a step back. Not quite impressed. Not sure much to said. I wish they could be better. They are 3.5 stars in my book.

After the fireworks in Coachman Park, we were going to the Cleveland street for additional party to allow disperse of traffic jam. We pass by the restaurant that Rachel has suggested earlier and we decided to try. 

This is a Puerto Rican restaurant has some traditional and fusion of its country cuisine. I was not hungry so I have the coconut creme brûlée and skirt steak turnover. I saw Fern has the special chicken roulade - chicken breast wrap in bacon, chorizo, sweet plantain and cream cheese look very yummy. 

I was surprise that the turnover skirt steak is chop not ground. It makes the turnover fantastic good. The creme brûlée is not the normal one. It is more to flan base with minor caramelize sugar over it and top with coconut flake. This is one of the unique creme brûlée I have taste. You can skip all dinner but don't skip the dessert. 

We have fun in this restaurant and Fern bust some move of the salsa at the stage. The stage use for performance at special event they host, live music was play here. It was fun as the slogan said "I won't be impressed with technology until I can download food". Dream on. May be one day will happen.

I have been to many Cold Stone, this is the best Cold Stone that I have visited. During the ice cream day, the line is long. But it move very fast. Because the manager was there and the rest of the wait staff paid good attention. That will be the biggest difference that I see compare to others location. 

During the ice cream day, the promotion is buy one get one free. We were at the line but it take only 10 minutes to get to our turn. I have the cotton candy and the coffee ice cream. My mixed topping is heath bar. It work out well. The ice cream is great. 

I saw the manager help clean up the table, pick up the trash, clean the counter. No wonder this store is presentable. It make the customers want to come back. I also like the set up which make the order much easy when they have two counter to paid the ice cream.

If look for late night dinner at weekends, this is one of the restaurant has full kitchen menu until 1 am. We were here late 11 pm dinner. This place has more people when we finish our dinner. I was surprised more would came late night. 

We got the Korean Japchae. This is glass noodle vegetable dish with shiitake mushroom. The sauce is right. The sesame oil is fragrance enough. It is good dish. We also got the beef bulgogi. This dish is a bit let down compare to my first visit. Because they beef quality has a lot tendon. Tough to bite. 

Overall we have a good night here. Service attentive is a bit behind. I have to flag down waiter or waitress to get attention.

I like this fast food and beer concept. This open air concept is something new and interesting. The do have a garage type area for seating. At least this area has roof over it. This is a place to hang out for late night. 

The place has a lot different types of games on the ground. It is great to see that in the amenities of the restaurant. You can try different games and they are great. It is almost like cruise ship games area. 

The food selection is great. I would said Asian fusion yet can be Mexican or American cuisine. We got the chicken wings. This wing is almost like fried and bake. The coating is Malaysian Chili Paste. This paste is very similar to shrimp paste. Then top with fried garlic. Perfect touch. We also got grouper tostada. It interesting to have it. Not much memorable like the wing. 

Overall we like the concept with beer. A great hang out place. One thing to improve is tone down the speaker volume in the garage seating area. I understand they need to be loud for the people hear over the open area but not at the confine area.

I have been here several time but never give them a review. One thing I like the most about this restaurant is their lunch special and honey butter bun. The honey butter bun is delicious and is complimentary item before the meal with cinnamon butter. The lunch special has attractive pricing and affordable. 

We were here for their MLK special. I got the sirloin steak with rice and chili. The steak was grilled to temperature requested. It is juicy. The chili is really nice with ground meat. We have the half rack pork rib as appetizer. It is folk tender and fall off the bone. My wife have the country fried steak. The coating is seasoning with spice and crispy. Good size piece of meat. 

Our service is good. Food come on time. Not much of wait. During pandemic, they seat groups in every 15 minutes.

This bar is at old Seminole Height. Very interesting place. It is our second stop tonight for chicken wing which I have read about in yelp. I am surprised that they close at 10 pm at Friday night. Their business hours is short. 

This bar is almost like gas station converted. The outside has high roof open air seating for large group. The inside is more like small table big enough for 4 people a group. 

We have order the Parmesan wing and a Weihenstephaner Pilsner - a German brew. They also have other import draft beer from England and Ireland. Good selection for the beer. The beer is great. The chicken wing is fried and top with some sauce with Parmesan. Is tasty. 

Overall experience is good. Pricing is affordable.

This southern restaurant has majority customers is African Americans. If you there that much of people, it must be good. They do have lounge area next door. I like restaurant section to enjoy the food. They have southern food. The price was reasonable at the mark. 

We have rock the boat. This dish is smoke and seared Triple Tail fish. The blackened is spicy. But I like it. It accompanying the collard green and Gouda grit. I like the collard green. Very southern. Our second dish is the Never Too Much. This is the southern steak with frite. It is Kansas Strip steak. The steak is well marinated and grilled correctly to order. The bbq sauce is nice to dip. Good pink center. Meat quality is good. The sunny side up egg is good with egg yolk spill over the steak. I would recommend this dish. 

Service is ok. But the food is good. Definitely one of the restaurant will be back for their fried chicken and oxtail. Cocktails look good.

I would said this BBQ place brought to Progress Energy Village a meaty place for community. It is not the budget BBQ place. Price is a bit high among all the BBQ place I have been to. However, they do have a good tasty BBQ. 

We got the three bone rib with chicken and two sides. The rib has good seasoning and moist meat. Well seasoning to the bone. The meat also separated from the bone which good technique. The BBQ chicken is well smoked flavor. Juicy enough for it. 

The collard green and rice are the good side. I would suggest more attractive side that is different than most BBQ place will make them unique. So far they just among the BBQ place and nothing special.

The fresh market located at Corey Avenue between Boca Ciega Drive and Gulf Blvd.  the two block area have local vendor put up their tent and conduct their Sunday market sales.

Today I have try the beff Wellington pie. The pie prepare by a vendor call Savory Pocket. The pie crush is crispy and layers. Perfectly bake. The beef is braise with potato and other vege. The source of the pie make you want to go for second. 

This market has less organic vege which is disappointed me. We have visited the fried vege vendor. They have fried beat, carrot, okra and more. 

The November market have lesser vendor than the peak time. The parking is easy at this area.

3.5 stars is about right. The taco here is more expensive than typical taco place. But I the same time, they do use the better ingredients. The restaurant has inside and outside seating. It convenient for dog owners to be have seat on outside. 

We got the steak and shrimp taco meal. It come with side of rice and fried bean. The side was delicious. The steak was well marinated. For the quantity of food is good enough for lunch portion. The service is great. Better than I expected. Definitely a good area to have drink and taco.

The store has been renovated since my last visit many years ago. This store turn out very nice for inside and outside during night time. Well decorated lighting. It is still did not improve on the rating. Since they much improved form the last time, I commenced they deserved to have 4 stars. 

We walk in the store 10 day after Halloween, I am ask if they have the pumpkin flavor. They went to back to check and found the pumpkins spice for the blizzard. I have asking them to add the heath bar Chocolate. Thank to them I still have a chance to try pumpkin blizzard. My wife has candy canes chill chocolate blizzard which is holiday flavor. Not bad. The blizzard is sticky but I think is still watery. 

I like new interior with high definition tv. I watch partial of the NBA there. Overall service is great.

It is about 3.5 stars. Since the food is almost the same pricing than fast food, I would recommend this place rather than fast food. Ming Ming has many low budget sushi combo. I can see why the young people love to visit. 

We got the number one combo. It have sixteen pieces of sushi and 5 pieces of sashimi. Very good deal. For under $10. We also got the spicy crawfish roll. Both sushi are good. But not a fan for the sashimi. We also got two boba. A coconut and a honey dew. I think this can be skip for the reason the boba is not sweet boba. 

Food come out quick. Service is medium. Food is average but for the price less than fast food is good choice.

Learn about the special offer of Brio. If not their regular menu is also good. One thing I like Brio they change menu over season. The have many to offer. But I like the most is their bar food. 

I have slice beef bruschetta when I first visit the Brio. They very good. Over time I learn about their bar menu over certain happy hour. These menu items is less than half of the price. However the portion also reduced. I am ok with less item with less 40% I paid. We got the beef carpaccio and black pepper shrimp. The carpaccio has mustard aioli which make it great. The shrimp come is six pieces over bread and cream sauce. It has nice peppery taste. 

We went at happy hour before closing which is 9 pm to 10 pm. Many of the staff is already tire. But this is the best time after movie for snack.

I have been One Family Korean restaurant long time ago. I use to like their grilled fish. Those were before my Yelp day. I coming back to check their new lunch special. This lunch special has some good value. 

We got the Galbi and Bulgogi lunch box. The bulgogi (slice beef) is stir fry. It come with potatoes and broccoli salad, goyoza, kimchi, spicy pickle cucumber, California roll and white rice. The Galbi is the best. This is grilled short rib. I counted is about 10 pieces. Good marinated sauce. The short rib is delicious. 

Service is good since it is only three tables when we visit. I like their lunch special. I will encourage you to try it too. It is delicious. They serve many other traditional Korean dish. Next time I will have the mackerel fish again.

It is about 4.5 stars. For assembly food, they did it very well. The use of material is great. The process of material also great. The assembly is really nice. This may be their success of the restaurant. They do have ice cream, waffles, milkshakes, energy drinks and more. It is a Restaurant not required vegetable oil. Healthy choices also in sweet side. Guilty pleasure. 

We got the classic waffle. It has different chop and slide fruits. You can tell they process their fruit to sweetness (may be dipping syrup or sugar). So you will not find sour fruit. I like this way very well. That why you paid the money for assembly fruit and waffle. The topping and ingredients is harmony melt together. 

Each plate they serve has some writing. We have our name on it.

The restaurant is the best of the Apollo Beach. This restaurant was recommended by three people when we indicated we want to visit the manatee viewing center. My son teacher when he has the math competition at East Bay High School, Our neighbor and Rachel M. This must be good restaurant to visit.
 
The restaurant has the harbor view that out look to the gulf. We were having the choice of the inside or outside seating. This time of the year with 74 degree outside temperature, the outside sitting is comfortable. Our waiter is quick on the feet to show us the favorite dish in the menu. We have order the Cajun Salmon and the Tuna Tokyo that was recommended by the waiter. The food came in about 15 minutes. My dish is the Cajun Salmon that come with rice and zucchini. The zucchini is stir fry and lightly grilled over the open flame. This is the technique of the chef uses stir fry with the right seasoning and grilled it to add the flavor of the open flame. The Cajun spice on the salmon is almost like the blacken preparation.  The fish is prepared superbly to dine. The Tuna Tokyo is delicious too. The Sashimi grade tuna is grilled outwardly and slice in the ¼" piece and spread over the rice and steam green bean. Most of the restaurant sear the tuna with peppercorn but this restaurant use the grilled technique for the tuna. The inside is still like sashimi and great to eat. This is a know how to handle the material and maintain the high grade for the taste. The tuna is drizzle with sweet wasabi sweet soy sauce. The balance of the drizzle sauce to be contacted with the freshly grilled outward meat make sense. Well done by the chef.

The lunch price is very reasonable for fine dining.  We were happy to be here to enjoy the great weather and accompany with great food. This is definite a place to go. We will be back for more. The service is good and quick. The host also seat us quick.

Another chain restaurant that has good chef in the kitchen. You can feel it when the food comes out. They also has Wednesday night special for limited time. They are running a $9.95 6 oz sirlion with fried and beer. Such a good deal. 

I got special of the night. The selection of the meat has good quality. I have ask for medium rare. The outside is completely cook but the inside still see red less pink. This is very good skill from the chef. The middle of the did not feel cool too which make this well prepared over the grille. 

I also got sheared Ahi tuna. This is favorite from this restaurant. I like that overlay over Asian dressing slaw. It has every good thing with about the appetizer. I would recommend this dish to start. Overall the bar is good but only one person in the bar area make the attentive service is lack off.

Great food here. Especially if you have little money. You can enjoy a great meal. The restaurant was a Caribbean restaurant before. Now is tropical cuisine with a bit Caribbean taste. The restaurant is displayed with trays of food for your choice of combination. 

I got a plate of Mofongo as a base and cucumber salad as side. My main dish are the oxtail. The oxtail is soft and fall of the bone. Very good. My friend dish is the king fish with rice. He like his dish because not many restaurant serve king fish. 

This is the place to go if you want to get in and out for lunch in 30 minutes. This restaurant will be the best choice. We also got the guava juice for refreshing drink. Our experience is great. I will be back for their king fish. They also has dessert I have not try yet.

Decent Louisiana cuisine in town. Very good use of Cajun spice. They are actually on the Bayou and matching the name of the restaurant. Very unique building with outside and inside seating. The are netting at outside seating but the door wide open. It help reduce the insect invasion. 

The entrée included classic Louisiana dish. We got two app and an entree. First app is jambalaya bowl. The jambalaya is average to my opinion. The second app is fried frog leg. $10 you got three big pairs. It was one of the highlights. The frog leg is big and juicy. Very good quality. It go well with salt and pepper if you want to add them. 

Our entrée is the Lagniappe - Crawfish etouffee and fried catfish. This did is great to serve over rice. This is a large dish. We were sharing with each other. I also got Abita Root Beer with sugar cane sweetening. This is Louisiana root beer. 

Service is good because not many around when we have visit. I will definitely come back for some other items in the menu.

This not your typical pho place. The reason behind is they prepared according to their street side food vendors in Vietnam. If you come here, the pho soup base is very herbal taste. Typical American will not like it. But I love it.

I got the pho tai nam gan sach. It is combination beef noodle.  The four major meat ingredients are rare slice beef, flank marinated beef, tendon, beef tripe. Guess what, they don't use beef ball. The tendon and tripe cut method also different. The soup is darker colors with herbal taste. It is very good. 

I also got two bah mi one with special cold cut and the other is grill pork. $3.50. Good deal than most.  The other dish I got is the vermicelli with grilled pork, shrimp, and egg roll. My wife like this dish. 

The interior of the restaurant need work. However, the cost of the food make up the restaurant need for customers. The price is reasonable.

I have been to this pokeworks at least four time. I like their poke and they are one of the best poke around. During the pandemic, they take precautions for the food and customers. They allow you to come in or call in the order. They set the six feet boundary from the food counter. They did display each topping and protein with identification tag. So you can tell them what you want. 

We got the regular bowl with two protein. Their choice of base is great because the have variety. I alway like their sushi rice and kale noodle as base. The protein selection also large. I like to get scallops and the ahi tuna. The other protein include spicy salmon, salmon, albacore tuna, shrimp, chicken, tofu. The beauty is their have the mixed in, sauce selection and protein together mixed up before the put on top of the base then add topping. This is good practice. The sauce you can select different type. I like poke sauce and Thai sweet chili. 

Pokeworks has reward program. You might want to sign up.

Saigon Bay has been my go to restaurant before my Yelping day. They have been upgraded their restaurant interior to better open look since my first visit in 2002. Food  is still good, they do have some royal customers to keep the restaurant open is a testimonial. 

Today I have the grilled pork chop rice. It come with fried spring roll, rice and the pickle salad. The spring roll is crispy. The pork chop is marinated with sweet soy sauce. They have given two chop in the dish. Good quantity. Food is good. 

I have added the avocado boba Yogurt. The taste is good and the boba is chewy. We have table of seven. The food come out quick. Even one dish was mistaken too spicy, the replacement dish was on the move quickly. Service is good. My guest enjoy their fish.

This Outback is just me dale of the pack of the all the Outback I have been to. However, I still like the way they prepare the food. The service is good and we were seated immediately during lunch time. 

The food presentation and preparation are very good. The seared tuna is well seared outwardly and pink in the middle. The seasoning of the seared tuna has peppery taste in the way I like. The seared tuna was overlaid the delicious salad. 

The sirloin steak come in the temperature I have ask. Warm rare center and complete cook outwardly. The grilled mark make extra burn taste into it. 

We were in and out in 45 minutes just good for the lunch crowd who has less time to eat. The restaurant is clean and nice.  The only thing is need customers to visit. They have good food quality control which make it perfect to enjoy.

Sus Hi meaning sushi word was separated. During pandemic, only the Togo order is allow. They do have touch less system to be order online and pickup. It is convenient to operates their online system. The order was easy on their online platform. I got to chose many topping for my poke bowl. 

I got build your own regular poke bowl. The regular is three proteins. Some protein required additional cost. The topping can choose 18 items. It is convenient to select. We got two different bowl. The protein we recommended are the tuna, grilled steak and shrimp tempura. You also can choose three different sauce. Sauce to be on top of the bowl or side can be selected. 

I like the their beignets dessert. It taste like mochi. But it is great with condensed milk. The most I like is the pork dumplings. It has a good dipping sauce. 

They serve the sushi burrito, mini nori, sushi roll. It is simple food. They are good is because they have good flavor.

We were here for a dinner. I was not having a high expectations to come to diner. However, they prove me wrong. This American diner definitely has it place in the soho area. 

We got shrimp pop boy. It has 11 shrimps count and mid size shrimp. Good value. I also like the yellow sauce add on it. Our second dish is the De Rueben. This is roast corn beef in the sandwich. The Russian dressing with the grilled toasted bread made this dish savory. Great bite to have. We choose the cucumber salad on the side go well with the sandwich. 

Our last dish is tuna taco. The tuna was seared. But I think is over seared to cook the inside too. However, the bowl was good to have. It has sprinkles some tortilla chip on top. 

Our service is the best for the night. That the reason I said put them in the map of soho. The food came out quick. Our experience is good here.

This restaurant is hype at Lutz area. If you happen to visit Lutz, this is more affordable Italian restaurant with a lot to offer. Reservation is highly recommended because it alway full house in the restaurant. 

We started with the garlic knots and salad. The salad has good dressing. The garlic knots is a bit dry until you discover the butter sauce at the bottom. 

Our entree is the Nodina di Maiale. It is pork chop in honey mustard brandy sauce. It was delicious. It also accompanied with some veggies with artichoke and sun dried tomatoes. Our second entree is the Mare e Monti. Surf and turf. It has the scallops, shrimp and veal in lemon butter sauce. 

Our service is attentive. The price for the food is affordable. Atmosphere is good but I think the seating is a bit tight.

Nice set up for the place. However, missing customers. Need a serious advertising or offer to attract customers. I like the decorations and they are on their class. I think it is a discouragement for older people try to get to the top of the stair step. I wonder there is elevator to help. 

We enjoy our time there. There is some good dish and some average dish. We order the shredded duck and chimichurri steak frites. The shredded duck is average. It is crispy but I think I don't feel I am eating duck because is probably fried to crispy. The duck taste is cover. 

The chimichurri steak is well cook to my order. It is good piece of meat. The outside was well marinated. The accompanying frites is very good. The trick is to ask them to separate the meat from the frites so it is not soak my the meat juice and stay crispy. 

Service is a bit slow. It can be instantaneous. Overal experience is good.

We have decided revisit again this food truck. They located very close to Hard Rock Casino. The food truck has it own lot next to the church. 

This time we have the Carne Frita, Churrasco, and Bistec  Encebollado. The carne frita has good pork. Outside crispy and inside moist. It good dish to have. The Bistec Encebollado is like broil meat with onions. I am ok with that dish. The Churrasco is the best dish. It has good quality meat with marinated sauce. It is definitely a dish to get. 

Food come out quick. Not much of wait. They know who we are and make the announcement in English so we know is our turn.

I write this review base on the first encounter of the restaurant. 3.5 stars is about right for the first experience. The restaurant has unique way of Thai and Mexican cuisine. The also has some fusion of the two cuisine dish. I only have the experience on the Thai side. I will update when I try their fusion dish. 

This restaurant can heat it up the chili spiciness since they have the use of Mexican chili. If you like spicy food, look no further. It is sweaty hot. It also can go up a level to numb your lip. 

I have the basil spicy calamari. I have order the Thai hot. It did not disappoint me. This dish is wet sauce compare to some with dry sauce. It has good flavor. My friend ordered the fried rice. I think it need a bit hot oil burn and stir fried. 

Overall we like our time there. I like their watermelon boba. Close out is good and service is good.

We meet up friend here and try the sushi. Seem like all their waitresses are Siam. They are creative enough to attract customer for their sushi. 

They have out side sitting. It good for this time of year. We sit out side and we were able to see what people eating inside the dinning hall. Some of the table so close that only separate by grass window. 

This restaurant is Asian fusion with Thai and sushi. I have order the spicy tuna and Bahamas roll. The spicy tuna can be improved to make it dice cube to be more firm on the fish meat. The Bahamas roll is great. It is baked chop scallop with sherrard imitation crab meat over California roll. It is tasty for this roll. The sushi is added the eel sauce and make it more pleasant. 

The service average. There people smoking for little time than it was distinguished. We are glad that he did it.

Some fresh ideas. Hand roll ice cream has become popular and now in YBOR. I like the effort to keep the whole store in black light. When the customers walk in, the light already do the trick. Many has left their chalk memory at the wall that is cool color under the black light. 

We have ordered the one topping and the liquid nitrogen freeze sweets roll. They have three topping for about 8 dollars. But the one topping is about $5. I like the liquid nitrogen freeze items. This is not child play item. Because the liquid nitrogen can be hazardous if you did not handle carefully. They have written instructions how to dip and eat eat the frozen food. They also have to rule about handling and disposing the liquid nitrogen. 

Overall I think this is a hip place to try. Like the black light. It make you cool.

The desert room is just a stroll from the Mykonos restaurant. It is easy walk and they have a few table on the outside and mostly inside. 

The display was wonderful and they have all kind of cake, baklava, chocolate item, cheese cake. Many to choose from. You almost want to have each of every one. Then you become a pig out. Fortunately we already have dinner, and we just want to have a taste. We order a chocolate blanket with chocolate mousse. The blanket is make from dark chocolate. Chocolate very likable thing especially my wife. 

The pricing is just right but a bit high. The out side sitting can be people watching or people watching what you have. The minutes we sat there has attract some tourist going to the store to buy the desert. We kind of outdoor advertising.

This is about 3.5 stars restaurant in my opinion. They are above average. Some dish is good and some may need to work on. But I applause their attitude to create new dishes on their special of the night. 

I was surprised the restaurant has good interior and seat. We were their fist customers when they just began to open on Monday. They usually close on Monday. We have order the chicken biryanis and the Mutton Masala with rice and naan. The biryanis to me need more heavy spice. Chicken may need more seasoning. On the other hand, the Mutton or goat meat is excellent. Masala is a mixed of many spice and create the base. It may varied from different restaurant due to the mystery of the spice use. But I can said I love this dish. The naan is blend. Not sure they make it by themselves. 

In order to attract more people, I think they need to change the way of business. They need to change the plastic ware for the plate and utensils to better presentable serving ware. Disposable ware shouldn't be used for the dine in condition.

Rare Ethnic Food 35

I have been to many Columbian and Venezuelan restaurant but never come across a Latin BBQ restaurant. In it own BBQ way, this is unique to experience it.  You can fill your stomach under $10.  

We have three dishes here. The De Carne Desmechada (Ropa Veja), Patacon, and the Pincho De Pollo. The Patacon is traditional dish of Columbia, the Patacon here is top with grilled chicken, Pork rinds. I say it is just ok. The reason I am here is to try their The De Carne Desmechada. They use two fried tostones with one on top and the other at bottom for a sandwich. The infill is Ropa veja which cook very well to accommodate the Latin style sandwich. Very tasty. We also have the Pincho with chicken kabab. It think it can use better seasoning. 

Overall experience is good. I definitely come back to try some other item in the menu.

Bartaco is upscale taco place. This restaurant is better than the City of St. Pete upscale taco restaurants. They serve better taco if you consider upscale taco. 

The atmosphere of the restaurant is good. Since this place is rather new, the restaurant gets a lot of traffic. They do not take reservations but will take name down 45 minutes before arrival. However, the early call in not really work since they have too many customers. 

What I mean upscale taco place is the sit down restaurant place with creative taco preparation. They are some affordable taco places with typical taco preparation in the Bay Area; as a result I am not compared to that. 

Most of the taco is $2.5 or $3.5 a piece. I have ordered the Baja Fish, Pork Belly, Spicy Chorizo, Fried Oyster, Curry Shrimp, Sesame Ribeye, and Duck Taco. I like the oyster, duck and pork belly tacos. 

The service is great in the beginning but it takes too much time to close up for the check. I like them for quick snack in the future. I don't like the outside seating with tiny stool. I wish they can use the sofa.

I like this cafe has the unique character. The cafe display many local artists painting creation. The pieces that are display have a lot imagination.  If you like it, you can acquire it to take it home. 

We were there late in the evening. 30 minutes before closing. But we were able to sneak in for the last half hours. By then all the dessert is gone. I got a quiche and request to heat it up. The quiche "Keesh" is nice and good. I have look at their menu and they have affordable price small dish or sandwich. Their breakfast menu is also attractive. 

The selections of the latte are many in the coffee and tea menu. The only thing I don't like is the location of the restaurant in the crabby neighborhood. However, the area is getting makeover such as river walk and waterworks.

Open mic of the Thursday night is interesting. People performed and singing and playing music instruments.

Opening night. A lot of excitement. Free food until 9 pm tonight 11-6-2014. They have a 40 feet long of buffet table as a feast for the open night. They have cuisine of Indian, Chinese, Thai, Arabian.  The opening night party include belly dancer, hoopla hoop dancing. If you are not here, you are missing out. This restaurant locate below the  Ramada hotel. 

They restaurant menu include Kosher Meat. Catering and banquet is available. The food is excellent. The goat curry is cook perfectly. There is a long line of people on the buffet opening night. I also have the tandoori chicken. It is serve at the hot platform. I have a lot food and entertainment and it is free at opening night. 

They have outside sitting and full bar. Cannot said enough. This is a party. Great party.

I have a chance to visit this tavern with group of yelp friend for a UYE. I have been book mark this location for some time. This is good tavern with nice set up. This restaurant bar is converted from a corner house. It has unique set up for interior decoration. The outside and inside seating is comfy. 

Not many bar serve good food. This is one of good food bar. They cover the restaurant and the bar food well. You can order dinner for a nice eat out or snacks for bar items. 

This bar do have good selection of wine to choose from different country. It also has many local brewery favorite include several I like such as Coppertail. They also have the stout selection. Unfortunately they don't have Guinness. 

It has vegan options such as mushrooms hotpot, roast acorn squash, veggies burger. I would said got to try it yourself.

The restaurant is interesting with the radio remote controller on the table. You can catch any tv screen and tune to that channel for the remote radio to listen in. Unfortunately our radio is too low on volume even we turn to the maximum. 

Tuesday the restaurant have daily special on the half slab on $9.99. However, I am going for the different special with rib and pull pork for $12.99. This is more worth than the daily special. With additional $3 you got extra meat and orange claw slaw. The rib is good. The pull pork is ok. Overall they are good portion for hungry person like me. Compare to many baby back rip, the are in the medium. No wow factor. May be the Cuisine R&D can improve this. 

Service is good and quick. I like their Skinny Acai Cucumber Spritzer. It is tasty for the cocktail.

Stay healthy better quality of life, this is a place to be. Even I not that conscious about the choice of material or ingredients of food, I shop at this place some time. 

The Earth Origins Market sound correctly and earthy for the product they have carry. From the organic produce to organic raise meat selections, provide variety of value food. It has all natural cookies- Mmmm yum. It has selection of salad bar if you just has one person portion for a night. 

The hot deli has good choice if you decide not to cook. For ice cream- ice cream? It has the talent I gelato. Not many place sell this this ice cream. The place is not packed in the morning and easy to shop. It almost like has the whole place for yourself. 

The fresh produce is great, the organic powder for cooking is better. It close to the beach and good for the vacationers stay at the hotel with kitchen want to cook themselves.

Cute little store along the central avenue. I have seen this place because my Yelp friend review. I cannot believe they are at the $ category. As a result I have try them out. 

Their price is at affordable range. Majority of the items are under $10. But I go for the most expensive in the menu. The mix grilled. It has chicken, steak and kefta (ground lamb). The dish come with basmati rice and two sides. We go for grilled veggies and the babaghanoush. You can feel chunks egg plant in the babaghanoush. We also add the falafel. The dish comes with good presentation. The steak is the best among all three types of meat. All meat was grilled very well not burn. 

It is almost like cafeteria style order at the counter and food bring to the table. Service is good.

I would this store is good for any starter with their beginner guitar. You can find it below $500. May to start your own guitar garage band. They many type of guitars. Electrical guitar with acoustic or base. Their guitar has classical and ukulele. Other than guitar, they have the key board, amplified, semi hollow, foot change. 

The store clerk is helpful, they have special on sale and give away on the drawing if you sign up with your email. Other items they carry are stage use light, mic, sequencing light, electrical paddle, speaker and more. It show you can be one person band or multi people band. They also have guitar lessons. They carry item is not top of the line but definitely have what you want or they can order for you. The store space is big. You can try out their instruments at sound proof room.

I like Cake Girls mini cup cake. It has at least twenty flavor at any given day. They have mini cupcakes, wedding cake, cake all occasions, ice cream, regular size cupcakes, cake pop. They also has package deal. 

We were here for their special mini cupcakes and the ice cream. I have two flavors ice cream with strawberry and dulce de leche. This ice cream is creamy. It has good flavor. For the cup cake, I like the French toast, banana split, dream side and s'more love. 

The special includes the mini Monday - mini cup cake reduces price, two for Tuesday on ice cream, Friday four pack for $5. Wednesday and Thursday 3 pm to 5 pm is 10% off day. Those are good day if you visit. Since this is the only mini cupcakes not a chain franchise, the owner takes extra care of the business. It is up on quality for your visit.

About 3.5 Stars. This store is grocery and serving food restaurant. It is interesting combination. Many customers was here to have the food dine in. I got my food to go. Please allow 20 minutes to order ahead before pickup. They need to prepare the food. 

We got the mixed grill. Cost is about $30. It is big enough for two people. In the mixed grill, accompanied rice, salad, and more. The meat has five types. These meats include shish kabab, chicken kabab, inegol kofte, Chicken gyro, lamb gyro. It was a lot of meat to have. Marinated sauce deep into the meat. Tasty for the food. 

The pickup is smooth, the payment is minimum the touch less during pandemic. Server wear mask.

Newly open restaurant. Second day in business. Hip place with sushi bar. The surrounding has not fully open for business but this restaurant is ready. It is located at Causeway Blvd. it is easy to access from the I-75 exit SR 60 take Falkenburg South and right to Causeway and they are on the north side. 

The building is new and the so do all the interior is new too. The menu price is at medium range. We started Tako Yaki. It come with 5 pieces to share. Good coating and round as you seen in Japan street food. We also has six pieces of yellowtail scallions sushi. Good enough meat. The Chicken Karage is crispy. Good coating. May be a little salty may help. 

Our main course are the Kiwami Ramen - Tonkotsu Ramen. Good enough pieces of charshu. Very good porch egg with flavor. Their pork broth is at the light side. This is their style. I like the most is their Kiwami Torch. It is spicy king crab top with torch white tuna. Very flavorful. 

Food come out quick. Service is good. I give them an A for just open and paid attention to detail. It is about 4.5 stars restaurant. Since the quantity is is less for ramen and chicken Karage, it is 4 stars.

This is the place they open up after they close the Water Avenue store. It has a lot improvement from old place. Parking getting better. Food control also getting better. Sitting is better, more room for customers. But one thing is they are competed with established local taco restaurant. They have huge menu allow them to have more choices than other. Hopefully will bring more customers. 

I got the grilled grouper quesadilla. The grouper is blackened and grilled but I did not feel the flavor of blackened. It may need to be heavier spice. The quesadilla is average. My wife have the Carnitas burrito which is much better than my order. The carnitas was well marinated. They also pack a lot into the burrito with meat. It make the hungry people enjoy the meal. 

Overall our experience is good. Improvement has been made.

This restaurant is tuck away and part of the plaza of gas service station. The restaurant has some inside seating area. During COVID-19 condition, dine in has not been allow. 

We got one of the jerk shrimp skew and one of the jerk chicken. They did not have oxtail during my visit. Jerk shrimp will need a longer wait which they have told me. The jerk shrimp skews were grilled with jerk sauce, I like this appetizer. The jerk chicken was BBQ with right amount of jerk marinated seasoning. It is marinated to the bone. 

Overall take out experience is good. Price is at the high side especially at Riverview area. Value to taste is about 3.5 stars.

Ethnic Cuisine # 65. Dominican Food. 

This cafe is interesting. Less than $10 you can have your meal. Better than fast food choices. It is off Armenia side street. It is local cafe restaurant. They don't open at night and close after lunch service. 

I was attracted by one of the picture post about the the Pernil pork shoulder. I said I got to try that. I got my lunch with that choice. They give me a good portion with their gravy. I also added the fried pork belly. The skin is crispy. My second dish was the king fish. I saw they have cold fish on display. They immediately offer me if I want a hot piece not the chill fish. They fried a big piece while I am waiting. All lunch come with rice and choice of side. I got the cucumber salad and the sweet plantain. 

Food is delicious after 30 minutes drove home and eat. The store clerk was friendly. I like to try their juice and coffee next time. They do have sandwiches on the menu. But I like the display food.

Brand new restaurant. I saw Mark was there, spot I give them a try. This is probably the second store in the Tampa Bay Area. The restaurant is actually open now. As mark put the tip. The grand opening is 8/25. 1 to 5 pm they have the sample treat. 

I am here earlier before the grand opening. I have try their fried calamari and the matcha red bean slush. The fried calamari is very close to Taiwanese style batter coating. The coating is crispy. The calamari is great to dip into the sweet sauce. 

I like their matcha red bean slush because the red bean is savory. Matcha ice is well blend. It is great with the red bean. The food order came out quick enough for the take out. 

The restaurant divided into two sections. One side for sit down restaurant and the other side for the take out express. Price is reasonable.

I am living at Tampa over 15 year and this oriental grocery store has been here longer than 15 years. At then, this is the most popular oriental grocery ever. Since the competition catch up with them, they no longer hold the jewels of Tampa Bay. 

May be this place need a face lift or renovation. It feel old to walk into this store. I wonder are they the oldest or Din Ho is the oldest one. Cannot tell. 

It still carry the needs for most of oriental cuisine material. Now they are more like a downtown grocery store for the Tampa Heights. It has meat, shrimp, fish in the fresh meat and seafood section.

This restaurant take over a legendary restaurant Arco Iris. Now it is Caribbean cuisine with Latin flavor. This cuisine just match it name. I like the mixed cuisine who can serve the community. 

This restaurant is a cafeteria type food. You can select the food by looking at the tray they serve. God is warm. I prefer hot plate. However, the selection is great. It have variety from poultry to seafood. We have the oxtail with sweet plantain and tamal en cazuela cubano. Tamal en cazuela cubano is tamales are made by mixing savory cornmeal dough. It is special thing I first try. My wife have the goat curry with tostone and black bean rice. The goat is tender. Not dish meat item is a bit salty. Other than that. It is a good meal. 

The price is affordable especially dinner time. The place has an uplifting with new furniture and nicer environment compared to last restaurant.

Let get the bad things I can said for this restaurant. It is the temperature of the BBQ meat. Mainly they are just warm. Not feel like from fire pit hot. With that said, everything is good. 

The restaurant just newly opened and they are pack for line. They have table but just don't have enough waiter. So you wait.... we were lucky to have the bar area seat. It is much easy and you can watch what your neighbors eat. 

We started with watermelon Paloma cocktails. It is great watermelon juice cocktails with tequila. Chili salt rim make it nice to lick off. 

We have the Go-Chu-Jiang rib as a shareable. It come with three ribs. It is Korean BBQ sauce. For me this dish is just average. I would go for other items. 

We got the Texas two step. 2 meat and 2 side. We got the beef brisket and the pork brisket. The beef brisket is definitely done very well. The pork brisket is just so so. The two side are purple slaw and the tri color purple potatoes salad. Both are good. 

Service is really good at bar. Very personalized. Price is at the high side.

North Star Eatery is part of the collaboration restaurant of Hall on Franklin. The cuisine and style is Asian Fusion. It is mixture of food from different Asia corner. The food serve including Chinese, Japanese, Vietnamese. The Vietnamese bah mi is in the high side in compare to many Vietnamese restaurant in Bay Area. But since have not try it yet not sure if the quality and taste is worth that price. 

The Bao section is nice for the amount of the charge. I like fried shrimp Bao. It is crisply fried with crunchy coating. I also the the slaw that accompanied the assembly. It work well. 

I would try their pork ramen. It look very on the picture. It my to do list. The Korean bento box and other sticky bun or Bao will be other good choice.

It is your burger spot. If you need good massive burger, here is the place. If you have less than $7 in your pocket, this is the place. If you want a good grilled burger with sizzling outward, this is the place. 

You will be surprised the best of the burger is not burger. It is the grilled grouper sandwich. The grouper is slightly grilled with sweet smoky flavor sauce. There are big pieces of grouper. It is worth the money for the sandwich and is less than $7. Great price. The burger has come with bacon. You can double triple the bacon. It is good hearty food.
