There are not many table there if you decide to eat there. Many of the customers have their food to go. There are a lot people waiting for their food since their pricing is better than the fast food join. Many local has ordered from there. Don't forget their donuts burger.

Our experience is good here. I like the Florida Pink Shrimp butterfly cut and lightly batter. The coating has some flavor. Big shrimp too. The dinner is more expensive than the lunch. During the lunch, they have $9.99 special for the shrimp. I have pass by this million time when I leaving YBOR city, but never visited. I make this special trip for second restaurant to visit that night. 

We have ordered the Pink Shrimp with spicy shrimp slaw and French fry. It has hush puppies to go with it. The shrimp is in good size. If you go with plater instead of basket, you will get more shrimp. 

We also order the mangle clam - little neck clam. It cook in shallots chili butter melt. The sauce is great. This is my first time have this type of sauce. Very creative. 

Service is good. Close out is good. Parking is available on street side or lot.

This is the second restaurant they have. The first one is at US 301. I think the one at US 301 has the edge over the latest one. The one at US 301 has king fish at Friday. This restaurant is more into typical Latin cuisine food. 

The day I have visited they have the lechon, oxtail, and many more to choose. The entree cook in the spot including the the carne Asada. I got the oxtail, lechon and the chicken. It come with choice of the base like yellow rice, white rice, rice with bean and a side. For the side I have cabbage and the sweet plantain since I have two order. The portion of the food is great. It will feed the hungry man. 

The restaurant has the sit down area. At least this restaurant has larger seating area than the first restaurant and it is a plus.

For happy hour it is definitely a good experience. We were here at 5 pm and the place still empty. By 6 pm, it is pack with people. The happy hour is at the bar area. 

I got the steak sandwich. This sandwich is worth the value. It is slice filet with fries. The steak was well cook to the temperature that was order. The quality of the steak is high. We also got the spicy shrimp. This dish is big shrimp fried in butterfly style. It is delicious. We have the seared ahi tuna last. The outward was seared. The tuna is dark red color. The number of pieces also enough. 

Overall experience is good. Service is good in good restaurants. Food come out quick without much waiting. We enjoy our time here.

Kona Grill is great especially the happy hours. They are offered good discount during happy hour. The interior is contemporary. Cuisine is most likely American and Sushi. 

I started with happy hour drink old fashioned. It is ok. If they change a different sweeter bourbon, it may be better.

We got the chicken and shrimp lettuce wrap. I like they use a good lettuce. The chicken and shrimp meat was stir fried with good flavor. Great finger food. The next two are the crunchy spicy tuna and wave roll. This two sushi roll is my flavor here. We also got the chicken satay. It come 4 sticks. It overlay on the salad. It is good size of meat to share the plate. Our final dish is pepperoni flat bread. The pepperoni is huge circle. Total is 8 pieces. 

Our time here is good. During the happy hour, the bar is full. Seem like everyone got the same ideas.

Saturday they also have lunch special. It will be good deal. I would suggest try them at lunch for under $10 dish. Great deal. 

Benjarong is decorated very nicely inside. Actually not too many people here. I won't said they are authentic but they are good enough dish presented in menu. We have ordered the duck and salmon. The duck was deep fried with ginger sauce. I like this dish with good flavor. The second dish is the salmon in sweet chili sauce. The salmon come in good piece and they are pan seared before the chili sauce. This is a sweet dish may required more rice to go with it. 

At menu come with pre-meal item of the soup of the day and the choice of salad or egg roll. I like the compliments pre-meal items. It make more enjoyable. Less than $25 lunch for two is a steal.

It is about 4.5 star. I like the choices of grains and assemble bowl. It is a restaurant known how to simplify the assembly line and items. It is easy to manage. However, I would like to have more protein choices. 

The food here is delicious. The sauce is unique. However, they probably need to be adjusted generally liking and different from other. We got the salmon as our protein. The salmon was well cook with skins attached. Not many know how to cook salmon with skin. They probably one of the restaurant know how to cook it. The grain choice as base is nice. 

One thing for sure to get repeat customers need to have variety. To get the customers interest and come back.

Every third Sunday night this place have the Blue Jam. If you like the blue music, this is the place you want to be. The Jam is continue and non stop for three hours from 6 to 9 pm at the third Sunday. They switch out the musician time to time but the music is non stop. You will hear the harmonica, saxophone, electrical guitar, electric piano solo in the middle of the song. Sometime they have the one line joke with the band at the back. What a fun night!!!!!

We have order the frog leg and the fried clam during the visit. This is a free spirit location. It is great to have the flow of music and the food in the same time. They also have the bar with TV every place. You have to multi tasking three time -- hear the music, eat the food, and watch the football playoff. What can be better than that. The frog leg skin is removed and deep fried with dried breading coating. The leg have a lot of meat and soft to eat. The chef did a good job not to over fried and maintain the crispy of the coating. The clam is also coat with dry breading. This breading is a bit different then the frog leg. This is butter milk breading and increase the flavor of the taste. Most of the time we are unable to feel the meat of the clam. However the chef in this restaurant put a good chunk of the clam meat that you can taste it. Some of the cook over fried the clam and become rubbery. The chef here did a good job that the clam meat is good enough to bite and break it. 

The service is good. We find out that they also have band play 5 day a week. Please check their web site for schedule. We will definite back for more when they have the blue jam. The food price here is reasonable. The entertainment is free with encourage for tipping the musician.

Their everyday lunch special is the best deal. I give them an A for allow lunch special 7 day a week. The restaurant only allow takeout now. They protect themselves in the bubble wrap. In the sense they protect the customers by touch less. 

We got the teriyaki salmon and the chicken katsu. The teriyaki salmon was well prepared. The sauce on it is good. I like the stir fry veggies. It was delicious. Portion is good enough for lunch. Cannot complain for the price we paid. My wife like their katsu. The chicken was fried well. She like sauce that go with it. 

Overall it is good. We I'll try their Hawaiian BBQ next time.

The market is still have fresh produce and meat during pandemic. The only thing I would said is the the aisle may be make it single direction aisle until the restriction is relax. 

Today I was luck to see they have the cotton candy grape. But that is not cheap. I don't mind the price as long as the grape has the cotton candy flavor. In fact they also sweet. I got the premium prosciutto. I have it thin slice. They help me as much as possible to thin the slice. I like it they separate each cut with paper. 

I also got the MacMurray Pinot Noir. This 2016 has great fruity taste and also smooth medium body. I did not see much of this wine other alcohol store. This is from Russian River Valley which I like plus the good year of grape. 

The entrance has a lot of orchids. It is a welcome sign for me to pulse and admire.

It good pizza store in Tampa. Although I am not a good pizza differentiator, but I do like their pizza. Their pizza has good ingredients topping. We got the meat lover and it has good meat such as sausage, pepperoni, bacon, ham and meatball. The sausage is slice peel cut sausage. It enhances the taste. Many topping here is not your typical pizza store use ingredients. 

We got their specialty dish of the day. Baked Stuffed Shrimp with Crab Meat. The four big pieces of giant shrimp stuffed with a lot of crab meat. It come with garlic rice. This my first time have garlic rice. Very unique. It also come with mixed veggies. Price is affordable. 

The only thing is this restaurant do not have rest room access at the seating area. Not sure they have the restroom. Did not ask. The seating room has one kind of smell. Not sure what is it. Other than that. They are great restaurant.

Kung fu tea still have good ramen, tea, and appetizers. I still like them. The reason they drop a star due the recent take I have. At least three time they have changed from generous to stingy. The pop corn chicken I have is less than half of box. Very little in compare to other place for the same price. If they continue this way, I might as well not to have take out at all.

My revisit was satisfied. They were running the $8.99 deal during the weekday 3 to 5 pm. I got the chicken piccata. The chicken is grilled. The sauce has piccata and lemon base. It is delicious. It come with slide zucchini top with bread crumbs. 

Even thought the price is reduced, the service is top notch. The food also is great quality. They did not reduce the quality since the price of the dish was cut more than 40%. I have to tip my hat to the restaurant for such good quality.

This is the second location in Tampa. It is Mediterranean grille. This is their fir stand alone building with drive through. It is good use for the Coronavirus period. It created the less contact condition. 

We like their whole grilled chicken. The chicken is marinated with good spice. Chicken was butterfly opening to grilled. So it can completely grill inside the bone and outside surface. It also allow the marinated sauce with maximum exposure. The butterfly chicken is beautifully displayed. Our sides are the yellow rice and the baba ghanoush. All of them are delicious. The whole chicken is great deal all the time. 

Drive through is not most easy for this kind of food due to complicated order. Wait will be needed.

Rare Ethnic Food 52. Ethiopian cuisine 

It is close to 4.5 stars for my experience today. I kind agree some food need to tone up the spicy taste. However the spice and ingredients are there. With that said. Let me get into the experience. 

Mitmita is actually meaning one of the Ethiopian Spice. It can be mixed and make many dish. I like the restaurant reflecting their true calling. The culture of food is use a piece of injera to pick up a bit of entree by hand and eat it. That is how it done to enjoy the different cuisine. 

We have a group there can try different dishes. Injera is a crepe type sheet for pick up the food. The best dish is the Ye-doro Wat. This is a chicken dish with Ethiopian Ber-bere sauce. The sauce has so many ingredients. It is flavorful. We also order the  Kat Wat the chop beef with Ethiopian bbq sauce, Kitfo the lean beef is with the Mitmita sauce, Gored Gored the raw tenderloin beef with amaze sauce. Those are good dishes. 

Afterward we have Ethiopian coffee with ceremony incense to celebrate special occasions. It was a great celebration. On the appetizers, we have the chicken, veggies, and beef sambusa. Very tasty. We have good time there.

Very popular local restaurant. Saturday they have pack house when I pick up my food on takeout at 3 pm. Usually that time don't have too many people. Obviously this is a local favorite.

I have order the Bandeja Paisa. This is Columbia favorite combination dish. It has carne Asada, chicharron, sausage, egg. It is well round of meat. Love it. The pork belly was fried to crispy. Food is in good portions. The other dish we have ordered is Sobrebariga a La Plancha. It supposed to be the grilled top flank steak. But when I open at home is grilled pork lion. It is still taste good. 

The entry come with complimentary dessert as a flan. It is delicious too. Other mixed up the order, the food is still good. Definitely worth a visit. If you order takeout, call ahead because they are busy.

I like Mama Soul Food. It is definitely southern soul. It has been this location for long time. They are planning another location in Brandon. I was surprised the restaurant is full. It has good selection of traditional dish, BBQ, and something out of the box. 

We started with catfish nuggets. It is fresh and delicious. I recommend you get this appetizer. The catfish nuggets was in good quantity. For the entree, we got the baked turkey wings. This is something new that we try. The wings were bake to very soft like jello type. Very good technique. We also have the hog maws dinner. The maw is refer to pig stomach. They prepare and clean it well. The braise sauce was great. It definitely has it unique way of cooking it. The side come with it also very good, especially the candy yum has the fragrance of smell. 

Service is attentive, some come to have pickup. Parking is not the best but I got the side street parking.

This Ding Tea location is better than the one in the Tampa Water Avenue. The tea is more flavorful. Milk tea taste good with the cream milk especially for laxative intolerant people. 

I got the the Hokkaido Milk Tea with boba. The boba here is not the brown sugar chewy boba. It is more like the jello type. It is still good but I prefer chewing type. They do have choices for ice level. You can ask for less ice. The sugar level also can be requested. The flexibility make them attractive. 

Overall it is good above average drink.

I like this food truck now has it permanent location. When they are in stable location, food also better. It is not difficult to find but the map direction may get you in wrong location. They are just south of river on the left if heading south. 

We got the three skews kabab where on the menu said BBQ plater. The skewers includes lamb and the chicken. The marinated is good because it was juicy. Good technique. The seasoning also there for the meat.  The second dish is the Hamada Maqluba Mix. This is mix of chicken, lamb, veggies over rice. This is their favorite dish. Many customers order this. 

Food will need to wait while they grilled the skewers. Price is reasonable for the food. I like it because it is still good when I take it home after 30 minutes.

This place is pack at 4 pm. I cannot believe it. Imagine dinner time. A few good things about this restaurant is the reasonable price, good good, party atmosphere. The restaurant have some big screens TV. Imagine soccer games day in this restaurant. It may be only standing room only. 

I quickly scan their menu. They have daily specials. For Sunday, it is beef tripe soup. I got one order of that. It come with two sides. I got rice and salad. The soup includes some meat and beef tripe. The soup is great with softening tripe. It go well with the rice. 

My second dish is the carne asada in the lite side. This dish is not at it normal portion. The beef is average grade. Not the best. But the seasoning is there. It go well with the potato. 

I also got the maracuya drink. This is the infuse coconut rum with passion fruit. I would said is not the one to try. Cost is high Taste is so so.

Green is almost like Asian fast food. This is set up like modern type restaurant and they can be a franchise chain. Food and ingredients is not complicated since they don't have beef tripe and pork tendon to prepare. 

The green mint pho is typical Vietnamese combination pho without the two ingredients that I have mention. As a result, they are easier to assemble. They do have the pho at the right tone. My wife orders the grilled chicken and adds the grilled pork bun. It is extra cost to add the extra item of grilled meat. It come with mixed green pickle veggies and house sweet chilies sauce. I like her choice better since the grilled chicken is excellent. If they can create a good grilled meat with excellent marinate, I can imagine their Banh Mi must be good. I will try that next time. 

We also have the boba with papaya and taro. They are good and they are at the average pricing. The service is good and fast. I would give them 4 stars since they have new concept.

Food is good, service is average, table is a bit sticky. That very said about this restaurant. We were here for weekend lunch. It is great to be watching football games. It has big screens tv and bunch of smaller tv surrounding the bar. 

We got the fried mozzarella to start. Good mozzarella cheese. The dipping Mariana sauce is good. Our entrees are grilled shrimp with rice and broccoli. I like they blackened and grilled. Made one side crispy. The other dish we have is the sirloin steak. Good amount of steak and fries. Temperature is right as requested. 

Overall the service is average. The table is a bit sticky may due to the detergent that spray. May be need a clean water to clear it.

The Brass Tap provides the people connection when they have good time to join together. The outdoor seating which is great to customers with dog. This time of year, the out side seating is nice. 

After the snow parade, we found our fellow yelpers who attend the snow parade at Brass Tap. It is great to see them and Brass Tap provide an easy meeting point since they are actually at the entrance of the central Ybor. If you try to find through the GPS they will give you the wrong location. Brass Tap just at the right of the entrance of the Central Ybor. 

The service is good. Usually the outside seating is easily get forgotten. However our waiter is very aware of us seating there and checking with us often. The beer and atmosphere is great there.

I notice this restaurant when one of the yelper comments she went to her family dinner. I saw some of the some of the picture she post is delicious. I have book mark it for next visit. 

It is sad to see the plaza is empty. However the restaurant is the likely attraction in the plaza has most of the cars in front of the store. We have order two dishes of the menu. The waitress is friendly to take our order. 

We have the fried pig intestine and the mixed mushroom with round eye beef. The intestine is deep fried then slice into pieces and come with sweet chili sauce. The outside is crispy and the inside is soft. This is a plain fried intestine. I prefer the marinated then fry because is more flavor. Mixed mushroom include straw mushroom and the Russian mushroom with slice round beef in strip. The beef did have a process to tenderize the meat to soften. This dish is cook with sweet soy base sauce. 

In this area, it uses to have good Chinese restaurant. Lately many of the restaurants either is go backward to serve American style Chinese food or the main chef left. As a result it is consider this restaurant is decent among the Chinese restaurants.

Very decent ramen place. The interior was nicely decorated to fit the customers comfort. The order started at the front door just like Japan Ramen restaurant. Buy your ramen at the machine and they will bring it out for you.

I like the decorations with the Japanese cartoon. One of the cartoons is if you bring your grandmother to the ramen place, there is a chance she will make the ramen cross stitch. Imagine that ramen sweater :). 

We have order the tonkutsu ramen. It come with two pieces of pork belly, two half of porch egg, bamboo shoots and mushrooms. I like the pork belly pan fried to crispy before adding to the ramen. Soup is good. I think if they use a bit pork bone to make the soup thicker is nicer. 

Overall our experience is pleasant. Love to come back to visit to try other item in the menu.

This my frequent lunch place. Today we have an office lunch at this restaurant at Christmas Eve. The reservation was very easy today since there is not much of customer. Most if the people is off today from work, as a result, it is easy to get reservation. Usually this place is pack with people at lunch time. 

Today we have 11 people in a group. The waiter took our order in less 2.5 minute. I have order the garlic pepper squid with Thai hot. The lunch here is a combo with the soup and appetizer.  The soup is chicken rice clear soup. The chicken was marinate and process before it put on the soup. I always like chef to make an extra step of food process. As a result, the chicken is a bit salty when you separate from the soup but not overpower the soup taste. I usually don't like plain chicken that was not process. The chef here did a good job. The appetizer is the crab Rangoon (fried wanton skin wrap the ground pork). It came with see Thai chili dipping sauce. 

The main course is the squid in Galicia pepper. I like they prepare the pepper burn in high heated oil with garlic. This make the flavor enhance and great to eat. The restaurant majority of the food including some sweetness to the taste except this dish and a few dish are salt base. 

Overall the service is good and the food is good. If you have group, please call ahead before lunch. This place easy fill up.

We are here for a special occasion for a Friend Birthday UYE. I enjoy my time here with Yelpiest people in the private section. When the yelp people get together is always a mission to laugh and enjoy the food. Our birthday girl has a speech but we were unsuccessful to create for her a tear drop moment. Love to yelp and play together. 

The restaurant is very accommodating for our event. We have over 30 peoples and we enjoy every moment of it. When we have order, we share the plate with the group. I have order the Hot and Crunchy Tuna Bowl and the Dynamite Crab Roll. The Tuna is seared and chop into pieces. The crunchy part is actually from the tempura batter onion. This dish actually can be improve if they have season the tuna with spice and seared and slice instead of chop cube. I like the bowl with brown rice. The Dynamite Crab Roll is included the Alaskan crab meat. I think the mango overtake the taste of the crab meat. I have a chance to try our friend share plate with Dino & Jimmy roll. This is Alaskan crab meat with tempura shrimp. I like this roll better than the Dynamite Crab roll. I also like my friend Kale salad. It is well season and correct dressing. 

During the Sunday, all day happy hour price. Now, this a deal! I have the sangria with red wine. This is a giant glass. One glass is enough. Basically you have to drink some of the sangria before you pull the wine bottle out. Or it will be overspill. Love the drink here.

Stonewood is the restaurant when I am come home late from travel and order to go. I have been in the restaurant 5 different times and numerous to go orders. I like this restaurant because is close to my home.

The interior decoration is very nice. The seat is very spacious. There are a few dish that I like. The Grilled Lamb Chop, New York Strip, Oak Grilled Salmon, Clam Chowder with cram meat, rosemary Rack of Lamb, and their burger. 

Tonight I have the New York Strip in medium rare with grill asparagus. The strip is perfectly grill with original meat taste. The asparagus is not too fiber and the stem is soft to eat. I also add a cup of clam chowder with crab meat. This is one of my favorite chowder. The crab meat can feel the lump pieces. 

I usually call ahead 30 minutes if I have the Togo order. When I arrive, the food just completed in right timing.

Little market in the historic YBOR city. Very close to the Hillsborough Community College. There was many apparent near that location. It is at the Quarter Condominium. Just at Palm Ave and 19 Street. The apple map has them at opposite corner at wrong location. But is close to see it. 

We were in search of Le' Ann's Cheesecake. They carry 4 flavors here. I have coffee cheesecake and my wife has the strawberry cheesecake. These cheesecake come in jar. The store carry many type of wine if you want a retail wine. They also has deli section that you can order the sandwiches. I have seen the black bean patty there for veggie burger assembly. Hmmm. Just wonder are they good. 

The store Clark is very friendly. We were welcome by them and help by them. If you need somethings quick in YBOR, this may be you place.

Like it! Like it! Like it!

I am a fan of the Coppertail free dive beer. The beer is very tasty and smell good with the wheat. This is one of the best craft beer in Bay Area. 

Today we are here for the cinco de mayo food truck rally. When we arrived, there is only one truck that serve Cajun food. However the truck do not serve that, instead, they are serving taco. 

Well! food is not happening. We decided to join the tour. The tour is $7 per person. This tour is the best value if you visit this brewery. It include two beer tasting and a glass of wine of your choice. I have the free dive. My wife does not drink so I have another glass of Thai spicy beer. Very interesting. The spiciness went deep down your throat. You can feel it. 

The tour is very informative. The guide is very knowledgeable. He know these beer. If I am visit again, go for the tour.

Chief's Creole is just open a few months. They are located at the historical African American Heritage Trail. The restaurant itself contains a lot of history. You can request Mrs. B to give you a tour. 

Today we have a chance to taste the sample of food from this restaurant from the Red Carpet to Royal Theater event. They are fried fritter, vegetable medley, bread pudding, and turkey wrap. The vegetable medley is stir fry with special seasoning and garlic. It is very yummy. The fried fritter cannot make up what is the material but they are good, this item is not in the menu. The best is the bread pudding. It is very good. I have not tried their actual menu yet. But they have good lunch and dinner menu. The lunch is less than $8.95 and their dinner menu is less than $15. I will certainly try them on if I near them next time. Their lunch menu includes shrimp po-boy and their dinner includes gumbo or jambalaya. 

Please remember they are not open on Monday and Tuesday. Their restaurant is Creole Louisiana Style cuisine. Base on the tiny experience, I am given them 4 star. I will adjust my review when I have the dinner.

John Pass Village has a lot of restaurant. But I only bookmark this one. I have seen many great reviews here. So I decided to try. Parking need to paid. It doesn't matter is garage or street side parking. 

This restaurant famous on the lobster roll. I would said the roll is below medium price. Which is value for the try. They claim it is New England style lobster roll. I found it a lot of butter. The meat is a mixed of the body and crawl. Which is supposed to be. Some other vendors serve this roll more into the crawl meat which I don't like it. But this restaurant is fair with body meat. They roll is well above average with a lot of meat. 

I also have the grouper taco. I think the seasoning is way too salty. It come with two taco. I would skip it and get two lobster roll. The service is attentive. Food come out fast since most is premade.

Southern food with soul. You can describe this restaurant like this one. It has the southern flavor and most welcome for the south. I just wonder why don't they have one closer to the New Tampa Area. 

This restaurant is pack on the Monday night. They serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner. At dinner they have a choice of blue plate special with one trip one plate. Pile as high as you want for hot or salad  table with $10.44. However, after you see the choice of buffet. You know one plate may not enough. You will go for the Market Plate with unlimited trip and plate plus dessert. Oh man! Oh man. A lot of choice of delicious food. The Market Plate is $14.47 per person. Best is the fried catfish.

The catfish is delicious. Don't forget the strawberry shortcake. The strawberry was marinated in syrup and very yummy good.

My church always hire this BBQ company to do the cookout at church special functions. I have been eating their food go many times but never visited their actual store. It was interesting to see they have two buildings. The north building is most of the people dine in. The north building is more like the overflow. They also have the outside seats. The takeout is at the back of the north building. Basically like curbside parking service. 

Food is good. We have order the two meat special combo to go. We walk in the store instead of curbside service. The food come out quick less than three minutes. Record time. It is easy and straightforward. The baby back has a lot of meat. The chicken is great too. The collar green may need to add some bacon make it more tasty. But some can go without the bacon. We also have the sweet corn casserole. I like this item.

The restaurant is pushing out the new menu with $9 dish in 9 minutes or free. We are the in their email list that allow us to buy one $9 menu and has the second one free. It is a steal and the promotion run to 3/1 with email coupon. 

The new $9 menu has to order from the kitchen counter. The kitchen counter only operates from monad to Thursday. We have tried their pork belly chicken carbonara, prosciutto and chicken penne, brisket rigatoni, and diavola scaloppine. The one we like the most are pork belly chicken carbonara and prosciutto and chicken angel hair. After the order, they will give you a number and you can select any empty table.  By the way, you will not expect a lot table service. 

Since the meal come out in 9 minutes, the whole dinner only need less than half hour. This is deigning for quick outlet and short time. You have to love the pasta dish in order to love this $9 meal. They also run the 7 minutes $7 lunch. It will be good with short time lunch break with restaurant entree. You will in and out the restaurant in 30 minutes. Thus it is the faster dinner ever.

Rare Ethnic Food No. 27

Cajun style cuisine is a happy thought since I spend 3.5 years in Louisiana. It was interesting that Cajun people are mainly at Louisiana. Cajun has become part of special cuisine in Louisiana. Cajun creole style has many type.  This restaurant special in popboys with grilled and fried.  

Their menu included blacken or fried shrimp, catfish, chicken, and fried oyster. They also has Alligator sausage that I have not try. After 3 pm, the Abita beer is dollar off. This restaurant close early. They don't open pass 6 pm and some of the day close at 4 pm. 

Today I am going to mixed and match. I ordered the half grilled shrimp and half fried oyster popboy. The Cajun spice on the grilled shrimp is good. I also has the blacken catfish. It was good blacken with fresh catfish. I like the edge of the blacken catfish. It has the most flavor. 

The wait of the food is good, no too long of wait. It is an open air restaurant. It great to enjoy at 70 degrees temperature day.

This is solid ice cream place at the heights. Consider many place not even have AC interior seating for ice cream joint, this is a luxury. They really has pick up most of review negative comments and make a good turn to good. I would give them a 5 stars on the improvement. Keep it up. 

They very close to above the 4.5 stars. But not yet. Still they are move in the right direction. The flavor need to be a wow factor. So far they are close. But can be better. They need to know the best seller and may be a wow flavor. We have the Jolly green Apple and Mint want cookies flavor. Both of them are good. The green apple is a sorbet. It has very nice color. I like kiddy color very attractive. The apple flavor need to be a bit stronger. I like the mint cookie. It is interesting. 

Our experience there is great. It is comfy to enjoy the ice cream there.

Frida bakery has mixed reviews from my friend. I like to find out myself for my own experience. The bakery serve lunch and breakfast. The breakfast included many item with bacon. The lunch also good. When I was there, many come in for the soup, I did not try that. 

I got to pieces of their dessert for the my late snack. I have cassada torte and the carrot cake. The cassada torte has a cannoli place on top. The middle has two layers of cake and mousse and a layer of chocolate. The cake is moist and has syrup in it. It is tasty. 

The carrot cake is good. It is top with carrot icing. Layer with cake cream. My experience here is good. No big wow factor. They have outside seating good for the current weather. I was serve quickly. Seem like the customers who eat there enjoy it.

Very close to 4.5 stars restaurant. I like this sport bar serve Louisiana cuisine. This is good combination of bar and cuisine concept. It is one of the kind in Bay Area. It is the second restaurant like this I have visited. 

I start with the drink of Blackberry Moonshine Swirl. It is beautiful drink with ice and alcohol. It fruity, ice, moonshine, like frozen margarita. Our main dish is blackened redfish. Not many restaurant have redfish. I have the blackened redfish double blackened. It come with sweet corn grit. I substituted the green bean with a cup of Duck and Andouille gumbo. Gumbo is delicious. My wife have the Crawfish Etouffee. The soup is not fish which tell you fresh enough. 

The food experience is good. We end our night with beignets. They may need to work on this item. The inside is still dough soft. It need to raise the dough enough to get to the inside out crispy. Service is excellent and well train. Average working age is very young for the waiter and waitress. This bar has a lot big TV. Definitely match the name of sport bar.

It was good to have a brewery so close to downtown and very close to waterworks park. You may think the parking is a problem but they have designated lot for the brewery across the street. Easy access. 

This is a locally craft beer. They do have some interesting beer. Including kumquat and orange crush. These are the local fruit that make good use in the local brewery. Good thinking to represent the local. Do you know we have kumquat festival in Dade City. 

Deja Moo Nitro has some exquisite taste for dark beer. The peanut butter Deja Moo is interesting. They have some beer I will try on next visit. They also has sour beer such as Sakura. There is a name of the beer call ginger mullet. Actually no ginger or mullet. 

The deco is contemporary. So good art work. Mostly high top chair. You can order your food in to enjoy your beer.

I like this Mill location in compare to the one in St Pete. This place is a lot larger with plenty of parking. It is important to have parking at soho area. As a result it is major plus. The new space also have large bar area. We were there for the happy hours. It was our fourth stops. 

The happy hour menu is simple. But it is good enough to enjoy your time here. Our group order the Crispy Buffalo Brussels, Watermelon Bruschetta, and Swedish Meet Ball. I don't like the Brussels that much. May because it is Buffalo which involves sour vinegar. I like the Watermelon Bruschetta the most. It has good cheese with chop watermelon. The meat ball also good. 

I like my drink with Basic Beach Cocktails. It is refreshing. Our bar tender has to serve on table to cover the late colleague and leave us not much of attentive service.

Very close to 4.5 stars. Fish guy is my place if I pass by again. It is great seafood market and restaurant. Seafood is fresh and delicious. You cannot believe a side street of Holiday area has this great seafood restaurant. Local know about this place. 

We start with 3-pepper crab soup. Plenty of crab meat. A bit spicy. Almost like Cajun style. We like this unique soup. We do have to send back the New England clam chowder. They taste a bit sour like vinegar. We also order a dozen of cedar key little neck. It is fresh sea taste. We t come with cocktail and butter dipping sauce. 

Our main dish is the blackened grouper, shrimp and scallops. The scallops is sea giant scallops. Since we close to home of scalloping, it is big and great. The shrimp come in five pieces. The grouper is good quantity. I like the Cajun blackened they use. The other dish is lobster roll. This roll I am not recommended. It has the imitation crab meat and lobster meat. I rather they use full lobster. 

Service is a bit slow. It also can be a lot more attentive. Other than that, it is great restaurant.

Finally south Tampa has a good enough poke place. This place does the poke right. Why I said that. Because they take extra step to marinate your selected poke with add on separately. That way the poke is separate from the base and topping. 

First chose your size. Figure out how many scoop and base you want. Second chose your base. The base includes brown rice, white rice, kale slaw, or power blend. Third chose your poke protein. I will definitely go with double tuna or tuna plus salmon. Then chose you mix-in sauce. This part can get tricky because whatever you chose is on you. I usually chose multiple sauces in sweet side and poke sauce which is a bit salty. I also like it to go with green onion and cilantro. I wish they can add the corn, edamame, cucumber in the mix-in. It will be better. Why include as topping. 

The great thing of this place is the have many toppings with fruit items which I like. Price wise is above average. But the have good sauce choice at the end. If use multiple sauce at the mix-in section, you may want warn them ahead so they don't put the first sauce too much become unbalanced. Good luck for the mix-in. If you afraid you will fail on the sauce choice, try their pre set poke.

I have book mark this place some time. Brett 5 stars has move up my schedule to visit. The mofongo is definitely recommended for this place. It actually match their name in high standard. During our visit, the number of customers is lack off I hope other will support them. 

We got the mofongo. They prepared it very well. It has the pull pork in it and so do the fried pig skin. It is delicious the way they prepared it. The mofongo is soft. Next time I will try their different mofongo. 

We have ask the palomilla to be grilled and top with caramel onion. The steak is big enough. Size and quantity make this dish affordable. The steak was grilled correctly. The salad is good. But the accompanying congri rice do not match the standard. You can find the non cook rice along side. Quality control need to be made in order to get high mark. 

Service is normal. Food come out in good speed. Seem like one waitress for serving and one for bringing out the food.

This Sonny BBQ is better than the one at Busch Blvd. I mean they are better because the way to preserve the juiciness of the meat. We have been here before. But today is the the tax day special, and we decided to take the advantage. The tax day special is $6.99 for the St. Louise rib and two side all day during the tax day. Good deal. 

Some of the Sonny prepared the over cook or dry, but not at this place. I also like their slice pork. Especially the all you can eat slice pork deal. If you are hungry enough, it is a good choice for you. Plenty of food for money.

This is about 3.5 stars restaurant. Thy service is good and the food delivery is less than 7 minutes. Very fast. May be is tax day and they already prepared this items ready to serve.

HOT AND SPICY. 

Happi Wok know how to turn up the heat for the dish. I mean real heat in the spiciness. Other than than their regular American menu, the have the Chinese menu for the Szechuan cuisine. Szechuan people in China eat really hot food. If you don't know how to order from Chinese menu, bring a friend that can read this menu. 

I would recommend their beef noodle. This is best dish in this restaurant and it is dish no. 93 in the Chinese menu. It come with pickle veggie and cube beef. The soup base is a bit spicy but I think you can handle it. 

We have the red pepper chicken (no 14), the the husband and wife beef lung and tripe (no 44) and the sweet vinegar rib (no 40). I like the pepper chicken. 

Service is good. Food in good value. This is a gem for the Chinese USF student who live around there. If you want to try it out may be invite me.

There are a lot of reviews for this restaurant. We were here because of popularity. Pappy started since 2008 and get a lot of attention Nationally. Food Network has rank them number 1 in US. 

They are using Apple wood smoke with dry rub ribs. This rib cook for long time and you can see the rib meat fall off the bone. We got full slab with with sweet potatoes fry and the ear of corn. The sweet potatoes fry is crispy and good flavor. The rib is fantastic. Although is is most popular but not need to kill over it. 

The restaurant move the line quick by taking order and the seating after order. The entrance is strange from the back. The service is good considering this is busy restaurant. They are not the best to my opinion but still very good in St. Louis.

Korean Street food on sale. The restaurant is located inside the grocery. When the grocery close, the restaurant also close. As the result, the hour is odd. 

Dosi meaning city and Rak meaning joy, pleasure or comfort. But when two word join together is pack meal or lunchbox. Very interesting. They do serve excellent lunchbox. I would recommend if you have less money with quick 3 combinations meal. Here is the place. We have been here twice. We got the bulgogi and the spicy pork pack meal. It come with fish cake and purple rice. The meat dish is cook at the order and fresh delicious. 

Not much of service since this is a fast food place. Definitely better than most fast food for the same price. I would said better deal with meat and veggies.

Great farm market to visit. It is clean and organized. This market is at US 92 best thing can happen to the people who pass by. It is definitely the choice for a good stop for dessert. This is the reason why we are here mostly. They have serve the tangerine soft serve. It is one of the kind. It also serve the shake. I didn't get it because it is 5 % milk. I cannot take that. I wish they have 2% or less milk. Unfortunately they don't have those options. They also got dole whip. I think if they can tone down the sour a bit will be better. 

Other than the dessert, they have all kinds produce. If you get produce here will be very fresh because they are just in the farm area. Definitely good for daily grocery. 

Social distancing is observing here. Will plan for people who sho here. Mask is just the county order.

This bakery serve a lot of sandwiches and pastry. The Hispanic bakery here is outstanding. The way they prepare the meat pie is fluffy on the crust and dry chicken in the inside. The crust is very good when you arrive before lunch time when they have very fresh items. 

I have the chicken pie there and it is great. I also get the bread pudding and the chicken potato ball. They are just out of oven. They certainly many item to choose from including choripan, areguipe pastry, pan de coco, Guava Chicharron, wine cake. This name sound very tempting and good. So good have your personal cheat day. You don't tell, who will know. 

Other than the bakery, they serve coffee, juice, breakfast item. Sound very good to start your morning routine. The people who serve there are very friendly and kind.

City buffet work for me since I not a buffet person. If you come here, go for dinner is better. More choices on food. 

Food is fresh compare to many buffet place at this price range. Their weekend dinner is $13 with a soft drink. Hibachi grill with marinated steak cut or skew. Skew shrimp for hibachi. The crawfish is fresh enough and tail easily separated from the shell. It has snow crab and blue crab for your choice. 

The hot food is above average on the serving. Considered this is very remote area and they can provide better quality food. 

I like the manager on the floor keep this operation on target. Service is A+. Selection is good enough for the price range. We enjoy our time here.

3.5 stars to my book. 4 stars given. Press Box really has Tampa in the map. It is really local dive bar. Tuesday is the time to visit because theY have 75 cents wings. The food here is affordable. If you have yelp check in, you got the pint of beer free. 

The bar have pool table, outside seating, juke box for music and more. Many are here is regular. The bar open to late 3 am in the morning. If you need a place to hang out late Aaron night, this may be your place. The bar is a bit rough although I did not see motor cycle rider here. We like the wing we have order. We got cajun dry rub and Parmesan wing. Both wing are great. We also got garlic butter wing. They are delicious  too. 

Service at the bar is ok. Food come out quick even close to midnight.

If you come to this place, be prepared for slow food delivery. With the warning labels ahead, everything is good. Understand each dish is prepared and grilled at the spot, it will take time to prepare. 

I have been here several time and got use to the slow delivery. The food is good and reasonable price. One thing you can avoid anyone by come here ahead of the crowd. I like their grilled meat. Especially their grilled lamb. They are very good here. If you want halal, they prepare that way. The accompanying sides are the salad and grilled tomato. The rice is the basmati and they are great. I also like their grilled chicken. 

I would suggest order a cup of Persian tea. It can be sweetened by adding the sugar. Service here is slow so get your order in earlier. It also part of the groceries store, so check them out.

Very good lunch place. In addition, a good breakfast place. They start early and close before dinner. I would said this restaurant is definitely 4.5 stars restaurant. They located in a small plaza and may be they are the only restaurant. Which make the parking area basically for this restaurant since no compete restaurant. 

I got the two pork chop. They actually has plenty of food because it come with two eggs, side of your choice and toast. I have my egg sunny side up. Seem like their egg are not regular egg because the yolk is more yellow. May be farm raise. I like the pork chop seasoning with a bit sweet. It look like Hawaiian style cooking. The chop is good grade because it has good fiber when you break the meat. 

I would compliment the chef skill to Caramelize the pork chop. The service is excellent. It is definitely the destination for lunch and Breakfast.

Finally I have visited the Brandon Quickly. This location has a lot of hospital customers. The drink is just above average Tampa boba cafes. I would recommend it. We were here for the boba and their hot food combo. I got the winter Mellon and rainbow jelly. It is good. 

I also got the three fruit boba before. I like it. The combo has included the grilled pork rice. These combo meal and drink is good for the customers. The meal include the grilled pork, pickle veggies, braised egg. It is affordable combo meal with drink at one price. 

Service is good.

I like Thali Plate. And this restaurant has it. Thali mainly South Indian food. It is a meal with multiple dishes. The biggest thali can consist of 45 dishes which is call Kutumb. We don't have it in Tampa. At least the Thalia here have 9 dishes. Considering it is big enough. 

I order the non veggies thali. It has tandoori chicken, goat curry, chicken butter curry, chick pea curry, sweet rice pudding, mango lassi, rice, nan, and veggies. They have good take out box to contain this thali. I was surprised they have compartment to fill. I think the take home portion is smaller compared to eat it there. The mango lassi is good. I like the goat curry and the tandoori chicken. 

The preparation will take minimum 30 minutes. So call ahead is a good ideal. The food is delicious but the portion for take out is small.

Crumbl Cookies is new kid in the block. It got a lot of attention. At least there is some line there. If you want to jump the line, just order from kiosk. There 8 stores in Florida. This is the first in Tampa Bay Area. 

The cookie selection is simple. The flavor did change time to time. We got the peaches N' cream and milk chocolate chip. Both cookies are good. The peaches N' cream is serve chill. The cream is very good. The milk chocolate chip serve warm. It is also good when you eat it at parking lot. 

Please remember there are two types of serving cookie. Chill or warm. You might want to know. The smaller cookie only for catering menu. Mostly the sugar cookie. They do have cream and drink if you like.

Wawa is very much go to gas station this day. They have good grade gas. The location near Wiregrass is clean and save. The place is well lighted. They have free tire pump with pressure gage. It is easy to know when you done with the preset tire pressure. The pump will beep you. 

We were here for the gas and the Siptopia. Wawa is running the special on the drink. 16 oz drink only $2. Good deal. I got the peach banana smoothie with whip cream. We also got the chocolate cookie and cream Creamy smoothie. Those are very good. I also have their flurricanes. This is salt caramel with mixed of the crust cookie in it. Very interesting.  Go there before run out of promotion. The 24 oz only $3. Worth the money.

Meat Market have a good thought on the food and decoration of the dining hall. It is hip looking upscale dining experience with a few things to offer. We were on the first round of multi restaurants happy hour tour. Meat Market was our first stop and did not disappoint us. I like the out side seating, bar area and the dining hall. They do provide heat lamp if you sit close to outside. 

I start with a Quatro Verde. This cocktail has illegal mezcal, ancho reyes, and basil. It is a good cocktail with great alcohol in it. It worth the money. The chef start with complimentary spicy corn. It was great to go with the alcohol drink. The appetizers we got is roasted escargot. Each chamber has at least two escargot which is why they charge high price to make up the value. The next appetizer is the wood grilled Churrasco and fries. The steak is good quality with good fries. This is most expensive item in the appetizers. I would expect better. But still good. 

Overall the bar service started too slow. Need to pay attention to customer. After they engaged, everything is good.

Lakeside tea was at my book mark for long time. I have previous visited this place and not write a review. My wife has visited this place for lunch. I only visited this place for drink. The inside has good space for sit down and chat. That is the reason they are tea place.

I have the strawberry matcha with milk. It three colors drink look fantastic. I also has boba in it. The drink is thick and rich in flavor. I would consider is a good tea. This review do not include the food they have. May be next review. 

The tea will require some time to make. Especially three ingredients. I like that they make the matcha tea from powder and use the small broom to mixed it before into the cup. It is thick in caffeine.

Finally Pinellas has shot chicken place. This place is better than the one in Tampa. This hot chicken place are having their own building and drive through. I would said they are not quite organized yet. The menu definitely will make the first timer scratch their head. Because the order need three steps. First choose type of chicken, then the heat or spicy, then the side. This usually take time to make one order. As a result, it is slow to order if only one register open. This need to change. It need minimum two registers all time until their customers know immediately what they want. 

The food is cook to order. So you need to be patient and wait. It is worthy to wait because it is good. I like the coating, flavor, and good pieces of chicken. We have chicken & waffle and quarter dark. The waffle was well made. The strip is well marinated. I like my quarter dark better because it has great coating. I got the hot level.  It is good heat.

This is the second restaurant they have open. The space is a lot beautiful than the YBOR location. They have a small room for hosting a special function or event. The restaurant is well decorated. I like the new space. 

We were here for their lunch special. Two roll with soup or salad is $11. It is a good deal. The restaurant is kind of empty. It need good promotion for the local Carrollwood to attract more customers. We got the two roll with Atlantic and Tokyo Rolls. The Atlantic roll is very nice. It is a Striped Bass with imitation crab meat and lemon slice. The lemon slice enhances the flavor. I would recommend this roll. The Tokyo roll has tuna and yellow tail mixed. The spicy sauce make it very nice. 

Our next dish is the baked mussels. But I like this dish better at YBOR because they bake till crisp on the top. Nonetheless, it is good big pieces of mussels. We also got the tempura bento box. The tempura is not measured up because they just dip the wet batter and fried. They did not add the tempura while fried to make it hairy. 

Overall is a good visit. Good service.

I would said their food is more to sweet side. This is their second stores in Tampa. Their original store is near Riverview. I have visited that store in Riverview. I think this store is better. There was no one eat in during the lunch time. But when we are leaving there is a couple walk in. 

My wife have the spicy drunken noodle with tone down heat. She have the chicken drunken noodle. The noodle is still wet. Not dry enough. But they do have a lot of quantity. Enough chicken meat. 

I have the garlic pepper shrimp. This dish is $15 with 8 big shrimps. Shrimp size is great. They do come with Thai hot like I ask. Burning spicy. I would said their technique is in good categories not in great categories. I still like it. It is great to go with rice. 

Service is great. I would recommend the server wear mask.

This is my go to Wawa in Largo. I cannot believe I have not given them a review. The gas here is one of the lowest price who accepts credit card as cash price. I think all gas station should do it or post two price with one for cash and one for credit. That way save customers a trip if they decided not to pump. 

This gas station has great number of pumps and with middle turn around. It also has ethanol boat fuel. It is great for any type of transportation. The convenience store is great with many things to sell. You can grab an hoggie or latte.

Osaka Sushi is new. I give an A for the interior decoration. It is very modernize and aesthetic pleasing. The selection of light and furniture match the beauty of the space they have. 

They are running the happy hour sushi from Monday to Saturday. The special start at 4:30 pm to 6:30 pm. They have the $1 sushi, $2 sashimi, $3 roll. The sushi is good size and thin. We have quite a few such as surf clam, eel, masago, snapper, white tuna, tuna. All is fresh. 

The roll is tasty. They include spicy tuna, spicy salmon, shrimp tempura, Boston, kamikazi roll. They are all good. The rice is cook correctly and season correctly. The only thing I can think off is the the process for spicy tuna roll. Instead of dice and chop, the fish meat is food process to ground meat. 

The service is great. I don't know anyone is running the special in weekend except them. So enjoy while it last.

I like business owner make good classy decorations for the customers to enjoy. This Vietnamese restaurant has good decorations for date night and enjoy good Vietnamese cuisine. Price just right on the budget average customer and a good place to hang out. 

They have bar area with high stool with TV. They also has main dinning hall. The special section are the four corner couch area where dating make nicer. Outside seating is more casual for people want to watch people. 

We have ordered the Da Nang Style noodle and the Iron Pot. The Da Nang noodle included large flat noodle, shrimp, pork in Shrimp base soup. It is good soup which is very similar to Malaysian prawn me soup base. The difference is they are sweet side and the the Malaysian prawn mee is at the spicy and salty side. 

The iron pot include shrimp, beef, chicken, eggplant, mushrooms and clear rice vermicelli. I like the iron pot to keep food warm all time even after half hour of eating. 

The service is ok. Our waiter only take our order and disappear, but other waitress was available. Manager is very nice. The only thing of the downfall is not because of the restaurant. It is about the parking on the street is hard to find.

Usually pizza is not my first choice of selection for any dinner.  I prefer it to be lunch or something quick and get back to work. Wood Fire Pizza has prove me wrong.

We were here 9:30pm 30 minutes before they close. We call ahead to make sure they are open. Sometime some other restaurant close early if they don't have customers. 

We have order the Big Sexy, Carnivore and Raquel. My friend tell me the Raquel is the margarita pizza -  in drink this is favorite order item in the bar. The Carnivore has a lot of meat items. I am meat lover. This is the pizza of my kind. The surprise come from the Big Sexy. The pizza really match the name. It is sexy of the taste, sexy of the look, and sexy to enjoy for this pizza. The taste is sophisticated consider the twist of ingredients that were in it. 

We are thankful that the restaurant open late for us. The service is great may be we hit the right time. We got 10% off the large pizza with yelp check in.

I dedicates this review to my Yelp elite friend that just past this year. I have bookmark this place due Mike review a year ago. I finally have a chance to visit and this place find it very affordable. This review for Mike M and Arlene. 

I know the restaurant is very close to my badminton gym. However, I was not able to visit after or before the games. I have to make a special trip for this restaurant. When arrive at this restaurant at 4:45, I was thinking we must be the first customer for the early arrival. I was surprised there were so many car in front already. Either I am really late or this is a popular place. Soon enough we founded out the early bird started from 2 to 5 pm daily. We beat the clock with 3 minutes to spare for the early bird. The early bird menu entrees are less than $9 except the steak dish for $14. What a steal. The people who dine there average age are at least 10 year older than me. I am just a young chicken when I was among them. 

We have ordered the coco loco tilapia and stuffed tilapia. Then we look at their regular menu, we have order the Rockefeller oyster of six for $9. I also spot a before 6 pm margarita for $3. Our total include tax an tip is less than $35. Wow. This food may not excited you but it had a awesome value. Oysters is great when came out from the grilled. Love it. I like the shredder coconut on the tilapia. It come with two side. The stuff tilapia is not bad at all. Although it do not have the wow factor, it is fresh and good. 

The margarita has full loaded alcohol. Usually if I got the discounted margarita, I fell dilute juice at the last melt drink. But the margarita here is strong. I will come to check them again since my wife also like it.

My favorite sandwich chain store. Definitely a Jersey taste. It is fresh, healthy, and good taste. I have been to many Jersey Mike sandwich stores include this one and they are not disappoint me. 

As usual, I order something that most of the sandwich store do not have items. Only Jersey Mike has it. The capacola ham with bacon, lecture, tomato and Mike way. Mike way is oil, spice, red vinegar, and pepper. The ham is spicy ham with a minor kick on it. I like it this way. 

The sandwich is prepared to my order. When you paid, set up phone number account with them. You can collect point along the way for a free sandwich in the future. I like their sweet tea which has the southern sweet. The combo include drink and chip. They also has hot sub such as the philly cheese steak.

Nordstrom is one of the high end departments store. Time to time they have sales item that is worth a look. The service is very attentive because you can sale person everywhere. The lay out is comfortable display with space to roam. Not like other store with shoulder to shoulder condition when we have a lot of customers. 

Their designer collection cloth is beautiful but in high prices range if you choose the designing clothes. They have online section you you want to shop at home. The store also has restaurant if you decided to shop here and dine here.

Mother day all the Tijuana Flat give free meal to all mother who visited. My child mom also got one free meal. This business model actually work and got many visitors of the night. It actually very thoughtful and they actually advertise their brand. Most of the family come to celebrate mother day at least 3 to 4 in a group. Some is more and actually bring business to the restaurant. 

I have order the steak quesadilla with cheese only. No veggies. My wife have the steak chimichanga. Did you notice their steak is good quality. Not tendon at all. Food was cool to right temperature with the cheese melt inside the quesadilla. If they have the steak grilled, I think they will attract more customers with correct marinated grilled steak. 

Overall. They are good food. Service is excellent. I did not try the grilled Mahi. May be next time.

I saw so many has post about the French Toast. As a result, we have ordered one to try. The toast is soft. Although they are all yellow out cover with scramble egg, I still cannot feel to much egg on the toast compare to the one I cook by my own. 

We ordered a piece of the Pistachio cherry Tart. We were debate to get this tart or the Apricot Flan. We were glad have tart. It has rich enough pistachio top with cherry. It is one of the best tart I have and it is special. 

I have the Egg Benedict for my close up. It come with choice of bacon or ham. I have pick the bacon. This is the best dish among the selection. The egg yolks is liquidity and the egg white just like jello. Now you know you have a good porch egg. 

The service is good, but our waiter for get our water initially. After that, the rest is on track.

Following Rachel many questions to the store clerk. I decided to take a picture of their menu for Rachel to study. It may require a PHD sturdy since they have ton of combination and topping selection. You think you have it all, not quite. As a statistical saying, I begin my quest with one Boba combination tonight. It is impossible and a tall task to try them all. 

I have been to many boba places; this place is the faster from order to deliver. May be they use the industry ice shave machine. No matter what, they are quick to deliver. The location is very tactical to be close to USF to attract students. The pricing is affordable compare to many Boba place. Tonight I have the Mango Snow with Boba. The boba cooks very soft. The mango snow is fruitier flavor. Many place you can feel the artificial fruit flavor but this place improve it to good tasting.  

Overall, I like their menu. A lot of speciality to try, fast service. One good trick, go there at 9 pm and sit out outside. Wait for the summer Bush Garden firework and enjoy a cup of boba. Cannot bit that with free firework with boba.

This is very nice hotel. Constantly is book for wedding, special anniversary celebration or meeting. They have the inside or outside gathering location for your choice. Include private garden for your outdoor for special function. 

The waterfall pool is beautiful and private at the hotel location. Many people has stay in this hotel due to access convenient. It get right to the Vinoy park that have many function such as art festival or blue festival. 

Every month they have special event with live music at their front court yard. Sometime is very interesting. The interior decoration is amazing. It has nice restaurant and bar. I would said this is a classic hotel in the heart of St. Pete. Easy walk to any restaurant of your choice.

Datz has few thing on their sleeve that attract the customer to come back. We were here at the Wednesday night, the place still pack at 9 pm. We have group of Yelpers gather here that night. The place is jam packed. 

Datz label themselves as a pokegym. You can score point for your team when you check in here for Pokemon catch. 

I have the beer with nitro  (forgot what name) and the Pork Shank Redemption. The beer come with right temperature not too chill but cold enough. The meal come out about correct timing. My dish is huge. It is a big Shank and decorated the Rosemary on top of the bone. It was braise properly with maple bourbon glaze out side. Very tasty on the exterior of the meat. Ii accompanied with the mash potatoes that make this dish filling. 

We have good time there,  food is good, service is good. Close out and paid bill is quick.

I was surprised the chef of this restaurant has some skill for handling the material. The foods are delicious to my standard. The live band is performed at their front porch at the week end. 

We have order the Escargot Bourguignon, Porch Bouillabaisse and the Plain Ole Steak with au Poivre sauce. The escargot is a bit small size but it is still a very good deal. We got it for $5 happy hour. It came with aluminum six spots mold. The flavor of the herb and butter sauce did mix well with the escargot. We dip the bread into the butter sauce and it is delicious. 

My wife has the Porch Bouillabaisse with mixed seafood. It is sauté with white wine, olive oil and clam broth. Mmmm good. It also comes with penne pasta with the broth. My steak entree come with mash potato and sautéed squash. The au Poivre sauce is brandy cream sauce with mushroom. The brandy adds the enhancement and sweetens the sauce and brown the mushroom. It is very very good. The steak is the top Sirlion season with kosher salt and fresh ground pepper. It makes the exterior of the meat crispy. The steak company very well with the au Poivre sauce. The steak is well pick from the market and they are very tender. 

The restaurant certainly has the food with good pricing. The only thing they really need to improve is the interior. The table, chair, lamp, and interior need to have makeover. They are too old and some table side is sticky. The food is 5 stars but the interior only allow me to award 4 stars.

Great chicken with mojo marinated sauce. I always like Pollo Tropical chicken. The chicken is marinated through and through. The season spice when into the chicken deep inside. I love the skin with rich mojo spice. It was so good. 

Sometime they run special item such as Tropichop. First step pick your meat - mojo pork, chicken pincho, Calypso Beef. Then add your base such as rice, lettuce or yellow rice. Then top with type of veggie, then added your sauce. Sound easy. This special is running now. I would go for typical grilled chicken with mojo spice. 

We have good coupon two order for $10. Can beat it. The salsa and spicy sauce can be pick up on the sauce island. In fortunately there was no Pollo Tropical in new Tampa area. I have travel far to get it if I am craving for it.

My friends want to have clean diet lunch near the USF area. I was able to locate one since I have been to the first watch near USF. 

My friend is a picky eater and he is not a vegan but he watches his diet carefully. It is challenging when one of your group people want a clean diet food. I only can think a few choices. We are great able to accommodate his need. I saw the first thing he has order is the kale tonic. It is kale, cucumber, lemon and Fuji Apple. Very healthy. No sugar added. The trick is always adding some type of fruit to sweeten it up. In this case is Fuji Apple. The lemon is to add the twist of the taste. Nice touch. 

This afternoon I have the smoke Salmon and Roasted Vegetable Frittata. It has the roasted shallots and tomatoes in the egg that create the sensation of the taste. Good touch. It also has some chive in there to enhance the taste. It serves with ciabatta toast and sweet jam. 

We have 5 people in our group but we are in and out the restaurant in 45 minutes. They are well prepare for the lunch crowd since their lunch time is short.

It is another good BBQ in Hillsborough County. This one located north of Mango. I like them because they have several good things happen to my visit. It is a food truck on the corner of CR 579 and US 92 Northwest corner. 

This smoke BBQ has smoke mullet. Their smoke mullet maintaining juicy condition and easy to pick the whole fish meat. Because the debone most of the fish. We also got their smoke brisket sandwich. It is good marinated. I like the carry a bit fat to beautify the entire taste. 

We got smoke rib which is also has meat fall off the bone. Easy to eat. The smoke chicken maintains it juicy meat. I have been to many smoke place but the meat is to dry. This place did a good job to keep the meat juicy. 

The side turkey rice is my favorite. The wait is a bit long. But I don't mind.

Solid four stars restaurant due to value, taste and unique. It is a fast food. No they are cool to your order. The food is good middle eastern food.  We have order the mix grill and tilapia pita. 

A lot people like to have the take out because it is easy. The only bad part I can find is the ventilation inside the restaurant. It need to ventilate more to keep the food smell out. 

Now the the good part. The mixed grill is delicious. Lamb and chicken are grilled better here. The juice and moisture of the food is kept inside. That is the different between them and most of the middle eastern food. 

The grilled tilapia is tasty. It has a lot of fish inside the pita. All this food come with the side of you choice. The pita is one choice and the mix plater is two choice. It is good experience here since the people are friendly.

I found this restaurant expensive for dinners. The dinner for two with drink, entrée, and appetizer is about $90. As the price is high the expectations also high. 

The entrance of the restaurant is somewhat unique. It is a side hallway entrance to the courtyard and host greet you there. This restaurant was book fully at night and we decided to sit at the bar. 

We started with chicken liver crostini. The liver was made into paste and spread over grilled toast. I like this dish because it is so southern. It was drizzle with dandelion vinegar. It add the taste to the liver. 

Our entrées are the seared hunger steak and the LA shrimp and little neck clam. The seafood dish is good. But the hunger steak is a bit too vinegary. I like the yellow split pea purée. The steak was well medium rare. Very good. The steak dish all is good but the taste or sauce is not impressive. 

Overall is good. The food come out in the right time. Not much to wait.

Bulla open door front basically is inviting setting for the prime Soho area. The bar setting is just like that. The bar area is busy. It is full of customers with one bar tender during weekday. I have waited at the bar area and not get my turn to serve and walk to the host to get a table to sit since sit down area has less people. It only happen at 6 pm that bar is more customers than the dining hall. 

I got the Churrasco for my main dish. This dish come with Mahon Cheese Grit at the bed and top with sautéed veggies on top with the skirt steak in the middle. This is one way they presented. I would separate all three items instead of lay them over each other. This way I can taste different taste. This is a good dish to recommend. I also got the churro at the end with caramel and chocolate dipping sauce. The chef here has good skill for the Churrasco made the meat tender. 

This is about 3.5 stars restaurant to my book. A few thing they can improve on. Since they have open air entrance, there is a lot food flight in the restaurant. It border me while I am eating. The bar area is too busy for just one person. May be need to look at how to improve the bar area when it is 80% capacity.

Casa Tina is a unique restaurant located in downtown Dunedin. I have not try their food yet but I do love like the mixed drink here. 

The restaurant has the nice decorations. It has a lot to look at includes the different design of the crucifix cross. They also has painting, art craving, wall mirrors and Mexican art. The also have the areal performance art sometime. So go enjoy it. 

The bar has different type of the tequilas to mix in the margarita. They also has different year selection of tequilas with longer the year and less hangover. 

You always can get a fruit juice mixed with tequila to create your own drink. My friend said that the food average, one day I will try it myself. The seating has the bar seat, booth, table or you can select the more comfortable seat at the couch. 

Overall they are good. One thing they can improve is to have larger the mixed drink menu selection.

This first time I have PF Chang as lunch. My previous visits mainly dinner time. They have the lunch menu which is different than the dinner. I like the dinner choices of dish. But the lunch menu offer something I have not try before. Our visit to mall give us the chance to visit the restaurant. 

The space of the restaurant is nice and open. During the pandemic we were able to seat six feet apart. We order the fried we have shrimp hand made dumplings. They offer two types of finishes. You can choose the dumplings by steam or pan fried. I have not have a pan fried shrimp dumplings. We actually like the pan fried a lot. 

We also got the northern style pork spare rib. This is another dish we don't have before. The rib marinated by dry rub spice. It was tender and off the bone. Good technique. 

Overall our time there was very good. Lunch is way to go.

This Carrabba's do not open for lunch except weekend. In Temple Terrace, there are a lot of retirements people live nearby and they go to dinner early. As a result, the restaurant fills up quick before the actual dinner time. The best way is eat early or later. 

I have been to this restaurant many times. They have run many special for introduce the new dishes. Tonight we are here for new dish for special price promotion. The dish is prosciutto wrap pork lion special for $10.90. Regular price is $14.49. The dish is pork loin wrap by prosciutto and top with sweet red wine sauce. It also comes with choice of pasta or veggie. We choose the angel hair pasta with garlic olive oil. The dish is great and well balance. I can say that I order that dish again if I come back. The entree comes with soup. I have chosen the Sicilian Chicken Soup. 

Overall, our experience here is great and the service is on point.

This is a drive through coffee shop. You expect long car line during popular time such as after lunch hour, morning, some mid afternoon. The only improvement is they take order while you on the line. This will speed up the wait. All coffee will need order and make. We got the expresso toasted mush mellow as topping. The shake has good ice. 

Drink is good. If they can use two percent milk is better. My wife got the Yoguccino shake. This is yogurt, ice cream and coffee. This interesting mixed. In addition we also add the lavender flavor into it. 

Basically you can order a drink that no one have the flavor mixologist. It is base own your combine request. They also has the Italian soda which you can do the same thing.

This new location definitely have a lot of room for customers. Many customers are happy to have the bigger place than the original store. However one challenge is how you fill the restaurant in this remote area. It not close to university, major metropolitan area, at smaller sub division. 

I can said that their tamales is getting better. We order a to go tamale but it is still taste very good at home. We have try their shrimp, fish and lengua taco. My wife like the lengua because they have prepared it to very soft easy to bite. For me, I think they need to pan fried one more time with spice to make it interesting to paid for the price. I don't like the fish taco which the fish is fried. I prefer it grill since this is high pricing taco. I like shrimp the best. It is definitely worth the money. 

This is cafeteria style order at the counter. But the tip on the checkout ask medium to high percentage choice or custom tip. I really see the point if I walk to order for high tip situation.

This express place have some good wings. Other than wing, they also have the smoothie and combo of other comfort food. The comfort food include gyro, chicken sandwich, Philly cheese steak, cheeseburger, fried oyster. 

The selection of smoothie include mango banana, strawberry, berries and more. I like their mango smoothie. It refreshing during the summer season. 

The chicken wing include wet and dry coating. I like their Parmesan and lemon pepper dry chicken wing. I am not a wet coating wing guys. If you buy six wing is about a dollar a piece. If you buy 10 wing is $0.80 a piece. The cheapest is 100 wing with $0.75 a piece. 

Their side include fried mushroom, fried okra, Conch fritter and more. Although they call themselves wing express, you still need to give them time to cook. But the wing is crispy and good.

New name under new change. The menu also change from previous Thai restaurant that was here. I kind miss the old restaurant. But I welcome the new restaurant. I think the menu getting larger. More choices. I like they have some signature dish is very intriguing. The dish included Tornado Soft Shell Crab, Chu Chee Duck, Siam Chicken, Nuah Nam Tom, Yum Seafood. This are some good dishes listed. 

We have order the day special with soft shell crab and the Chu Chee Duck. Because they are still new in the area, the material of the food is very good quality and big. The soft shell crab come in two pieces with size larger than palm of my hand. The sauce is a bit sweet. 

The duck was fried and top with Chu Chee curry sauce. The kaffir lime leaves has good flavor. The duck was deboned. It come with good amount of pieces. It is "A" on ingredients.

Irish bar and eatery. May a leprechaun there. Let me know if you spot one. Please find the pot of gold too. 

James Joyce may be derived from famous persons in Ireland. But they do build a good bar at YBOR. We arrive at 6 pm and it is already some patrons already there for a glass of beer. Their tap include local, German , Irish beer. But the special of the day actually drawn us here today. It is very hard to find local restaurants serve broil live Crawfish. But this pub serve this dish. If you buy two beers, the Crawfish is $6.95. It is a deal. My wife went for the order and I enjoy the two beers. 

I have the Carlsberg and the IPA. Both are good draft beer.  I have the Guinness Beef Stew and the the Scott Egg. The beef stew cook with Guinness Stout as one of the ingredients. The stew is delicious Ireland comfort food. The Scott Egg is amazing. It coat with ground sausage outwardly. Very interesting. 

We enjoy our time there. Interesting bar.

Dunn River Fall and Park is a beautiful place in the northern Jamaica. The cascade of falls is the main attraction. This restaurant name after the beautiful place does represent the food and native cuisine. The restaurant has a lot seating and a stage for special events. Time to time they have special music event.
