I am surprised they did not receive high mark. This may be the service is slow. Other than that. They are 5 stars to my book. The price of the food is very reasonable. You have to understand stand why they successful is because their good Island spice marinated to the meat. 

I got jerk chicken that only cost $9. The chicken is marinated to the bone. Their spice is different than most of the Jamaican restaurant. This is their uniqueness. The lunch special during the weekdays is less than $6. They have good oxtail and jerk shrimp. Please check out their website for musical show.

This is the Krispy Creme that I have been visited frequently since the New Tampa location close many years ago. They have conveyor belt type of making the donuts in massive volume. The light for hot is almost lighted every time. Which mean they has fresh made donuts. 

They have many types of donuts. But the one I like is the sugar donut. Not event the glaze donut. When they have the hot donut or freshly made donut, I like to ask them get them from the conveyor belt. Sometimes I ask for naked donut. I will at sugar crystal by myself. 

During national donut day, this donut is free with one donut per person. Parking is not the most in this area. Very limited space. But drive through is available. They don't accept tip since there is camera behind the counter. Some one is monitor the employee behavior.

We have been to this bakery numerous time but none were at their anniversary. We finally came to their 105 year Anniversary celebration with rolling back 1912 price and item. It definitely a great success story for a store that has such history. I hope they can go for another 100 years. 

We got the coconut macaroons, eclairs, brownie, and devil crab. The roll back price was very attractive. Many item very affordable. The total we paid is less than $6. I cannot believe it. I like everything we got. The coconut was moist. The brownies are delicious. Sometimes you can get not fresh devil crab. But not in this place. The crab cake was perfect and not smelly. Have a lot of crab meat. Eclair is a sticky situation. It is slimy and sticky good. 

I alway like their Cuban pastry. Since it is anniversary celebration, I stay with their roll back item.  There were some other items we didn't get. But we did regret we did not get enough of the coconut macaroons. The celebration ballon and people line up make this event very festive.

Good restaurant. They have promising future. This restaurant is about 4.5 stars in my book. Not yet 5 stars. They have 5 dollar pho night. Service is good and attentive. We were here and find out many people waiting on the line try to get in. Very popular place. We were lucky to have two seat at the bar when two other just leaving. 

I read all my friend review. Many have visited them a year or two years ago. You can see the most drop of the star is due to service. During our visit, the service is perfect and you can see improvement. The reason they are four stars now is their regular price is a bit in the high side in compare to many Vietnamese restaurant. That is the main reason not round up to 5 stars. 

Food. The restaurant has good beef noodle soup. The sou is the best to my expectations in Bay Area. The papaya salad is one of the best. We also order the crispy duck and papaya tiger shrimp fresh roll. Their roll only come in one compare to many Vietnamese restaurant. But their roll is a lot bigger than other place to make up two quantities. 

My experience is good. I will visit them when they have five dollars deal.

After big explosion of opening, now the slow down is make sense if they worth for shop. Base of my opinion, they are more excited than the grocery next door. They have some organic produce offer. I like the ready to go and cook items. The seasoned meat and fish is easy to be selected and ready to cook. Is is easy for house wife to plan the meal of the day. 

I got the JC Pie Pop ice cream. This item on sale and it is non GMO ingredients ice cream. Good flavor. I also have some hard crust almond for my movie night. The organic item included the fruits and veggies with timing sprinkle to keep the veggies moisture to the fresh. They also have the precut veggies ready to cook at home. Same some processing time. 

Their organic juice or power juice are expensive for small bottles. Check is no line since it was 30 minutes to closed.

If you looking for good craft coffee and you have not have a lot of coffee budget, this is your place. I always advocate that our country cup of coffee is too expensive. It is about 400 percent profit. Especially for those big chain coffee shop. This local own coffee place is just the right price. 

I have never seen food truck sell coffee and tea only until today. The coffee is great taste since they are fresh brew. If you need caffeine badly, you can go with espresso with double shot. They have cold brew and americano coffee. They also cafe con leche. The best part is to add the flavor into coffee. They have one flavor rarely seen. Lavender flavor. I would recommend that with fragrance smell. Other flavors include caramel, vanilla, hazelnut, mocha. 

The tea includes chai latte, mango fruit tea, London fog, mocha ice tea and more. I would stop here again for coffee.

Great restaurant to be at Tampa Palm. We need restaurant like this in our area. I understand why many people visit this place. It is for good taste, ingredients conscious healthy living, good price. Ciccio do have all the qualities above. 

We order three items to share. The first is the daily special island poke. This dish has seared rare tuna, blacken pineapple, edamame, mango over the sticky rice. Nice combination with sweet ginger sauce. It is good dish. The only thing I don't like is chop up seared Tuna. I will prefer is slice and better presentation with slice. 

Our second dish is Thai Grilled Steak Bowl. It has lettuce, cilantro, mango, carrots, fried wonton skin. I like the grilled steak. I don't like the hard raw carrot. It doesn't go with the dish. 

Our third dish is Spicy Thai chicken. I like this dish because it has mushrooms and stir fried noodle. The stir fried is good. Although it is American style but is still quite good.

The cheaper gas in Carrollwood. This Thorntons is not easy to access if you are on opposite site of Linebaugh. Since there is no left turn, you have to go straight and make a u-turn. This may be the reason they are 4 cents cheaper than most gas station around there. 

They have 20 pumps for gas. So there not much of waiting. There is plenty of room to maneuver you car around the pump station. The convenience store has hotdog, cold or hot drinks, quick snack and more. The outside of the building has security camera in case anything happens around the pump stations.

During the Yelp restaurant week, this restaurant is top of my list to visit. It was great incentive to visit the restaurant during the Yelp Restaurants Week. The place is trendy. This is my first dinner to actually eat at David Island. 

We have Pollo Al Forno w/ Lemons and Pollo Margherita. The Pollo Al Forno w/ Lemons is roast chicken with Italian herb. When the menu said with lemon, it actually with lemon Italian tomato base sauce. If I know it ahead I may change my mind because I don't like sour food. Nonetheless, the chicken is great. I think the potatoes can be smaller pieces for all the herb. The chicken Margherita was a great dish. It has all bell and whistle for the farm to table item. The chicken is pounded and breaded with right crust. It sauce is amazing. I would definitely go for this dish. Very pleasant to enjoy this dish. 

The service is great. The only thing for the restaurant is not much choice on the protein side. Only chicken, sausage, meat ball. It will be difficult to grab hold on the the customers to visit from out side of David Island. Don't get me wrong, this is good restaurant.

We were curious after Whole Food bought by Amazon if the grocery store lowered their price. The price of the food are still remains the same. This store location is some what unique because it located in mall compound but not link to mall interior way. 

I found the cotton candy grape here. The cotton candy grape is $4 a pound. The food here is high grade. I like ready to cook food at the meat area. Many choices of marinated meat either ready to grilled or cook.  I found lion fish for sales. There are many smoke fish including salmon Keta candy, hot smoke lion fish, smoke garlic herb sea bass, smoke shrimp. Those look good. 

The cheese section is amazing and plenty of good cheese to select. They dry noodle by bulk which is convenient for small portions meal. The hot deli section is huge. It is good by pound. I got two pieces of chimichurri steak. I like mochi section that you can pick up by pieces. This is something new to me.

This is the second Moonlight in the Pinellas Park. They open less than a month. The have the buy one get the second drink for 50% off until end of August. Not much time left for the promotion. 

The new Moonlight is about the same size of the first one. They several seating area. Only two people working on the drink. You may have to wait if the line in front of you have large order. They also serve finger food and simple meal plate for hot food. 

I got two smoothies with boba. The smoothies is $4.5 each and added boba is $0.59. Event with 50% off, I have to paid $8. I got the lavender and the taro smoothies with honey boba. The drinks are very nicely made. The boba amount is good quantity not the huge quantity. May be $0.59 for added on is a bit steep.

The bakery items here is good. I would said is about 3.5 stars for many Latin bakeries that I have been to. Don't come before the closing time because many hot items sold out.

Their popular items are devil crab, empanadas, stuff potatoes, meat pie, chorizo rolls, and sausage rolls. These items is $2.49 or $2.99 each. They also serve sandwiches including Cuban sandwich. The coffee includes cafe conleche, expresso, cappuccino, mocha, flavor latte. All these drinks are good. 

Breakfast can found here. As cheaper as Cuban toast to breakfast bowl. The breakfast bowl has 3 eggs, 2 meats and 2 veggies. There is plenty to share. I got the coconut turnover and coconut macaroons. The pastry is fresh and crunchy. Price is above the average in the Bay Area. Other than that. All is good.

This is my second time back to the grocery store and my first review. 80% of the store is the grocery store. If you like some Pinoy cuisine ingredients, look no further. You can get it here. 

I am here actually for their 20% of store space. They have back alley kitchen restaurant. They do have two tables. I got the lechon and halo-halo. Unfortunately the lechon grill is not what I imagine roast pig. But is similar to Chinese crispy pork. However I like their dipping sauce. The brown sweet sauce is complimented the crispy pork. 

The halo-halo is definitely an item to have. They have many ingredients below with ice cream on top. Great drink for summer. Sweet and savory. I like their purple grain. It is enjoyable bite in the drink. 

One thing to improve is the store only one person. When you have long line in front of you might as well go to other restaurant. Because the wait is long. For my next visit, I like to try their Daing Fish fried.

I like this bay looking restaurant. It is on the water. They have plenty of waiter and waitress. The time we have visited were Sunday lunch time at 11:00 am. It is a bit cold seat at the outside next to water for December. This is our first restaurant for progressive lunch. 

I got the grilled grouper sandwich with pretzels bun. The side we have the coconut rice. It was great. The grouper is fresh. They do give good pieces of grouper. We also has the lobster roll with sweet potatoes. The sweet potatoes were crunchy. The lobster is chunky and has less mayonnaise which show more lobster meat in the rolls. I like this way better. 

Our service is good. Food come out quick. We were able to finish our meal and paid less than 50 minutes.

New poke place near channelside. It is at the lower floor of the apartments complex. The parking can select the parking garage. The visitors parking is free. You may have to take the elevator of the residential apartment to downstairs since the parking is at third floor. 

We were there at the grand opening. They do have celebrations on the grand opening. It I has the prize drawing for the visit. It also has special on the poke. I got the two protein bowl. The protein includes shrimp, spicy tuna, ahi tuna, salmon, tofu and more I got the ahi tuna and shrimp. The add in has a lot option. They also have the up charge item such as avocado. 

The poke is right quantity. It is good for enough for a hungry person. It has a lot choices. I like they mixed sauce and poke then add to the meat.

It is about 3.5 stars restaurant. The food is simple. Nothing special. However, the price is reasonable. Especially for dinner. This newly open restaurant has open seating and contemporary design interior. It is pleasant to visit. 

The restaurant does not provide any bread or pre-meal items compared to many Italian restaurants nearby. It may be due to their reasonable price. We got the Vongole pasta. It come with seven clams, spaghetti with white wine and garlic clam sauce. Hint, I did not feel much of wine sauce. I like this dish because it is light. Great for older customers who don't like heavy sodium or sauce. The second dish we have is the Lemon Butter Salmon. This dish has pan sear salmon. Again, it is very light. 

We feel the dish is very much we can prepare ourselves. Nothing special. The reasonable price make up the worth of visit.

Just like to agree with the rest of Yelper. 4 stars. It is good to have their weekday specials. It is $3.95 a roll. The special is about six pieces per roll. They also has the weekend special for 50% off on the second roll. The week end special are specialty roll. 

The decorations of the restaurant is contemporary. I would give them a good effort for the bathroom details. During the lunch time, not too many people. We order the spicy tuna, spicy yellow tails, spicy scallops, Tampa roll, eel avocado, and the Boston roll. The food is good. The spicy scallops has the most tasty flavor. 

Food is fresh. It take 15 minutes for six roll to make. The important is the rice. They do have the right ideal about the rice seasoning. It right amount of rice. Close out is good.

Very close to 4.5 stars restaurant. I would said they are good enough in this area. In fact, they are better than most of the Japanese restaurant which serves by non Japanese chef. I believe many enjoy the food once they have the sashimi. 

Restaurant is kind of tuck away in the plaza. Not visible to the Main Street. We got bento box special and the Arizona roll. We are kind of in hurry for a movie but we didn't tell them so. However, the speed of the serving, we were able to finish at 35 minutes. 

I like my bento box. It has sashimi, sushi, California roll, goyoza, teriyaki chicken, tempura shrimp and veggies. Accompanying with salad and soup. I like the way they prepared the sashimi. The fish was glazed with sesame oil. Nice touch. The temperature is crispy and evenly spread of flour. I like they special made goyoza. The infill include meat and scallions. Very nice. All fish is in good size. 

Overall very good experience.

Solid 4 stars. Very close to 4.5 stars. If they have more creative side, they probably 5 stars. This take out BBQ place is Riverview jewels. Many come here for the pickup food. The peach cobbler should not be miss. This is the item I recommend. 

We have the family meal deal with three meat types and 3 sides and a peach cobbler as a deal. The meat are ribs, chicken and pulled pork. The best is the rib. I like the way the have the rib with seasoning stick to the surface. The sons is the chicken. The sides we have is the yellow rice, garlic potatoes and collard greens. The best is the garlic potatoes. 

The deal is good for $25. It is in good quantity. The wait is good to order on side. Many call in. The smoke house just right outside.

This food truck located a the empty land. The entrance is from Old SR 54 not the Wesley Chapel Blvd.  the map may take you at non entrance way. They do have pepinos, patacone, cachapa and more. Is is Venezuelan food. Price is at the high side. 

I got the carne mechada (shredded beef). It look beautiful. The beef is a lot. I also like the fried patacone. It was crispy. The Venezuelan cheese is delicious. The sauce was well made. 

From order to finish is about 10 minutes. I don't mind the wait to get the freshly fried patacone.

Cinco De Mayo weekend, our office pick this restaurant to have the lunch before the week is over. This restaurant is hidden at temple terrace in a small plaza. If I don't have yelp, I would not have found it. 

They have $5 lunch special and margarita special. I have order one margarita and it come with 32 oz glass. Giant glass!!! It almost cannot fit my face. I have asked the help from my friend to take a sip. 

I have ordered the steak quesadilla, it come with lettuce and tomato. The steak is stir fried in flour taco. It is decent. Taste is good. I have added a dessert at the end with fried dough with cinnamon, powder sugar and honey. 

Service is friendly, food came out fast, the atmosphere is great. This is about 3.5 stars restaurant. Please check them out. Definitely a very budget lunch.

Kao Thai is in my bookmark for a while. Finally I have a chance to visit the restaurant. The restaurant is well decorated. I like the clothing napkin setup on the table like bold tide. They have different menu. One is their regular menu and the other is the Thai street food menu. 

We Thee dishes from the Thai Street Menu. The first dish is the Yum Nam Kao Tod. This is salad dish with sausage, crispy curry rice that fried, peanut. To me, this dish is salty and sour to be eat along. The second dish is Hoy Tod. It s a mussels egg pancake and bean sprouts. It come with the dipping sweet chilies sauce. I like this dish. The third dish is my favorite. Kao Kook Ka Pi. This dish has seven combination items in one dish. The item I like the most is shrimp paste fried rice. I have this as Malay dish. But they carry it. This is the first I have in Tampa Bay. The dish also includes the caramelize pork belly, Thai sweet sausage, egg, onion, apple and string bean. It is well presented. 

Overall our experience is good. I really want to come back to try their main menu dish. This restaurant is about 4.5 stars since each dish is well decorated.

For the BBQ they are about middle of the pack in Tampa. Their combo compare to many place they are right portion not the generous portion. 

We got the combo package with collard greens and sweet corn as side. The main meat is the hog feed and the rib and brisket. The hog feed is the pull pork. I think the rib is better. Brisket is just good. We also got the pork sandwich. Their food is good but not to jump out the seat. 

Price is a bit in the expensive side. May be create something attractive to the side items will attract more business. I do like the choice of the sauce. We got the mango sauce and the guava sauce. It is interesting.

This is the restaurant we have visited sometime ago and finally I have sometime to write about it. Havana 86 is the restaurant may be open during pandemic. We visited two months ago. I like the restaurant because it has good Cuban cuisine. Especially this area has already many Cuban restaurants close. I am happy they open their door. 

We started with Tostones Rellenos - stuff fried green plantain. We got the stuffing at lobster. It comes with 5 pieces and delicious to share. For the main course, we have Vaca Frita and Churrasco ala Cubana. The vaca frita can be a little crispy by pan grilled longer. The skirt steak is delicious. 

Overall the food is good. It is close to 4.5 stars. Price is affordable. Hopefully they keep it this way. Service is ok nothing jump out.

It is about 3.5 stars. The lobster is definitely better quality than most lobster roll I have. They do have body meat not like most restaurants mainly crawl meat and the body sold to other dish. The preparation is butter lobster. I actually like this way better because you can taste the freshness of the lobster. 

They have three different size of the roll. 2 oz to 4 oz selection. You also go to mega roll foot long with 10oz to share. They also has the lobster fried or Macaroni to try. Other than lobster, hot, burger, fish sandwich also available. 

The truck just park outside. You can order the inside the brewery and they will give you a wait table. Food is great. I would said a good lobster roll in Tampa. I would suggest at least 3 oz roll.

A good barrier island food off the Pinellas county gulf coast. Rick is look like back to normal after pandemic. The customer come back to enjoy the mixed cocktails and food. It is St. Pete beach area restaurant. I pick this place after my visit to my project. 

I order the grilled grouper sandwich. It come with the side. And I got the deep corn on the cob. I have not have a deep fried corn in Florida. I have deep fried corn once at New Orlean. The corn is very delicious. I recommend this side order if you come here. The outward of the corn has apply a layer of salty coating. It match the corn sweetness. The grouper is fresh. Seem like fresh catch of the day. My friend has a he shrimp pasta. He like it and finish the entire bowl. 

Overall the service is good. I did not try their cocktails. But the food is good and has some unique item.

There are so many poke place pop up lately. This is second poke island I have seen. I like it particularly is their choices of the protein. They have something that other poke place do not offer. The protein has eel, Tempura shrimp, tomago, squid. These items is not normally serve. 

They have served a Yummy sauce which is spicy sesame is lovely. Mixed it with eel and poke sauce will make this perfect. I would said one part of yummy and poke sauce and two part of eel sauce is the way I like it. It you don't want it sweet, just use one part of eel sauce. I like the way they have the sauce on the rice first then pile all ingredients and sauce on the top. To make better, I would suggest sauce and ingredients mixed and put over rice. Then topping. This will increase the best taste. 

Price is good. But more protein did not mean you get more food. I would suggest that more protein with more food.

Flames Indian Restaurant is one of the up coming Indian cuisine at south Tampa. The cuisine does tone down a bit for the local American. It is still maintained a good spice mixture that represents the Indian cuisine. The decorations of the restaurant is nice. While we eating there, there are some local come to pickup the take out. 

We have the Phatthar Gosht Ka Saalan. It is a lamb dish from Hyderabadi Cuisine. This dish to me the spice is enough. However I think missing the heat of the spiciness. It has s still delicious. 

I like the most is the Chicken Chettinad. It is a classic chettinad dish with great flavor. I like the sophisticated of the spice. It is great dish to go with rice. 

Both dishes is good. Portion is a bit small. Service at the restaurant is good. If you not use to the spicy Indian foods, this may be a good choice. They do have good taste.

This Bento has great setup among many Bento I have been to. Set up is very nice with indoor or outdoor dining. The elevated outdoor concrete floor serve a very good view and away from the vehicles. 

I have sushi box with yellowtail caliente roll and salmon roll. It come with California roll, goyoza, salad and spicy cucumber pickles. This bento box is fresh and good. The food do improve a lot from old day. My wife have bento box of chicken katsu. The chicken was two flat pieces. It also accompanied with noodle and brown rice. The salad and wonton skin also includes in the box. 

There is not much of service. It is order at the counter and bring a number to your table. Food was delivered by your number.

Very close to 4.5 stars. This restaurant has potential. Newly open. It give good quantity of food. It is upscale fast food with good flavor. Menu is easy understanding. A three step process to select what you want. 

First step is to choose the your entree. This includes burritos, quesadilla, bowl, taco. Next step is to choose your protein, it includes different types of chicken, pork, steak or ground beef, shrimp. Base on type of protein will determine the price of the items. Next step to choose your add on. They have good choices. I got the steak quesadilla. The add on was delicious. It take 10 minutes to prepare my thick quesadilla. It has good cheese. My wife have BBQ pork. The bowl is huge with add on. She like the taste of it. 

Overall I said it is good value for the food we have. I like the good thick quesadilla. Enough steak in it. Good grilled steak.

This is our second stop happy hour restaurant. Malio is restaurant near Curtis Hixon park. If you happen to be there, you may want to check on their happy hour from 3 to 7 pm Tuesday to Friday. Their happy hour food item is great. 

I start with their high west old fashioned. It is a double Rye whiskey. It has some kick into it. Good deal at happy hour. Our selection for the appetizers begins with filet tips it was grilled very well. Good to share with friend. Our next appetizer is Ahi Tuna Tartare. It serve with wonton chip and pickles ginger. Tuna was good. Our last appetizer is the Shrimp Theresa. It is grilled shrimp with ponzu crispy outside. I like this appetizer the best. It come as six pieces. 

Overall we enjoy our time here. Service is good. Parking at the building is $6 if you want to park close. They do have coupons but still need to pay $6 for parking. I think it defeated the coupon.
